40015016	And He said , Are you also even yet dull and ignorant [ without understanding and unable to put things together ] ?
40015017	Do you not see and understand that whatever goes into the mouth passes into the abdomen and so passes on into the place where discharges are deposited ?
40015018	But whatever comes out of the mouth comes from the heart , and this is what makes a man unclean and defiles [ him ] .
40015019	For out of the heart come evil thoughts ( reasonings and disputings and designs ) such as murder , adultery , sexual vice , theft , false witnessing , slander , and irreverent speech .
40015020	These are what make a man unclean and defile [ him ] ; but eating with unwashed hands does not make him unclean or defile [ him ] .
40015021	And going away from there , Jesus withdrew to the district of Tyre and Sidon .
40015022	And behold , a woman who was a Canaanite from that district came out and , with a [ loud , troublesomely urgent ] cry , begged , Have mercy on me , O Lord , Son of David ! My daughter is miserably and distressingly and cruelly possessed by a demon !
40015023	But He did not answer her a word . And His disciples came and implored Him , saying , Send her away , for she is crying out after us .
40015024	He answered , I was sent only to the lost sheep of the house of Israel .
40015025	But she came and , kneeling , worshiped Him and kept praying , Lord , help me !
40015026	And He answered , It is not right ( proper , becoming , or fair ) to take the children’s bread and throw it to the little dogs .
40015027	She said , Yes , Lord , yet even the little pups ( little whelps ) eat the crumbs that fall from their [ young ] masters’ table .
40015028	Then Jesus answered her , O woman , great is your faith ! Be it done for you as you wish . And her daughter was cured from that moment .
40015029	And Jesus went on from there and passed along the shore of the Sea of Galilee . Then He went up into the hills and kept sitting there .
40015030	And a great multitude came to Him , bringing with them the lame , the maimed , the blind , the dumb , and many others , and they put them down at His feet ; and He cured them ,
40015031	So that the crowd was amazed when they saw the dumb speaking , the maimed made whole , the lame walking , and the blind seeing ; and they recognized and praised and thanked and glorified the God of Israel .
40015032	Then Jesus called His disciples to Him and said , I have pity and sympathy and am deeply moved for the crowd , because they have been with Me now three days and they have nothing [ at all left ] to eat ; and I am not willing to send them away hungry , lest they faint or become exhausted on the way .
40015033	And the disciples said to Him , Where are we to get bread sufficient to feed so great a crowd in this isolated and desert place ?
40015034	And Jesus asked them , How many loaves of bread do you have ? They replied , Seven , and a few small fish .
40015035	And ordering the crowd to recline on the ground ,
40015036	He took the seven loaves and the fish , and when He had given thanks , He broke them and gave them to the disciples , and the disciples gave them to the people .
40015037	And they all ate and were satisfied . And they gathered up seven [ large provision ] baskets full of the broken pieces that were left over .
40015038	Those who ate were 4,000 men , not including the women and the children .
40015039	Then He dismissed the crowds , got into the boat , and went to the district of Magadan .
40016001	NOW THE Pharisees and Sadducees came up to Jesus , and they asked Him to show them a sign ( spectacular miracle ) from heaven [ attesting His divine authority ] .
40016002	He replied to them , When it is evening you say , It will be fair weather , for the sky is red ,
40016003	And in the morning , It will be stormy today , for the sky is red and has a gloomy and threatening look . You know how to interpret the appearance of the sky , but you cannot interpret the signs of the times .
40016004	A wicked and morally unfaithful generation craves a sign , but no sign shall be given to it except the sign of the prophet Jonah . Then He left them and went away .
40016005	When the disciples reached the other side of the sea , they found that they had forgotten to bring any bread .
40016006	Jesus said to them , Be careful and on your guard against the leaven ( ferment ) of the Pharisees and Sadducees .
40016007	And they reasoned among themselves about it , saying , It is because we did not bring any bread .
40016008	But Jesus , aware of this , asked , Why are you discussing among yourselves the fact that you have no bread ? O you [ men , how little trust you have in Me , how ] little faith !
40016009	Do you not yet discern ( perceive and understand ) ? Do you not remember the five loaves of the five thousand , and how many [ small hand ] baskets you gathered ?
40016010	Nor the seven loaves for the four thousand , and how many [ large provision ] baskets you took up ?
40016011	How is it that you fail to understand that I was not talking to you about bread ? But beware of the leaven ( ferment ) of the Pharisees and Sadducees .
40016012	Then they discerned that He did not tell them to beware of the leaven of bread , but of the teaching of the Pharisees and Sadducees .
40016013	Now when Jesus went into the region of Caesarea Philippi , He asked His disciples , Who do people say that the Son of Man is ?
40016014	And they answered , Some say John the Baptist ; others say Elijah ; and others Jeremiah or one of the prophets .
40016015	He said to them , But who do you [ yourselves ] say that I am ?
40016016	Simon Peter replied , You are the Christ , the Son of the living God .
40016017	Then Jesus answered him , Blessed ( happy , fortunate , and to be envied ) are you , Simon Bar-Jonah . For flesh and blood [ men ] have not revealed this to you , but My Father Who is in heaven .
40016018	And I tell you , you are Peter [ Greek , Petros -- a large piece of rock ] , and on this rock [ Greek , petra -- a huge rock like Gibraltar ] I will build My church , and the gates of Hades ( the powers of the infernal region ) shall not overpower it [ or be strong to its detriment or hold out against it ] .
40016019	I will give you the keys of the kingdom of heaven ; and whatever you bind ( declare to be improper and unlawful ) on earth must be what is already bound in heaven ; and whatever you loose ( declare lawful ) on earth must be what is already loosed in heaven .
40016020	Then He sternly and strictly charged and warned the disciples to tell no one that He was Jesus the Christ .
40016021	From that time forth Jesus began [ clearly ] to show His disciples that He must go to Jerusalem and suffer many things at the hands of the elders and the high priests and scribes , and be killed , and on the third day be raised from death .
40016022	Then Peter took Him aside to speak to Him privately and began to reprove and charge Him sharply , saying , God forbid , Lord ! This must never happen to You !
40016023	But Jesus turned away from Peter and said to him , Get behind Me , Satan ! You are in My way [ an offense and a hindrance and a snare to Me ] ; for you are minding what partakes not of the nature and quality of God , but of men .
40016024	Then Jesus said to His disciples , If anyone desires to be My disciple , let him deny himself [ disregard , lose sight of , and forget himself and his own interests ] and take up his cross and follow Me [ cleave steadfastly to Me , conform wholly to My example in living and , if need be , in dying , also ] .
40016025	For whoever is bent on saving his [ temporal ] life [ his comfort and security here ] shall lose it [ eternal life ] ; and whoever loses his life [ his comfort and security here ] for My sake shall find it [ life everlasting ] .
40016026	For what will it profit a man if he gains the whole world and forfeits his life [ his blessed life in the kingdom of God ] ? Or what would a man give as an exchange for his [ blessed ] life [ in the kingdom of God ] ?
40016027	For the Son of Man is going to come in the glory ( majesty , splendor ) of His Father with His angels , and then He will render account and reward every man in accordance with what he has done .
40016028	Truly I tell you , there are some standing here who will not taste death before they see the Son of Man coming in ( into ) His kingdom .
40017001	AND SIX days after this , Jesus took with Him Peter and James and John his brother , and led them up on a high mountain by themselves .
40017002	And His appearance underwent a change in their presence ; and His face shone clear and bright like the sun , and His clothing became as white as light .
40017003	And behold , there appeared to them Moses and Elijah , who kept talking with Him .
40017004	Then Peter began to speak and said to Jesus , Lord , it is good and delightful that we are here ; if You approve , I will put up three booths here -- one for You and one for Moses and one for Elijah .
40017005	While he was still speaking , behold , a shining cloud [ composed of light ] overshadowed them , and a voice from the cloud said , This is My Son , My Beloved , with Whom I am [ and have always been ] delighted . Listen to Him !
40017006	When the disciples heard it , they fell on their faces and were seized with alarm and struck with fear .
40017007	But Jesus came and touched them and said , Get up , and do not be afraid .
40017008	And when they raised their eyes , they saw no one but Jesus only .
40017009	And as they were going down the mountain , Jesus cautioned and commanded them , Do not mention to anyone what you have seen , until the Son of Man has been raised from the dead .
40017010	The disciples asked Him , Then why do the scribes say that Elijah must come first ?
40017011	He replied , Elijah does come and will get everything restored and ready .
40017012	But I tell you that Elijah has come already , and they did not know or recognize him , but did to him as they liked . So also the Son of Man is going to be treated and suffer at their hands .
40017013	Then the disciples understood that He spoke to them about John the Baptist .
40017014	And when they approached the multitude , a man came up to Him , kneeling before Him and saying ,
40017015	Lord , do pity and have mercy on my son , for he has epilepsy ( is moonstruck ) and he suffers terribly ; for frequently he falls into the fire and many times into the water .
40017016	And I brought him to Your disciples , and they were not able to cure him .
40017017	And Jesus answered , O you unbelieving ( warped , wayward , rebellious ) and thoroughly perverse generation ! How long am I to remain with you ? How long am I to bear with you ? Bring him here to Me .
40017018	And Jesus rebuked the demon , and it came out of him , and the boy was cured instantly .
40017019	Then the disciples came to Jesus and asked privately , Why could we not drive it out ?
40017020	He said to them , Because of the littleness of your faith [ that is , your lack of firmly relying trust ] . For truly I say to you , if you have faith [ that is living ] like a grain of mustard seed , you can say to this mountain , Move from here to yonder place , and it will move ; and nothing will be impossible to you .
40017021	But this kind does not go out except by prayer and fasting .
40017022	When they were going about here and there in Galilee , Jesus said to them , The Son of Man is going to be turned over into the hands of men .
40017023	And they will kill Him , and He will be raised [ to life ] again on the third day . And they were deeply and exceedingly grieved and distressed .
40017024	When they arrived in Capernaum , the collectors of the half shekel [ the temple tax ] went up to Peter and said , Does not your Teacher pay the half shekel ?
40017025	He answered , Yes . And when he came home , Jesus spoke to him [ about it ] first , saying , What do you think , Simon ? From whom do earthly rulers collect duties or tribute -- from their own sons or from others not of their own family ?
40017026	And when Peter said , From other people not of their own family , Jesus said to him , Then the sons are exempt .
40017027	However , in order not to give offense and cause them to stumble [ that is , to cause them to judge unfavorably and unjustly ] go down to the sea and throw in a hook . Take the first fish that comes up , and when you open its mouth you will find there a shekel . Take it and give it to them to pay the temple tax for Me and for yourself .
40018001	AT THAT time the disciples came up and asked Jesus , Who then is [ really ] the greatest in the kingdom of heaven ?
40018002	And He called a little child to Himself and put him in the midst of them ,
40018003	And said , Truly I say to you , unless you repent ( change , turn about ) and become like little children [ trusting , lowly , loving , forgiving ] , you can never enter the kingdom of heaven [ at all ] .
40018004	Whoever will humble himself therefore and become like this little child [ trusting , lowly , loving , forgiving ] is greatest in the kingdom of heaven .
40018005	And whoever receives and accepts and welcomes one little child like this for My sake and in My name receives and accepts and welcomes Me .
40018006	But whoever causes one of these little ones who believe in and acknowledge and cleave to Me to stumble and sin [ that is , who entices him or hinders him in right conduct or thought ] , it would be better ( more expedient and profitable or advantageous ) for him to have a great millstone fastened around his neck and to be sunk in the depth of the sea .
40018007	Woe to the world for such temptations to sin and influences to do wrong ! It is necessary that temptations come , but woe to the person on whose account or by whom the temptation comes !
40018008	And if your hand or your foot causes you to stumble and sin , cut it off and throw it away from you ; it is better ( more profitable and wholesome ) for you to enter life maimed or lame than to have two hands or two feet and be thrown into everlasting fire .
40018009	And if your eye causes you to stumble and sin , pluck it out and throw it away from you ; it is better ( more profitable and wholesome ) for you to enter life with only one eye than to have two eyes and be thrown into the hell ( Gehenna ) of fire .
40018010	Beware that you do not despise or feel scornful toward or think little of one of these little ones , for I tell you that in heaven their angels always are in the presence of and look upon the face of My Father Who is in heaven .
40018011	For the Son of man came to save [ from the penalty of eternal death ] that which was lost .
40018012	What do you think ? If a man has a hundred sheep , and one of them has gone astray and gets lost , will he not leave the ninety-nine on the mountain and go in search of the one that is lost ?
40018013	And if it should be that he finds it , truly I say to you , he rejoices more over it than over the ninety-nine that did not get lost .
40018014	Just so it is not the will of My Father Who is in heaven that one of these little ones should be lost and perish .
40018015	If your brother wrongs you , go and show him his fault , between you and him privately . If he listens to you , you have won back your brother .
40018016	But if he does not listen , take along with you one or two others , so that every word may be confirmed and upheld by the testimony of two or three witnesses .
40018017	If he pays no attention to them [ refusing to listen and obey ] , tell it to the church ; and if he refuses to listen even to the church , let him be to you as a pagan and a tax collector .
40018018	Truly I tell you , whatever you forbid and declare to be improper and unlawful on earth must be what is already forbidden in heaven , and whatever you permit and declare proper and lawful on earth must be what is already permitted in heaven .
40018019	Again I tell you , if two of you on earth agree ( harmonize together , make a symphony together ) about whatever [ anything and everything ] they may ask , it will come to pass and be done for them by My Father in heaven .
40018020	For wherever two or three are gathered ( drawn together as My followers ) in ( into ) My name , there I AM in the midst of them .
40018021	Then Peter came up to Him and said , Lord , how many times may my brother sin against me and I forgive him and let it go ? [ As many as ] up to seven times ?
40018022	Jesus answered him , I tell you , not up to seven times , but seventy times seven !
40018023	Therefore the kingdom of heaven is like a human king who wished to settle accounts with his attendants .
40018024	When he began the accounting , one was brought to him who owed him 10,000 talents [ probably about $ 10,000,000 ] ,
40018025	And because he could not pay , his master ordered him to be sold , with his wife and his children and everything that he possessed , and payment to be made .
40018026	So the attendant fell on his knees , begging him , Have patience with me and I will pay you everything .
40018027	And his master’s heart was moved with compassion , and he released him and forgave him [ cancelling ] the debt .
40018028	But that same attendant , as he went out , found one of his fellow attendants who owed him a hundred denarii [ about twenty dollars ] ; and he caught him by the throat and said , Pay what you owe !
40018029	So his fellow attendant fell down and begged him earnestly , Give me time , and I will pay you all !
40018030	But he was unwilling , and he went out and had him put in prison till he should pay the debt .
40018031	When his fellow attendants saw what had happened , they were greatly distressed , and they went and told everything that had taken place to their master .
40018032	Then his master called him and said to him , You contemptible and wicked attendant ! I forgave and cancelled all that [ great ] debt of yours because you begged me to .
40018033	And should you not have had pity and mercy on your fellow attendant , as I had pity and mercy on you ?
40018034	And in wrath his master turned him over to the torturers ( the jailers ) , till he should pay all that he owed .
40018035	So also My heavenly Father will deal with every one of you if you do not freely forgive your brother from your heart his offenses .
40019001	NOW WHEN Jesus had finished saying these things , He left Galilee and went into the part of Judea that is beyond the Jordan ;
40019002	And great throngs accompanied Him , and He cured them there .
40019003	And Pharisees came to Him and put Him to the test by asking , Is it lawful and right to dismiss and repudiate and divorce one’s wife for any and every cause ?
40019004	He replied , Have you never read that He Who made them from the beginning made them male and female ,
40019005	And said , For this reason a man shall leave his father and mother and shall be united firmly ( joined inseparably ) to his wife , and the two shall become one flesh ?
40019006	So they are no longer two , but one flesh . What therefore God has joined together , let not man put asunder ( separate ) .
40019007	They said to Him , Why then did Moses command [ us ] to give a certificate of divorce and thus to dismiss and repudiate a wife ?
40019008	He said to them , Because of the hardness ( stubbornness and perversity ) of your hearts Moses permitted you to dismiss and repudiate and divorce your wives ; but from the beginning it has not been so [ ordained ] .
40019009	I say to you : whoever dismisses ( repudiates , divorces ) his wife , except for unchastity , and marries another commits adultery , and he who marries a divorced woman commits adultery .
40019010	The disciples said to Him , If the case of a man with his wife is like this , it is neither profitable nor advisable to marry .
40019011	But He said to them , Not all men can accept this saying , but it is for those to whom [ the capacity to receive ] it has been given .
40019012	For there are eunuchs who have been born incapable of marriage ; and there are eunuchs who have been made so by men ; and there are eunuchs who have made themselves incapable of marriage for the sake of the kingdom of heaven . Let him who is able to accept this accept it .
40019013	Then little children were brought to Jesus , that He might put His hands on them and pray ; but the disciples rebuked those who brought them .
40019014	But He said , Leave the children alone ! Allow the little ones to come to Me , and do not forbid or restrain or hinder them , for of such [ as these ] is the kingdom of heaven composed .
40019015	And He put His hands upon them , and then went on His way .
40019016	And behold , there came a man up to Him , saying , Teacher , what excellent and perfectly and essentially good deed must I do to possess eternal life ?
40019017	And He said to him , Why do you ask Me about the perfectly and essentially good ? There is only One Who is good [ perfectly and essentially ] -- God . If you would enter into the Life , you must continually keep the commandments .
40019018	He said to Him , What sort of commandments ? [ Or , which ones ? ] And Jesus answered , You shall not kill , You shall not commit adultery , You shall not steal , You shall not bear false witness ,
40019019	Honor your father and your mother , and , You shall love your neighbor as [ you do ] yourself .
40019020	The young man said , I have observed all these from my youth ; what still do I lack ?
40019021	Jesus answered him , If you would be perfect [ that is , have that spiritual maturity which accompanies self-sacrificing character ] , go and sell what you have and give to the poor , and you will have riches in heaven ; and come , be My disciple [ side with My party and follow Me ] .
40019022	But when the young man heard this , he went away sad ( grieved and in much distress ) , for he had great possessions .
40019023	And Jesus said to His disciples , Truly I say to you , it will be difficult for a rich man to get into the kingdom of heaven .
40019024	Again I tell you , it is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to go into the kingdom of heaven .
40019025	When the disciples heard this , they were utterly puzzled ( astonished , bewildered ) , saying , Who then can be saved [ from eternal death ] ?
40019026	But Jesus looked at them and said , With men this is impossible , but all things are possible with God .
40019027	Then Peter answered Him , saying , Behold , we have left [ our ] all and have become Your disciples [ sided with Your party and followed You ] . What then shall we receive ?
40019028	Jesus said to them , Truly I say to you , in the new age [ the Messianic rebirth of the world ] , when the Son of Man shall sit down on the throne of His glory , you who have [ become My disciples , sided with My party and ] followed Me will also sit on twelve thrones and judge the twelve tribes of Israel .
40019029	And anyone and everyone who has left houses or brothers or sisters or father or mother or children or lands for My name’s sake will receive many [ even a hundred ] times more and will inherit eternal life .
40019030	But many who [ now ] are first will be last [ then ] , and many who [ now ] are last will be first [ then ] .
40020001	FOR THE kingdom of heaven is like the owner of an estate who went out in the morning along with the dawn to hire workmen for his vineyard .
40020002	After agreeing with the laborers for a denarius a day , he sent them into his vineyard .
40020003	And going out about the third hour ( nine o’clock ) , he saw others standing idle in the marketplace ;
40020004	And he said to them , You go also into the vineyard , and whatever is right I will pay you . And they went .
40020005	He went out again about the sixth hour ( noon ) , and the ninth hour ( three o’clock ) he did the same .
40020006	And about the eleventh hour ( five o’clock ) he went out and found still others standing around , and said to them , Why do you stand here idle all day ?
40020007	They answered him , Because nobody has hired us . He told them , You go out into the vineyard also and you will get whatever is just and fair .
40020008	When evening came , the owner of the vineyard said to his manager , Call the workmen and pay them their wages , beginning with the last and ending with the first .
40020009	And those who had been hired at the eleventh hour ( five o’clock ) came and received a denarius each .
40020010	Now when the first came , they supposed they would get more , but each of them also received a denarius .
40020011	And when they received it , they grumbled at the owner of the estate ,
40020012	Saying , These [ men ] who came last worked no more than an hour , and yet you have made them rank with us who have borne the burden and the scorching heat of the day .
40020013	But he answered one of them , Friend , I am doing you no injustice . Did you not agree with me for a denarius ?
40020014	Take what belongs to you and go . I choose to give to this man hired last the same as I give to you .
40020015	Am I not permitted to do what I choose with what is mine ? [ Or do you begrudge my being generous ? ] Is your eye evil because I am good ?
40020016	So those who [ now ] are last will be first [ then ] , and those who [ now ] are first will be last [ then ] . For many are called , but few chosen .
40020017	And as Jesus was going up to Jerusalem , He took the twelve disciples aside along the way and said to them ,
40020018	Behold , we are going up to Jerusalem , and the Son of Man will be handed over to the chief priests and scribes ; and they will sentence Him to death
40020019	And deliver Him over to the Gentiles to be mocked and whipped and crucified , and He will be raised [ to life ] on the third day .
40020020	Then the mother of Zebedee’s children came up to Him with her sons and , kneeling , worshiped Him and asked a favor of Him .
40020021	And He asked her , What do you wish ? She answered Him , Give orders that these two sons of mine may sit , one at Your right hand and one at Your left in Your kingdom .
40020022	But Jesus replied , You do not realize what you are asking . Are you able to drink the cup that I am about to drink and to be baptized with the baptism with which I am baptized ? They answered , We are able .
40020023	He said to them , You will drink My cup , but seats at My right hand and at My left are not Mine to give , but they are for those for whom they have been ordained and prepared by My Father .
40020024	But when the ten [ other disciples ] heard this , they were indignant at the two brothers .
40020025	And Jesus called them to Him and said , You know that the rulers of the Gentiles lord it over them , and their great men hold them in subjection [ tyrannizing over them ] .
40020026	Not so shall it be among you ; but whoever wishes to be great among you must be your servant ,
40020027	And whoever desires to be first among you must be your slave --
40020028	Just as the Son of Man came not to be waited on but to serve , and to give His life as a ransom for many [ the price paid to set them free ] .
40020029	And as they were going out of Jericho , a great throng accompanied Him .
40020030	And behold , two blind men were sitting by the roadside , and when they heard that Jesus was passing by , they cried out , Lord , have pity and mercy on us , [ You ] Son of David !
40020031	The crowds reproved them and told them to keep still ; but they cried out all the more , Lord , have pity and mercy on us , [ You ] Son of David !
40020032	And Jesus stopped and called them , and asked , What do you want Me to do for you ?
40020033	They answered Him , Lord , we want our eyes to be opened !
40020034	And Jesus , in pity , touched their eyes ; and instantly they received their sight and followed Him .
40021001	AND WHEN they came near Jerusalem and had reached Bethphage at the Mount of Olives , Jesus sent two disciples on ahead ,
40021002	Saying to them , Go into the village that is opposite you , and at once you will find a donkey tied , and a colt with her ; untie [ them ] and bring [ them ] to Me .
40021003	If anyone says anything to you , you shall reply , The Lord needs them , and he will let them go without delay .
40021004	This happened that what was spoken by the prophet might be fulfilled , saying ,
40021005	Say to the Daughter of Zion [ inhabitants of Jerusalem ] , Behold , your King is coming to you , lowly and riding on a donkey , and on a colt , the foal of a donkey [ a beast of burden ] .
40021006	Then the disciples went and did as Jesus had directed them .
40021007	They brought the donkey and the colt and laid their coats upon them , and He seated Himself on them [ the clothing ] .
40021008	And most of the crowd kept spreading their garments on the road , and others kept cutting branches from the trees and scattering them on the road .
40021009	And the crowds that went ahead of Him and those that followed Him kept shouting , Hosanna ( O be propitious , graciously inclined ) to the Son of David , [ the Messiah ] ! Blessed ( praised , glorified ) is He Who comes in the name of the Lord ! Hosanna ( O be favorably disposed ) in the highest [ heaven ] !
40021010	And when He entered Jerusalem , all the city became agitated and [ trembling with excitement ] said , Who is This ?
40021011	And the crowds replied , This is the prophet Jesus from Nazareth of Galilee .
40021012	And Jesus went into the temple ( whole temple enclosure ) and drove out all who bought and sold in the sacred place , and He turned over the four-footed tables of the money changers and the chairs of those who sold doves .
40021013	He said to them , The Scripture says , My house shall be called a house of prayer ; but you have made it a den of robbers .
40021014	And the blind and the lame came to Him in the porches and courts of the temple , and He cured them .
40021015	But when the chief priests and the scribes saw the wonderful things that He did and the boys and the girls and the youths and the maidens crying out in the porches and courts of the temple , Hosanna ( O be propitious , graciously inclined ) to the Son of David ! they were indignant .
40021016	And they said to Him , Do You hear what these are saying ? And Jesus replied to them , Yes ; have you never read , Out of the mouths of babes and unweaned infants You have made ( provided ) perfect praise ?
40021017	And leaving them , He departed from the city and went out to Bethany and lodged there .
40021018	In the early dawn the next morning , as He was coming back to the city , He was hungry .
40021019	And as He saw one single leafy fig tree above the roadside , He went to it but He found nothing but leaves on it [ seeing that in the fig tree the fruit appears at the same time as the leaves ] . And He said to it , Never again shall fruit grow on you ! And the fig tree withered up at once .
40021020	When the disciples saw it , they marveled greatly and asked , How is it that the fig tree has withered away all at once ?
40021021	And Jesus answered them , Truly I say to you , if you have faith ( a firm relying trust ) and do not doubt , you will not only do what has been done to the fig tree , but even if you say to this mountain , Be taken up and cast into the sea , it will be done .
40021022	And whatever you ask for in prayer , having faith and [ really ] believing , you will receive .
40021023	And when He entered the sacred enclosure of the temple , the chief priests and elders of the people came up to Him as He was teaching and said , By what power of authority are You doing these things , and who gave You this power of authority ?
40021024	Jesus answered them , I also will ask you a question , and if you give Me the answer , then I also will tell you by what power of authority I do these things .
40021025	The baptism of John -- from where was it ? From heaven or from men ? And they reasoned and argued with one another , If we say , From heaven , He will ask us , Why then did you not believe him ?
40021026	But if we say , From men -- we are afraid of and must reckon with the multitude , for they all regard John as a prophet .
40021027	So they answered Jesus , We do not know . And He said to them , Neither will I tell you by what power of authority I do these things .
40021028	What do you think ? There was a man who had two sons . He came to the first and said , Son , go and work today in the vineyard .
40021029	And he answered , I will not ; but afterward he changed his mind and went .
40021030	Then the man came to the second and said the same [ thing ] . And he replied , I will [ go ] , sir ; but he did not go .
40021031	Which of the two did the will of the father ? They replied , The first one . Jesus said to them , Truly I tell you , the tax collectors and the harlots will get into the kingdom of heaven before you .
40021032	For John came to you walking in the way of an upright man in right standing with God , and you did not believe him , but the tax collectors and the harlots did believe him ; and you , even when you saw that , did not afterward change your minds and believe him [ adhere to , trust in , and rely on what he told you ] .
40021033	Listen to another parable : There was a master of a house who planted a vineyard and put a hedge around it and dug a wine vat in it and built a watchtower . Then he let it out [ for rent ] to tenants and went into another country .
40021034	When the fruit season drew near , he sent his servants to the tenants to get his [ share of the ] fruit .
40021035	But the tenants took his servants and beat one , killed another , and stoned another .
40021036	Again he sent other servants , more than the first time , and they treated them the same way .
40021037	Finally he sent his own son to them , saying , They will respect and give heed to my son .
40021038	But when the tenants saw the son , they said to themselves , This is the heir ; come on , let us kill him and have his inheritance .
40021039	And they took him and threw him out of the vineyard and killed him .
40021040	Now when the owner of the vineyard comes back , what will he do to those tenants ?
40021041	They said to Him , He will put those wretches to a miserable death and rent the vineyard to other tenants of such a character that they will give him the fruits promptly in their season .
40021042	Jesus asked them , Have you never read in the Scriptures : The very Stone which the builders rejected and threw away has become the Cornerstone ; this is the Lord’s doing , and it is marvelous in our eyes ?
40021043	I tell you , for this reason the kingdom of God will be taken away from you and given to a people who will produce the fruits of it .
40021044	And whoever falls on this Stone will be broken to pieces , but he on whom It falls will be crushed to powder [ and It will winnow him , scattering him like dust ] .
40021045	And when the chief priests and the Pharisees heard His parables ( comparisons , stories used to illustrate and explain ) , they perceived that He was talking about them .
40021046	And although they were trying to arrest Him , they feared the throngs because they regarded Him as a prophet .
40022001	AND AGAIN Jesus spoke to them in parables ( comparisons , stories used to illustrate and explain ) , saying ,
40022002	The kingdom of heaven is like a king who gave a wedding banquet for his son
40022003	And sent his servants to summon those who had been invited to the wedding banquet , but they refused to come .
40022004	Again he sent other servants , saying , Tell those who are invited , Behold , I have prepared my banquet ; my bullocks and my fat calves are killed , and everything is prepared ; come to the wedding feast .
40022005	But they were not concerned and paid no attention [ they ignored and made light of the summons , treating it with contempt ] and they went away -- one to his farm , another to his business ,
40022006	While the others seized his servants , treated them shamefully , and put them to death .
40022007	[ Hearing this ] the king was infuriated ; and he sent his soldiers and put those murderers to death and burned their city .
40022008	Then he said to his servants , The wedding [ feast ] is prepared , but those invited were not worthy .
40022009	So go to the thoroughfares where they leave the city [ where the main roads and those from the country end ] and invite to the wedding feast as many as you find .
40022010	And those servants went out on the crossroads and got together as many as they found , both bad and good , so [ the room in which ] the wedding feast [ was held ] was filled with guests .
40022011	But when the king came in to view the guests , he looked intently at a man there who had on no wedding garment .
40022012	And he said , Friend , how did you come in here without putting on the [ appropriate ] wedding garment ? And he was speechless ( muzzled , gagged ) .
40022013	Then the king said to the attendants , Tie him hand and foot , and throw him into the darkness outside ; there will be weeping and grinding of teeth .
40022014	For many are called ( invited and summoned ) , but few are chosen .
40022015	Then the Pharisees went and consulted and plotted together how they might entangle Jesus in His talk .
40022016	And they sent their disciples to Him along with the Herodians , saying , Teacher , we know that You are sincere and what You profess to be and that You teach the way of God truthfully , regardless of consequences and being afraid of no man ; for You are impartial and do not regard either the person or the position of anyone .
40022017	Tell us then what You think about this : Is it lawful to pay tribute [ levied on individuals and to be paid yearly ] to Caesar or not ?
40022018	But Jesus , aware of their malicious plot , asked , Why do you put Me to the test and try to entrap Me , you pretenders ( hypocrites ) ?
40022019	Show me the money used for the tribute . And they brought Him a denarius .
40022020	And Jesus said to them , Whose likeness and title are these ?
40022021	They said , Caesar’s . Then He said to them , Pay therefore to Caesar the things that are due to Caesar , and pay to God the things that are due to God .
40022022	When they heard it they were amazed and marveled ; and they left Him and departed .
40022023	The same day some Sadducees , who say that there is no resurrection [ of the dead ] , came to Him and they asked Him a question ,
40022024	Saying , Teacher , Moses said , If a man dies , leaving no children , his brother shall marry the widow and raise up a family for his brother .
40022025	Now there were seven brothers among us ; the first married and died , and , having no children , left his wife to his brother .
40022026	The second also died childless , and the third , down to the seventh .
40022027	Last of all , the woman died also .
40022028	Now , in the resurrection , to which of the seven will she be wife ? For they all had her .
40022029	But Jesus replied to them , You are wrong because you know neither the Scriptures nor God’s power .
40022030	For in the resurrected state neither do [ men ] marry nor are [ women ] given in marriage , but they are like the angels in heaven .
40022031	But as to the resurrection of the dead -- have you never read what was said to you by God ,
40022032	I am the God of Abraham , and the God of Isaac , and the God of Jacob ? He is not the God of the dead but of the living !
40022033	And when the throng heard it , they were astonished and filled with [ glad ] amazement at His teaching .
40022034	Now when the Pharisees heard that He had silenced ( muzzled ) the Sadducees , they gathered together .

40022037	And He replied to him , You shall love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your mind ( intellect ) .
40022038	This is the great ( most important , principal ) and first commandment .
40022039	And a second is like it : You shall love your neighbor as [ you do ] yourself .
40022040	These two commandments sum up and upon them depend all the Law and the Prophets .

40022045	If then David thus calls Him Lord , how is He his Son ?
40022046	And no one was able to answer Him a word , nor from that day did anyone venture or dare to question Him .
40023001	THEN JESUS said to the multitudes and to His disciples ,
40023002	The scribes and Pharisees sit on Moses’ seat [ of authority ] .
40023003	So observe and practice all they tell you ; but do not do what they do , for they preach , but do not practice .
40023004	They tie up heavy loads , hard to bear , and place them on men’s shoulders , but they themselves will not lift a finger to help bear them .
40023005	They do all their works to be seen of men ; for they make wide their phylacteries ( small cases enclosing certain Scripture passages , worn during prayer on the left arm and forehead ) and make long their fringes [ worn by all male Israelites , according to the command ] .
40023006	And they take pleasure in and [ thus ] love the place of honor at feasts and the best seats in the synagogues ,
40023007	And to be greeted with honor in the marketplaces and to have people call them rabbi .
40023008	But you are not to be called rabbi ( teacher ) , for you have one Teacher and you are all brothers .
40023009	And do not call anyone [ in the church ] on earth father , for you have one Father , Who is in heaven .
40023010	And you must not be called masters ( leaders ) , for you have one Master ( Leader ) , the Christ .
40023011	He who is greatest among you shall be your servant .
40023012	Whoever exalts himself [ with haughtiness and empty pride ] shall be humbled ( brought low ) , and whoever humbles himself [ whoever has a modest opinion of himself and behaves accordingly ] shall be raised to honor .
40023013	But woe to you , scribes and Pharisees , pretenders ( hypocrites ) ! For you shut the kingdom of heaven in men’s faces ; for you neither enter yourselves , nor do you allow those who are about to go in to do so .
40023014	Woe to you , scribes and Pharisees , pretenders ( hypocrites ) ! For you swallow up widows’ houses and for a pretense to cover it up make long prayers ; therefore you will receive the greater condemnation and the heavier sentence .
40023015	Woe to you , scribes and Pharisees , pretenders ( hypocrites ) ! For you travel over sea and land to make a single proselyte , and when he becomes one [ a proselyte ] , you make him doubly as much a child of hell ( Gehenna ) as you are .
40023016	Woe to you , blind guides , who say , If anyone swears by the sanctuary of the temple , it is nothing ; but if anyone swears by the gold of the sanctuary , he is a debtor [ bound by his oath ] .
40023017	You blind fools ! For which is greater : the gold , or the sanctuary of the temple that has made the gold sacred ?
40023018	You say too , Whoever swears by the altar is not duty bound ; but whoever swears by the offering on the altar , his oath is binding .
40023019	You blind men ! Which is greater : the gift , or the altar which makes the gift sacred ?
40023020	So whoever swears by the altar swears by it and by everything on it .
40023021	And he who swears by the sanctuary of the temple swears by it and by Him Who dwells in it .
40023022	And whoever swears by heaven swears by the throne of God and by Him Who sits upon it .
40023023	Woe to you , scribes and Pharisees , pretenders ( hypocrites ) ! For you give a tenth of your mint and dill and cummin , and have neglected and omitted the weightier ( more important ) matters of the Law -- right and justice and mercy and fidelity . These you ought [ particularly ] to have done , without neglecting the others .
40023024	You blind guides , filtering out a gnat and gulping down a camel !
40023025	Woe to you , scribes and Pharisees , pretenders ( hypocrites ) ! For you clean the outside of the cup and of the plate , but within they are full of extortion ( prey , spoil , plunder ) and grasping self-indulgence .
40023026	You blind Pharisee ! First clean the inside of the cup and of the plate , so that the outside may be clean also .
40023027	Woe to you , scribes and Pharisees , pretenders ( hypocrites ) ! For you are like tombs that have been whitewashed , which look beautiful on the outside but inside are full of dead men’s bones and everything impure .
40023028	Just so , you also outwardly seem to people to be just and upright but inside you are full of pretense and lawlessness and iniquity .
40023029	Woe to you , scribes and Pharisees , pretenders ( hypocrites ) ! For you build tombs for the prophets and decorate the monuments of the righteous ,
40023030	Saying , If we had lived in the days of our forefathers , we would not have aided them in shedding the blood of the prophets .
40023031	Thus you are testifying against yourselves that you are the descendants of those who murdered the prophets .
40023032	Fill up , then , the measure of your fathers’ sins to the brim [ so that nothing may be wanting to a full measure ] .
40023033	You serpents ! You spawn of vipers ! How can you escape the penalty to be suffered in hell ( Gehenna ) ?
40023034	Because of this , take notice : I am sending you prophets and wise men ( interpreters and teachers ) and scribes ( men learned in the Mosaic Law and the Prophets ) ; some of them you will kill , even crucify , and some you will flog in your synagogues and pursue and persecute from town to town ,
40023035	So that upon your heads may come all the blood of the righteous ( those who correspond to the divine standard of right ) shed on earth , from the blood of the righteous Abel to the blood of Zechariah son of Barachiah , whom you murdered between the sanctuary and the altar [ of burnt offering ] .
40023036	Truly I declare to you , all these [ evil , calamitous times ] will come upon this generation .
40023037	O Jerusalem , Jerusalem , murdering the prophets and stoning those who are sent to you ! How often would I have gathered your children together as a mother fowl gathers her brood under her wings , and you refused !
40023038	Behold , your house is forsaken and desolate ( abandoned and left destitute of God’s help ) .
40023039	For I declare to you , you will not see Me again until you say , Blessed ( magnified in worship , adored , and exalted ) is He Who comes in the name of the Lord !
40024001	JESUS DEPARTED from the temple area and was going on His way when His disciples came up to Him to call His attention to the buildings of the temple and point them out to Him .
40024002	But He answered them , Do you see all these ? Truly I tell you , there will not be left here one stone upon another that will not be thrown down .
40024003	While He was seated on the Mount of Olives , the disciples came to Him privately and said , Tell us , when will this take place , and what will be the sign of Your coming and of the end ( the completion , the consummation ) of the age ?
40024004	Jesus answered them , Be careful that no one misleads you [ deceiving you and leading you into error ] .
40024005	For many will come in ( on the strength of ) My name [ appropriating the name which belongs to Me ] , saying , I am the Christ ( the Messiah ) , and they will lead many astray .
40024006	And you will hear of wars and rumors of wars ; see that you are not frightened or troubled , for this must take place , but the end is not yet .
40024007	For nation will rise against nation , and kingdom against kingdom , and there will be famines and earthquakes in place after place ;
40024008	All this is but the beginning [ the early pains ] of the birth pangs [ of the intolerable anguish ] .
40024009	Then they will hand you over to suffer affliction and tribulation and put you to death , and you will be hated by all nations for My name’s sake .
40024010	And then many will be offended and repelled and will begin to distrust and desert [ Him Whom they ought to trust and obey ] and will stumble and fall away and betray one another and pursue one another with hatred .
40024011	And many false prophets will rise up and deceive and lead many into error .
40024012	And the love of the great body of people will grow cold because of the multiplied lawlessness and iniquity ,
40024013	But he who endures to the end will be saved .
40024014	And this good news of the kingdom ( the Gospel ) will be preached throughout the whole world as a testimony to all the nations , and then will come the end .
40024015	So when you see the appalling sacrilege [ the abomination that astonishes and makes desolate ] , spoken of by the prophet Daniel , standing in the Holy Place -- let the reader take notice and ponder and consider and heed [ this ] --
40024016	Then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains ;
40024017	Let him who is on the housetop not come down and go into the house to take anything ;
40024018	And let him who is in the field not turn back to get his overcoat .
40024019	And alas for the women who are pregnant and for those who have nursing babies in those days !
40024020	Pray that your flight may not be in winter or on a Sabbath .
40024021	For then there will be great tribulation ( affliction , distress , and oppression ) such as has not been from the beginning of the world until now -- no , and never will be [ again ] .
40024022	And if those days had not been shortened , no human being would endure and survive , but for the sake of the elect ( God’s chosen ones ) those days will be shortened .
40024023	If anyone says to you then , Behold , here is the Christ ( the Messiah ) ! or , There He is ! -- do not believe it .
40024024	For false Christs and false prophets will arise , and they will show great signs and wonders so as to deceive and lead astray , if possible , even the elect ( God’s chosen ones ) .
40024025	See , I have warned you beforehand .
40024026	So if they say to you , Behold , He is in the wilderness ( desert ) -- do not go out there ; if they tell you , Behold , He is in the secret places or inner rooms -- do not believe it .
40024027	For just as the lightning flashes from the east and shines and is seen as far as the west , so will the coming of the Son of Man be .
40024028	Wherever there is a fallen body ( a corpse ) , there the vultures ( or eagles ) will flock together .
40024029	Immediately after the tribulation of those days the sun will be darkened , and the moon will not shed its light , and the stars will fall from the sky , and the powers of the heavens will be shaken .
40024030	Then the sign of the Son of Man will appear in the sky , and then all the tribes of the earth will mourn and beat their breasts and lament in anguish , and they will see the Son of Man coming on the clouds of heaven with power and great glory [ in brilliancy and splendor ] .
40024031	And He will send out His angels with a loud trumpet call , and they will gather His elect ( His chosen ones ) from the four winds , [ even ] from one end of the universe to the other .
40024032	From the fig tree learn this lesson : as soon as its young shoots become soft and tender and it puts out its leaves , you know of a surety that summer is near .
40024033	So also when you see these signs , all taken together , coming to pass , you may know of a surety that He is near , at the very doors .
40024034	Truly I tell you , this generation ( the whole multitude of people living at the same time , in a definite , given period ) will not pass away till all these things taken together take place .
40024035	Sky and earth will pass away , but My words will not pass away .
40024036	But of that [ exact ] day and hour no one knows , not even the angels of heaven , nor the Son , but only the Father .
40024037	As were the days of Noah , so will be the coming of the Son of Man .
40024038	For just as in those days before the flood they were eating and drinking , [ men ] marrying and [ women ] being given in marriage , until the [ very ] day when Noah went into the ark ,
40024039	And they did not know or understand until the flood came and swept them all away -- so will be the coming of the Son of Man .
40024040	At that time two men will be in the field ; one will be taken and one will be left .
40024041	Two women will be grinding at the hand mill ; one will be taken and one will be left .
40024042	Watch therefore [ give strict attention , be cautious and active ] , for you do not know in what kind of a day [ whether a near or remote one ] your Lord is coming .
40024043	But understand this : had the householder known in what [ part of the night , whether in a night or a morning ] watch the thief was coming , he would have watched and would not have allowed his house to be undermined and broken into .
40024044	You also must be ready therefore , for the Son of Man is coming at an hour when you do not expect Him .
40024045	Who then is the faithful , thoughtful , and wise servant , whom his master has put in charge of his household to give to the others the food and supplies at the proper time ?
40024046	Blessed ( happy , fortunate , and to be envied ) is that servant whom , when his master comes , he will find so doing .
40024047	I solemnly declare to you , he will set him over all his possessions .
40024048	But if that servant is wicked and says to himself , My master is delayed and is going to be gone a long time ,
40024049	And begins to beat his fellow servants and to eat and drink with the drunken ,
40024050	The master of that servant will come on a day when he does not expect him and at an hour of which he is not aware ,
40024051	And will punish him [ cut him up by scourging ] and put him with the pretenders ( hypocrites ) ; there will be weeping and grinding of teeth .
40025001	THEN THE kingdom of heaven shall be likened to ten virgins who took their lamps and went to meet the bridegroom .
40025002	Five of them were foolish ( thoughtless , without forethought ) and five were wise ( sensible , intelligent , and prudent ) .
40025003	For when the foolish took their lamps , they did not take any [ extra ] oil with them ;
40025004	But the wise took flasks of oil along with them [ also ] with their lamps .
40025005	While the bridegroom lingered and was slow in coming , they all began nodding their heads , and they fell asleep .
40025006	But at midnight there was a shout , Behold , the bridegroom ! Go out to meet him !
40025007	Then all those virgins got up and put their own lamps in order .
40025008	And the foolish said to the wise , Give us some of your oil , for our lamps are going out .
40025009	But the wise replied , There will not be enough for us and for you ; go instead to the dealers and buy for yourselves .
40025010	But while they were going away to buy , the bridegroom came , and those who were prepared went in with him to the marriage feast ; and the door was shut .
40025011	Later the other virgins also came and said , Lord , Lord , open [ the door ] to us !
40025012	But He replied , I solemnly declare to you , I do not know you [ I am not acquainted with you ] .
40025013	Watch therefore [ give strict attention and be cautious and active ] , for you know neither the day nor the hour when the Son of Man will come .
40025014	For it is like a man who was about to take a long journey , and he called his servants together and entrusted them with his property .
40025015	To one he gave five talents [ probably about $ 5,000 ] , to another two , to another one -- to each in proportion to his own personal ability . Then he departed and left the country .
40025016	He who had received the five talents went at once and traded with them , and he gained five talents more .
40025017	And likewise he who had received the two talents -- he also gained two talents more .
40025018	But he who had received the one talent went and dug a hole in the ground and hid his master’s money .
40025019	Now after a long time the master of those servants returned and settled accounts with them .
40025020	And he who had received the five talents came and brought him five more , saying , Master , you entrusted to me five talents ; see , here I have gained five talents more .
40025021	His master said to him , Well done , you upright ( honorable , admirable ) and faithful servant ! You have been faithful and trustworthy over a little ; I will put you in charge of much . Enter into and share the joy ( the delight , the blessedness ) which your master enjoys .
40025022	And he also who had the two talents came forward , saying , Master , you entrusted two talents to me ; here I have gained two talents more .
40025023	His master said to him , Well done , you upright ( honorable , admirable ) and faithful servant ! You have been faithful and trustworthy over a little ; I will put you in charge of much . Enter into and share the joy ( the delight , the blessedness ) which your master enjoys .
40025024	He who had received one talent also came forward , saying , Master , I knew you to be a harsh and hard man , reaping where you did not sow , and gathering where you had not winnowed [ the grain ] .
40025025	So I was afraid , and I went and hid your talent in the ground . Here you have what is your own .
40025026	But his master answered him , You wicked and lazy and idle servant ! Did you indeed know that I reap where I have not sowed and gather [ grain ] where I have not winnowed ?
40025027	Then you should have invested my money with the bankers , and at my coming I would have received what was my own with interest .
40025028	So take the talent away from him and give it to the one who has the ten talents .
40025029	For to everyone who has will more be given , and he will be furnished richly so that he will have an abundance ; but from the one who does not have , even what he does have will be taken away .
40025030	And throw the good-for-nothing servant into the outer darkness ; there will be weeping and grinding of teeth .
40025031	When the Son of Man comes in His glory ( His majesty and splendor ) , and all the holy angels with Him , then He will sit on the throne of His glory .
40025032	All nations will be gathered before Him , and He will separate them [ the people ] from one another as a shepherd separates his sheep from the goats ;
40025033	And He will cause the sheep to stand at His right hand , but the goats at His left .
40025034	Then the King will say to those at His right hand , Come , you blessed of My Father [ you favored of God and appointed to eternal salvation ] , inherit ( receive as your own ) the kingdom prepared for you from the foundation of the world .
40025035	For I was hungry and you gave Me food , I was thirsty and you gave Me something to drink , I was a stranger and you brought Me together with yourselves and welcomed and entertained and lodged Me ,
40025036	I was naked and you clothed Me , I was sick and you visited Me with help and ministering care , I was in prison and you came to see Me .
40025037	Then the just and upright will answer Him , Lord , when did we see You hungry and gave You food , or thirsty and gave You something to drink ?
40025038	And when did we see You a stranger and welcomed and entertained You , or naked and clothed You ?
40025039	And when did we see You sick or in prison and came to visit You ?
40025040	And the King will reply to them , Truly I tell you , in so far as you did it for one of the least [ in the estimation of men ] of these My brethren , you did it for Me .
40025041	Then He will say to those at His left hand , Begone from Me , you cursed , into the eternal fire prepared for the devil and his angels !
40025042	For I was hungry and you gave Me no food , I was thirsty and you gave Me nothing to drink ,
40025043	I was a stranger and you did not welcome Me and entertain Me , I was naked and you did not clothe Me , I was sick and in prison and you did not visit Me with help and ministering care .
40025044	Then they also [ in their turn ] will answer , Lord , when did we see You hungry or thirsty or a stranger or naked or sick or in prison , and did not minister to You ?
40025045	And He will reply to them , Solemnly I declare to you , in so far as you failed to do it for the least [ in the estimation of men ] of these , you failed to do it for Me .
40025046	Then they will go away into eternal punishment , but those who are just and upright and in right standing with God into eternal life .
40026001	WHEN JESUS had ended this discourse , He said to His disciples ,
40026002	You know that the Passover is in two days -- and the Son of Man will be delivered up treacherously to be crucified .
40026003	Then the chief priests and the elders of the people gathered in the [ open ] court of the palace of the high priest , whose name was Caiaphas ,
40026004	And consulted together in order to arrest Jesus by stratagem secretly and put Him to death .
40026005	But they said , It must not be during the Feast , for fear that there will be a riot among the people .
40026006	Now when Jesus came back to Bethany and was in the house of Simon the leper ,
40026007	A woman came up to Him with an alabaster flask of very precious perfume , and she poured it on His head as He reclined at table .
40026008	And when the disciples saw it , they were indignant , saying , For what purpose is all this waste ?
40026009	For this perfume might have been sold for a large sum and the money given to the poor .
40026010	But Jesus , fully aware of this , said to them , Why do you bother the woman ? She has done a noble ( praiseworthy and beautiful ) thing to Me .
40026011	For you always have the poor among you , but you will not always have Me .
40026012	In pouring this perfume on My body she has done something to prepare Me for My burial .
40026013	Truly I tell you , wherever this good news ( the Gospel ) is preached in the whole world , what this woman has done will be told also , in memory of her .
40026014	Then one of the Twelve [ apostles ] , who was called Judas Iscariot , went to the chief priests
40026015	And said , What are you willing to give me if I hand Him over to you ? And they weighed out for and paid to him thirty pieces of silver [ about twenty-one dollars and sixty cents ] .
40026016	And from that moment he sought a fitting opportunity to betray Him .
40026017	Now on the first day of Unleavened Bread [ Passover week ] , the disciples came to Jesus and said to Him , Where do You wish us to prepare for You to eat the Passover supper ?
40026018	He said , Go into the city to a certain man and say to him , The Master says : My time is near ; I will keep the Passover at your house with My disciples .
40026019	And accordingly the disciples did as Jesus had directed them , and they made ready the Passover supper .
40026020	When it was evening , He was reclining at table with the twelve disciples .
40026021	And as they were eating , He said , Solemnly I say to you , one of you will betray Me !
40026022	They were exceedingly pained and distressed and deeply hurt and sorrowful and began to say to Him one after another , Surely it cannot be I , Lord , can it ?
40026023	He replied , He who has [ just ] dipped his hand in the same dish with Me will betray Me !
40026024	The Son of Man is going just as it is written of Him ; but woe to that man by whom the Son of Man is betrayed ! It would have been better ( more profitable and wholesome ) for that man if he had never been born !
40026025	Judas , the betrayer , said , Surely it is not I , is it , Master ? He said to him , You have stated [ the fact ] .

40026034	Jesus said to him , Solemnly I declare to you , this very night , before a single rooster crows , you will deny and disown Me three times .

40026036	Then Jesus went with them to a place called Gethsemane , and He told His disciples , Sit down here while I go over yonder and pray .
40026037	And taking with Him Peter and the two sons of Zebedee , He began to show grief and distress of mind and was deeply depressed .
40026038	Then He said to them , My soul is very sad and deeply grieved , so that I am almost dying of sorrow . Stay here and keep awake and keep watch with Me .
40026039	And going a little farther , He threw Himself upon the ground on His face and prayed saying , My Father , if it is possible , let this cup pass away from Me ; nevertheless , not what I will [ not what I desire ] , but as You will and desire .
40026040	And He came to the disciples and found them sleeping , and He said to Peter , What ! Are you so utterly unable to stay awake and keep watch with Me for one hour ?
40026041	All of you must keep awake ( give strict attention , be cautious and active ) and watch and pray , that you may not come into temptation . The spirit indeed is willing , but the flesh is weak .
40026042	Again a second time He went away and prayed , My Father , if this cannot pass by unless I drink it , Your will be done .
40026043	And again He came and found them sleeping , for their eyes were weighed down with sleep .
40026044	So , leaving them again , He went away and prayed for the third time , using the same words .
40026045	Then He returned to the disciples and said to them , Are you still sleeping and taking your rest ? Behold , the hour is at hand , and the Son of Man is betrayed into the hands of especially wicked sinners [ whose way or nature it is to act in opposition to God ] .
40026046	Get up , let us be going ! See , My betrayer is at hand !
40026047	As He was still speaking , Judas , one of the Twelve [ apostles ] , came up , and with him a great crowd with swords and clubs , from the chief priests and elders of the people .
40026048	Now the betrayer had given them a sign , saying , The One I shall kiss is the Man ; seize Him .
40026049	And he came up to Jesus at once and said , Hail ( greetings , good health to You , long life to You ) , Master ! And he embraced Him and kissed Him with [ pretended ] warmth and devotion .
40026050	Jesus said to him , Friend , for what are you here ? Then they came up and laid hands on Jesus and arrested Him .
40026051	And behold , one of those who were with Jesus reached out his hand and drew his sword and , striking the body servant of the high priest , cut off his ear .
40026052	Then Jesus said to him , Put your sword back into its place , for all who draw the sword will die by the sword .
40026053	Do you suppose that I cannot appeal to My Father , and He will immediately provide Me with more than twelve legions [ more than 80,000 ] of angels ?
40026054	But how then would the Scriptures be fulfilled , that it must come about this way ?
40026055	At that moment Jesus said to the crowds , Have you come out with swords and clubs as [ you would ] against a robber to capture Me ? Day after day I was accustomed to sit in the porches and courts of the temple teaching , and you did not arrest Me .
40026056	But all this has taken place in order that the Scriptures of the prophets might be fulfilled . Then all the disciples deserted Him and , fleeing , escaped .
40026057	But those who had seized Jesus took Him away to Caiaphas , the high priest , where the scribes and the elders had assembled .
40026058	But Peter followed Him at a distance , as far as the courtyard of the high priest’s home ; he even went inside and sat with the guards to see the end .
40026059	Now the chief priests and the whole council ( the Sanhedrin ) sought to get false witnesses to testify against Jesus , so that they might put Him to death ;
40026060	But they found none , though many witnesses came forward [ to testify ] . At last two men came forward
40026061	And testified , This Fellow said , I am able to tear down the sanctuary of the temple of God and to build it up again in three days .
40026062	And the high priest stood up and said , Have You no answer to make ? What about this that these men testify against You ?
40026063	But Jesus kept silent . And the high priest said to Him , I call upon you to swear by the living God , and tell us whether you are the Christ , the Son of God .

40026065	Then the high priest tore his clothes and exclaimed , He has uttered blasphemy ! What need have we of further evidence ? You have now heard His blasphemy .

40026068	Saying , Prophesy to us , You Christ ( the Messiah ) ! Who was it that struck You ?

40026070	But he denied it falsely before them all , saying , I do not know what you mean .

40026072	And again he denied it and disowned Him with an oath , saying , I do not know the Man !

40026074	Then Peter began to invoke a curse on himself and to swear , I do not even know the Man ! And at that moment a rooster crowed .
40026075	And Peter remembered Jesus’ words , when He had said , Before a single rooster crows , you will deny and disown Me three times . And he went outside and wept bitterly .
40027001	WHEN IT was morning , all the chief priests and the elders of the people held a consultation against Jesus to put Him to death ;
40027002	And they bound Him and led Him away and handed Him over to Pilate the governor .
40027003	When Judas , His betrayer , saw that [ Jesus ] was condemned , [ Judas was afflicted in mind and troubled for his former folly ; and ] with remorse [ with little more than a selfish dread of the consequences ] he brought back the thirty pieces of silver to the chief priests and the elders ,
40027004	Saying , I have sinned in betraying innocent blood . They replied , What is that to us ? See to that yourself .
40027005	And casting the pieces of silver [ forward ] into the [ Holy Place of the sanctuary of the ] temple , he departed ; and he went off and hanged himself .
40027006	But the chief priests , picking up the pieces of silver , said , It is not legal to put these in the [ consecrated ] treasury , for it is the price of blood .
40027007	So after consultation they bought with them [ the pieces of silver ] the potter’s field [ as a place ] in which to bury strangers .
40027008	Therefore that piece of ground has been called the Field of Blood to the present day .
40027009	Then were fulfilled the words spoken by Jeremiah the prophet when he said , And they took the thirty pieces of silver , the price of Him on Whom a price had been set by some of the sons of Israel ,
40027010	And they gave them for the potter’s field , as the Lord directed me .
40027011	Now Jesus stood before the governor [ Pilate ] , and the governor asked Him , Are you the King of the Jews ? Jesus said to him , You have stated [ the fact ] .
40027012	But when the charges were made against Him by the chief priests and elders , He made no answer .
40027013	Then Pilate said to Him , Do You not hear how many and how serious are the things they are testifying against You ?
40027014	But He made no reply to him , not even to a single accusation , so that the governor marveled greatly .
40027015	Now at the Feast [ of the Passover ] the governor was in the habit of setting free for the people any one prisoner whom they chose .
40027016	And at that time they had a notorious prisoner whose name was Barabbas .
40027017	So when they had assembled for this purpose , Pilate said to them , Whom do you want me to set free for you , Barabbas , or Jesus Who is called Christ ?
40027018	For he knew that it was because of envy that they had handed Him over to him .
40027019	Also , while he was seated on the judgment bench , his wife sent him a message , saying , Have nothing to do with that just and upright Man , for I have had a painful experience today in a dream because of Him .
40027020	But the chief priests and the elders prevailed on the people to ask for Barabbas , and put Jesus to death .
40027021	Again the governor said to them , Which of the two do you wish me to release for you ? And they said , Barabbas !
40027022	Pilate said to them , Then what shall I do with Jesus Who is called Christ ?
40027023	They all replied , Let Him be crucified ! And he said , Why ? What has He done that is evil ? But they shouted all the louder , Let Him be crucified !
40027024	So when Pilate saw that he was getting nowhere , but rather that a riot was about to break out , he took water and washed his hands in the presence of the crowd , saying , I am not guilty of nor responsible for this righteous Man’s blood ; see to it yourselves .
40027025	And all the people answered , Let His blood be on us and on our children !
40027026	So he set free for them Barabbas ; and he [ had ] Jesus whipped , and delivered Him up to be crucified .
40027027	Then the governor’s soldiers took Jesus into the palace , and they gathered the whole battalion about Him .
40027028	And they stripped off His clothes and put a scarlet robe ( garment of dignity and office worn by Roman officers of rank ) upon Him ,
40027029	And , weaving a crown of thorns , they put it on His head and put a reed ( staff ) in His right hand . And kneeling before Him , they made sport of Him , saying , Hail ( greetings , good health to You , long life to You ) , King of the Jews !
40027030	And they spat on Him , and took the reed ( staff ) and struck Him on the head .
40027031	And when they finished making sport of Him , they stripped Him of the robe and put His own garments on Him and led Him away to be crucified .
40027032	As they were marching forth , they came upon a man of Cyrene named Simon ; this man they forced to carry the cross of Jesus .
40027033	And when they came to a place called Golgotha [ Latin : Calvary ] , which means The Place of a Skull ,

40027035	And when they had crucified Him , they divided and distributed His garments [ among them ] by casting lots so that the prophet’s saying was fulfilled , They parted My garments among them and over My apparel they cast lots .
40027036	Then they sat down there and kept watch over Him .
