40027038	At the same time two robbers were crucified with Him , one on the right hand and one on the left .
40027039	And those who passed by spoke reproachfully and abusively and jeered at Him , wagging their heads ,
40027040	And they said , You Who would tear down the sanctuary of the temple and rebuild it in three days , rescue Yourself from death . If You are the Son of God , come down from the cross .
40027041	In the same way the chief priests , with the scribes and elders , made sport of Him , saying ,
40027042	He rescued others from death ; Himself He cannot rescue from death . He is the King of Israel ? Let Him come down from the cross now , and we will believe in and acknowledge and cleave to Him .
40027043	He trusts in God ; let God deliver Him now if He cares for Him and will have Him , for He said , I am the Son of God .
40027044	And the robbers who were crucified with Him also abused and reproached and made sport of Him in the same way .
40027045	Now from the sixth hour ( noon ) there was darkness over all the land until the ninth hour ( three o’clock ) .
40027046	And about the ninth hour ( three o’clock ) Jesus cried with a loud voice , Eli , Eli , lama sabachthani ? -- that is , My God , My God , why have You abandoned Me [ leaving Me helpless , forsaking and failing Me in My need ] ?
40027047	And some of the bystanders , when they heard it , said , This Man is calling for Elijah !
40027048	And one of them immediately ran and took a sponge , soaked it with vinegar ( a sour wine ) , and put it on a reed ( staff ) , and was about to give it to Him to drink .
40027049	But the others said , Wait ! Let us see whether Elijah will come to save Him from death .
40027050	And Jesus cried again with a loud voice and gave up His spirit .
40027051	And at once the curtain of the sanctuary of the temple was torn in two from top to bottom ; the earth shook and the rocks were split .
40027052	The tombs were opened and many bodies of the saints who had fallen asleep in death were raised [ to life ] ;
40027053	And coming out of the tombs after His resurrection , they went into the holy city and appeared to many people .
40027054	When the centurion and those who were with him keeping watch over Jesus observed the earthquake and all that was happening , they were terribly frightened and filled with awe , and said , Truly this was God’s Son !
40027055	There were also numerous women there , looking on from a distance , who were of those who had accompanied Jesus from Galilee , ministering to Him .
40027056	Among them were Mary of Magdala , and Mary the mother of James and Joseph , and the mother of Zebedee’s sons .
40027057	When it was evening , there came a rich man from Arimathea , named Joseph , who also was a disciple of Jesus .
40027058	He went to Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus , and Pilate ordered that it be given to him .
40027059	And Joseph took the body and rolled it up in a clean linen cloth used for swathing dead bodies
40027060	And laid it in his own fresh ( undefiled ) tomb , which he had hewn in the rock ; and he rolled a big boulder over the door of the tomb and went away .
40027061	And Mary of Magdala and the other Mary kept sitting there opposite the tomb .
40027062	The next day , that is , the day after the day of Preparation [ for the Sabbath ] , the chief priests and the Pharisees assembled before Pilate
40027063	And said , Sir , we have just remembered how that vagabond Imposter said while He was still alive , After three days I will rise again .
40027064	Therefore give an order to have the tomb made secure and safeguarded until the third day , for fear that His disciples will come and steal Him away and tell the people that He has risen from the dead , and the last deception and fraud will be worse than the first .
40027065	Pilate said to them , You have a guard [ of soldiers ; take them and ] go , make it as secure as you can .
40027066	So they went off and made the tomb secure by sealing the boulder , a guard of soldiers being with them and remaining to watch .
40028001	NOW AFTER the Sabbath , near dawn of the first day of the week , Mary of Magdala and the other Mary went to take a look at the tomb .
40028002	And behold , there was a great earthquake , for an angel of the Lord descended from heaven and came and rolled the boulder back and sat upon it .
40028003	His appearance was like lightning , and his garments as white as snow .
40028004	And those keeping guard were so frightened at the sight of him that they were agitated and they trembled and became like dead men .
40028005	But the angel said to the women , Do not be alarmed and frightened , for I know that you are looking for Jesus , Who was crucified .
40028006	He is not here ; He has risen , as He said [ He would do ] . Come , see the place where He lay .
40028007	Then go quickly and tell His disciples , He has risen from the dead , and behold , He is going before you to Galilee ; there you will see Him . Behold , I have told you .
40028008	So they left the tomb hastily with fear and great joy and ran to tell the disciples .
40028009	And as they went , behold , Jesus met them and said , Hail ( greetings ) ! And they went up to Him and clasped His feet and worshiped Him .
40028010	Then Jesus said to them , Do not be alarmed and afraid ; go and tell My brethren to go into Galilee , and there they will see Me .
40028011	While they were on their way , behold , some of the guards went into the city and reported to the chief priests everything that had occurred .
40028012	And when they [ the chief priests ] had gathered with the elders and had consulted together , they gave a sufficient sum of money to the soldiers ,
40028013	And said , Tell people , His disciples came at night and stole Him away while we were sleeping .
40028014	And if the governor hears of it , we will appease him and make you safe and free from trouble and care .
40028015	So they took the money and did as they were instructed ; and this story has been current among the Jews to the present day .
40028016	Now the eleven disciples went to Galilee , to the mountain to which Jesus had directed and made appointment with them .
40028017	And when they saw Him , they fell down and worshiped Him ; but some doubted .
40028018	Jesus approached and , breaking the silence , said to them , All authority ( all power of rule ) in heaven and on earth has been given to Me .
40028019	Go then and make disciples of all the nations , baptizing them into the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit ,
40028020	Teaching them to observe everything that I have commanded you , and behold , I am with you all the days ( perpetually , uniformly , and on every occasion ) , to the [ very ] close and consummation of the age . Amen ( so let it be ) .
41001001	THE BEGINNING [ of the facts ] of the good news ( the Gospel ) of Jesus Christ , the Son of God .
41001002	Just as it is written in the prophet Isaiah : Behold , I send My messenger before Your face , who will make ready Your way --
41001003	A voice of one crying in the wilderness [ shouting in the desert ] , Prepare the way of the Lord , make His beaten tracks straight ( level and passable ) !
41001004	John the Baptist appeared in the wilderness ( desert ) , preaching a baptism [ obligating ] repentance ( a change of one’s mind for the better , heartily amending one’s ways , with abhorrence of his past sins ) in order to obtain forgiveness of and release from sins .
41001005	And there kept going out to him [ continuously ] all the country of Judea and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem ; and they were baptized by him in the river Jordan , as they were confessing their sins .
41001006	And John wore clothing woven of camel’s hair and had a leather girdle around his loins and ate locusts and wild honey .
41001007	And he preached , saying , After me comes He Who is stronger ( more powerful and more valiant ) than I , the strap of Whose sandals I am not worthy or fit to stoop down and unloose .
41001008	I have baptized you with water , but He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit .
41001009	In those days Jesus came from Nazareth of Galilee and was baptized by John in the Jordan .
41001010	And when He came up out of the water , at once he [ John ] saw the heavens torn open and the [ Holy ] Spirit like a dove coming down [ to enter ] into Him .
41001011	And there came a voice out from within heaven , You are My Beloved Son ; in You I am well pleased .
41001012	Immediately the [ Holy ] Spirit [ from within ] drove Him out into the wilderness ( desert ) ,
41001013	And He stayed in the wilderness ( desert ) forty days , being tempted [ all the while ] by Satan ; and He was with the wild beasts , and the angels ministered to Him [ continually ] .
41001014	Now after John was arrested and put in prison , Jesus came into Galilee , preaching the good news ( the Gospel ) of the kingdom of God ,
41001015	And saying , The [ appointed period of ] time is fulfilled ( completed ) , and the kingdom of God is at hand ; repent ( have a change of mind which issues in regret for past sins and in change of conduct for the better ) and believe ( trust in , rely on , and adhere to ) the good news ( the Gospel ) .
41001016	And passing along the shore of the Sea of Galilee , He saw Simon [ Peter ] and Andrew the brother of Simon casting a net [ to and fro ] in the sea , for they were fishermen .
41001017	And Jesus said to them , Come after Me and be My disciples , and I will make you to become fishers of men .
41001018	And at once they left their nets and [ yielding up all claim to them ] followed [ with ] Him [ joining Him as disciples and siding with His party ] .
41001019	He went on a little farther and saw James the son of Zebedee , and John his brother , who were in [ their ] boat putting their nets in order .
41001020	And immediately He called out to them , and [ abandoning all mutual claims ] they left their father Zebedee in the boat with the hired men and went off after Him [ to be His disciples , side with His party , and follow Him ] .
41001021	And they entered into Capernaum , and immediately on the Sabbath He went into the synagogue and began to teach .
41001022	And they were completely astonished at His teaching , for He was teaching as One Who possessed authority , and not as the scribes .
41001023	Just at that time there was in their synagogue a man [ who was in the power ] of an unclean spirit ; and now [ immediately ] he raised a deep and terrible cry from the depths of his throat , saying ,
41001024	What have You to do with us , Jesus of Nazareth ? Have You come to destroy us ? I know who You are -- the Holy One of God !
41001025	And Jesus rebuked him , saying , Hush up ( be muzzled , gagged ) , and come out of him !
41001026	And the unclean spirit , throwing the man into convulsions and screeching with a loud voice , came out of him .
41001027	And they were all so amazed and almost terrified that they kept questioning and demanding one of another , saying , What is this ? What new ( fresh ) teaching ! With authority He gives orders even to the unclean spirits and they obey Him !
41001028	And immediately rumors concerning Him spread [ everywhere ] throughout all the region surrounding Galilee .
41001029	And at once He left the synagogue and went into the house of Simon [ Peter ] and Andrew , accompanied by James and John .
41001030	Now Simon’s mother-in-law had for some time been lying sick with a fever , and at once they told Him about her .
41001031	And He went up to her and took her by the hand and raised her up ; and the fever left her , and she began to wait on them .
41001032	Now when it was evening , after the sun had set , they brought to Him all who were sick and those under the power of demons ,
41001033	Until the whole town was gathered together about the door .
41001034	And He cured many who were afflicted with various diseases ; and He drove out many demons , but would not allow the demons to talk because they knew Him [ intuitively ] .
41001035	And in the morning , long before daylight , He got up and went out to a deserted place , and there He prayed .
41001036	And Simon [ Peter ] and those who were with him followed Him [ pursuing Him eagerly and hunting Him out ] ,
41001037	And they found Him and said to Him , Everybody is looking for You .
41001038	And He said to them , Let us be going on into the neighboring country towns , that I may preach there also ; for that is why I came out .
41001039	[ So ] He went throughout the whole of Galilee , preaching in their synagogues and driving out demons .
41001040	And a leper came to Him , begging Him on his knees and saying to Him , If You are willing , You are able to make me clean .
41001041	And being moved with pity and sympathy , Jesus reached out His hand and touched him , and said to him , I am willing ; be made clean !
41001042	And at once the leprosy [ completely ] left him and he was made clean [ by being healed ] .
41001043	And Jesus charged him sternly ( sharply and threateningly , and with earnest admonition ) and [ acting with deep feeling thrust him forth and ] sent him away at once ,
41001044	And said to him , See that you tell nothing [ of this ] to anyone ; but begone , show yourself to the priest , and offer for your purification what Moses commanded , as a proof ( an evidence and witness ) to the people [ that you are really healed ] .
41001045	But he went out and began to talk so freely about it and blaze abroad the news [ spreading it everywhere ] that [ Jesus ] could no longer openly go into a town but was outside in [ lonely ] desert places . But the people kept on coming to Him from all sides and every quarter .
41002001	AND JESUS having returned to Capernaum , after some days it was rumored about that He was in the house [ probably Peter’s ] .
41002002	And so many people gathered together there that there was no longer room [ for them ] , not even around the door ; and He was discussing the Word .
41002003	Then they came , bringing a paralytic to Him , who had been picked up and was being carried by four men .
41002004	And when they could not get him to a place in front of Jesus because of the throng , they dug through the roof above Him ; and when they had scooped out an opening , they let down the [ thickly padded ] quilt or mat upon which the paralyzed man lay .
41002005	And when Jesus saw their faith [ their confidence in God through Him ] , He said to the paralyzed man , Son , your sins are forgiven [ you ] and put away [ that is , the penalty is remitted , the sense of guilt removed , and you are made upright and in right standing with God ] .
41002006	Now some of the scribes were sitting there , holding a dialogue with themselves as they questioned in their hearts ,
41002007	Why does this Man talk like this ? He is blaspheming ! Who can forgive sins [ remove guilt , remit the penalty , and bestow righteousness instead ] except God alone ?
41002008	And at once Jesus , becoming fully aware in His spirit that they thus debated within themselves , said to them , Why do you argue ( debate , reason ) about all this in your hearts ?
41002009	Which is easier : to say to the paralyzed man , Your sins are forgiven and put away , or to say , Rise , take up your sleeping pad or mat , and start walking about [ and keep on walking ] ?
41002010	But that you may know positively and beyond a doubt that the Son of Man has right and authority and power on earth to forgive sins -- He said to the paralyzed man ,
41002011	I say to you , arise , pick up and carry your sleeping pad or mat , and be going on home .
41002012	And he arose at once and picked up the sleeping pad or mat and went out before them all , so that they were all amazed and recognized and praised and thanked God , saying , We have never seen anything like this before !
41002013	[ Jesus ] went out again along the seashore ; and all the multitude kept gathering about Him , and He kept teaching them .
41002014	And as He was passing by , He saw Levi ( Matthew ) son of Alphaeus sitting at the tax office , and He said to him , Follow Me ! [ Be joined to Me as a disciple , side with My party ! ] And he arose and joined Him as His disciple and sided with His party and accompanied Him .
41002015	And as Jesus , together with His disciples , sat at table in his [ Levi’s ] house , many tax collectors and persons [ definitely stained ] with sin were dining with Him , for there were many who walked the same road ( followed ) with Him .
41002016	And the scribes [ belonging to the party ] of the Pharisees , when they saw that He was eating with [ those definitely known to be especially wicked ] sinners and tax collectors , said to His disciples , Why does He eat and drink with tax collectors and [ notorious ] sinners ?
41002017	And when Jesus heard it , He said to them , Those who are strong and well have no need of a physician , but those who are weak and sick ; I came not to call the righteous ones to repentance , but sinners ( the erring ones and all those not free from sin ) .
41002018	Now John’s disciples and the Pharisees were observing a fast ; and [ some people ] came and asked Jesus , Why are John’s disciples and the disciples of the Pharisees fasting , but Your disciples are not doing so ?
41002019	Jesus answered them , Can the wedding guests fast ( abstain from food and drink ) while the bridegroom is with them ? As long as they have the bridegroom with them , they cannot fast .
41002020	But the days will come when the bridegroom will be taken away from them , and they will fast in that day .
41002021	No one sews a patch of unshrunken ( new ) goods on an old garment ; if he does , the patch tears away from it , the new from the old , and the rent ( tear ) becomes bigger and worse [ than it was before ] .
41002022	And no one puts new wine into old wineskins ; if he does , the wine will burst the skins , and the wine is lost and the bottles destroyed ; but new wine is to be put in new ( fresh ) wineskins .
41002023	One Sabbath He was going along beside the fields of standing grain , and as they made their way , His disciples began to pick off the grains .
41002024	And the Pharisees said to Him , Look ! Why are they doing what is not permitted or lawful on the Sabbath ?
41002025	And He said to them , Have you never [ even ] read what David did when he was in need and was hungry , he and those who were accompanying him ? --
41002026	How he went into the house of God when Abiathar was the high priest , and ate the sacred loaves set forth [ before God ] , which it is not permitted or lawful for any but the priests to eat , and [ how he ] also gave [ them ] to those who were with him ?
41002027	And Jesus said to them , The Sabbath was made on account and for the sake of man , not man for the Sabbath ;
41002028	So the Son of Man is Lord even of the Sabbath .
41003001	AGAIN JESUS went into a synagogue , and a man was there who had one withered hand [ as the result of accident or disease ] .
41003002	And [ the Pharisees ] kept watching Jesus [ closely ] to see whether He would cure him on the Sabbath , so that they might get a charge to bring against Him [ formally ] .
41003003	And He said to the man who had the withered hand , Get up [ and stand here ] in the midst .
41003004	And He said to them , Is it lawful and right on the Sabbath to do good or to do evil , to save life or to take it ? But they kept silence .
41003005	And He glanced around at them with vexation and anger , grieved at the hardening of their hearts , and said to the man , Hold out your hand . He held it out , and his hand was [ completely ] restored .
41003006	Then the Pharisees went out and immediately held a consultation with the Herodians against Him , how they might [ devise some means to ] put Him to death .
41003007	And Jesus retired with His disciples to the lake , and a great throng from Galilee followed Him . Also from Judea
41003008	And from Jerusalem and Idumea and from beyond the Jordan and from about Tyre and Sidon -- a vast multitude , hearing all the many things that He was doing , came to Him .
41003009	And He told His disciples to have a little boat in [ constant ] readiness for Him because of the crowd , lest they press hard upon Him and crush Him .
41003010	For He had healed so many that all who had distressing bodily diseases kept falling upon Him and pressing upon Him in order that they might touch Him .
41003011	And the spirits , the unclean ones , as often as they might see Him , fell down before Him and kept screaming out , You are the Son of God !
41003012	And He charged them strictly and severely under penalty again and again that they should not make Him known .
41003013	And He went up on the hillside and called to Him [ for Himself ] those whom He wanted and chose , and they came to Him .
41003014	And He appointed twelve to continue to be with Him , and that He might send them out to preach [ as apostles or special messengers ]
41003015	And to have authority and power to heal the sick and to drive out demons :
41003016	[ They were ] Simon , and He surnamed [ him ] Peter ;
41003017	James son of Zebedee and John the brother of James , and He surnamed them Boanerges , that is , Sons of Thunder ;
41003018	And Andrew , and Philip , and Bartholomew ( Nathaniel ) , and Matthew , and Thomas , and James son of Alphaeus , and Thaddaeus ( Judas , not Iscariot ) , and Simon the Cananaean [ also called Zelotes ] ,
41003019	And Judas Iscariot , he who betrayed Him .
41003020	Then He went to a house [ probably Peter’s ] , but a throng came together again , so that Jesus and His disciples could not even take food .
41003021	And when those who belonged to Him ( His kinsmen ) heard it , they went out to take Him by force , for they kept saying , He is out of His mind ( beside Himself , deranged ) !
41003022	And the scribes who came down from Jerusalem said , He is possessed by Beelzebub , and , By [ the help of ] the prince of demons He is casting out demons .
41003023	And He summoned them to Him and said to them in parables ( illustrations or comparisons put beside truths to explain them ) , How can Satan drive out Satan ?
41003024	And if a kingdom is divided and rebelling against itself , that kingdom cannot stand .
41003025	And if a house is divided ( split into factions and rebelling ) against itself , that house will not be able to last .
41003026	And if Satan has raised an insurrection against himself and is divided , he cannot stand but is [ surely ] coming to an end .
41003027	But no one can go into a strong man’s house and ransack his household goods right and left and seize them as plunder unless he first binds the strong man ; then indeed he may [ thoroughly ] plunder his house .
41003028	Truly and solemnly I say to you , all sins will be forgiven the sons of men , and whatever abusive and blasphemous things they utter ;
41003029	But whoever speaks abusively against or maliciously misrepresents the Holy Spirit can never get forgiveness , but is guilty of and is in the grasp of an everlasting trespass .
41003030	For they persisted in saying , He has an unclean spirit .
41003031	Then His mother and His brothers came and , standing outside , they sent word to Him , calling [ for ] Him .
41003032	And a crowd was sitting around Him , and they said to Him , Your mother and Your brothers and Your sisters are outside asking for You .
41003033	And He replied , Who are My mother and My brothers ?
41003034	And looking around on those who sat in a circle about Him , He said , See ! Here are My mother and My brothers ;
41003035	For whoever does the things God wills is My brother and sister and mother !
41004001	AGAIN JESUS began to teach beside the lake . And a very great crowd gathered about Him , so that He got into a ship in order to sit in it on the sea , and the whole crowd was at the lakeside on the shore .
41004002	And He taught them many things in parables ( illustrations or comparisons put beside truths to explain them ) , and in His teaching He said to them :
41004003	Give attention to this ! Behold , a sower went out to sow .
41004004	And as he was sowing , some seed fell along the path , and the birds came and ate it up .
41004005	Other seed [ of the same kind ] fell on ground full of rocks , where it had not much soil ; and at once it sprang up , because it had no depth of soil ;
41004006	And when the sun came up , it was scorched , and because it had not taken root , it withered away .
41004007	Other seed [ of the same kind ] fell among thorn plants , and the thistles grew and pressed together and utterly choked and suffocated it , and it yielded no grain .
41004008	And other seed [ of the same kind ] fell into good ( well-adapted ) soil and brought forth grain , growing up and increasing , and yielded up to thirty times as much , and sixty times as much , and even a hundred times as much as had been sown .
41004009	And He said , He who has ears to hear , let him be hearing [ and let him consider , and comprehend ] .
41004010	And as soon as He was alone , those who were around Him , with the Twelve [ apostles ] , began to ask Him about the parables .
41004011	And He said to them , To you has been entrusted the mystery of the kingdom of God [ that is , the secret counsels of God which are hidden from the ungodly ] ; but for those outside [ of our circle ] everything becomes a parable ,
41004012	In order that they may [ indeed ] look and look but not see and perceive , and may hear and hear but not grasp and comprehend , lest haply they should turn again , and it [ their willful rejection of the truth ] should be forgiven them .
41004013	And He said to them , Do you not discern and understand this parable ? How then is it possible for you to discern and understand all the parables ?
41004014	The sower sows the Word .
41004015	The ones along the path are those who have the Word sown [ in their hearts ] , but when they hear , Satan comes at once and [ by force ] takes away the message which is sown in them .
41004016	And in the same way the ones sown upon stony ground are those who , when they hear the Word , at once receive and accept and welcome it with joy ;
41004017	And they have no real root in themselves , and so they endure for a little while ; then when trouble or persecution arises on account of the Word , they immediately are offended ( become displeased , indignant , resentful ) and they stumble and fall away .
41004018	And the ones sown among the thorns are others who hear the Word ;
41004019	Then the cares and anxieties of the world and distractions of the age , and the pleasure and delight and false glamour and deceitfulness of riches , and the craving and passionate desire for other things creep in and choke and suffocate the Word , and it becomes fruitless .
41004020	And those sown on the good ( well-adapted ) soil are the ones who hear the Word and receive and accept and welcome it and bear fruit -- some thirty times as much as was sown , some sixty times as much , and some [ even ] a hundred times as much .
41004021	And He said to them , Is the lamp brought in to be put under a peck measure or under a bed , and not [ to be put ] on the lampstand ?
41004022	[ Things are hidden temporarily only as a means to revelation . ] For there is nothing hidden except to be revealed , nor is anything [ temporarily ] kept secret except in order that it may be made known .
41004023	If any man has ears to hear , let him be listening and let him perceive and comprehend .
41004024	And He said to them , Be careful what you are hearing . The measure [ of thought and study ] you give [ to the truth you hear ] will be the measure [ of virtue and knowledge ] that comes back to you -- and more [ besides ] will be given to you who hear .
41004025	For to him who has will more be given ; and from him who has nothing , even what he has will be taken away [ by force ] ,
41004026	And He said , The kingdom of God is like a man who scatters seed upon the ground ,
41004027	And then continues sleeping and rising night and day while the seed sprouts and grows and increases -- he knows not how .
41004028	The earth produces [ acting ] by itself -- first the blade , then the ear , then the full grain in the ear .
41004029	But when the grain is ripe and permits , immediately he sends forth [ the reapers ] and puts in the sickle , because the harvest stands ready .
41004030	And He said , With what can we compare the kingdom of God , or what parable shall we use to illustrate and explain it ?
41004031	It is like a grain of mustard seed , which , when sown upon the ground , is the smallest of all seeds upon the earth ;
41004032	Yet after it is sown , it grows up and becomes the greatest of all garden herbs and puts out large branches , so that the birds of the air are able to make nests and dwell in its shade .
41004033	With many such parables [ Jesus ] spoke the Word to them , as they were able to hear and to comprehend and understand .
41004034	He did not tell them anything without a parable ; but privately to His disciples ( those who were peculiarly His own ) He explained everything [ fully ] .
41004035	On that same day [ when ] evening had come , He said to them , Let us go over to the other side [ of the lake ] .
41004036	And leaving the throng , they took Him with them , [ just ] as He was , in the boat [ in which He was sitting ] . And other boats were with Him .
41004037	And a furious storm of wind [ of hurricane proportions ] arose , and the waves kept beating into the boat , so that it was already becoming filled .
41004038	But He [ Himself ] was in the stern [ of the boat ] , asleep on the [ leather ] cushion ; and they awoke Him and said to Him , Master , do You not care that we are perishing ?
41004039	And He arose and rebuked the wind and said to the sea , Hush now ! Be still ( muzzled ) ! And the wind ceased ( sank to rest as if exhausted by its beating ) and there was [ immediately ] a great calm ( a perfect peacefulness ) .
41004040	He said to them , Why are you so timid and fearful ? How is it that you have no faith ( no firmly relying trust ) ?
41004041	And they were filled with great awe and feared exceedingly and said one to another , Who then is this , that even wind and sea obey Him ?
41005001	THEY CAME to the other side of the sea to the region of the Gerasenes .
41005002	And as soon as He got out of the boat , there met Him out of the tombs a man [ under the power ] of an unclean spirit .
41005003	This man continually lived among the tombs , and no one could subdue him any more , even with a chain ;
41005004	For he had been bound often with shackles for the feet and handcuffs , but the handcuffs of [ light ] chains he wrenched apart , and the shackles he rubbed and ground together and broke in pieces ; and no one had strength enough to restrain or tame him .
41005005	Night and day among the tombs and on the mountains he was always shrieking and screaming and beating and bruising and cutting himself with stones .
41005006	And when from a distance he saw Jesus , he ran and fell on his knees before Him in homage ,
41005007	And crying out with a loud voice , he said , What have You to do with me , Jesus , Son of the Most High God ? [ What is there in common between us ? ] I solemnly implore you by God , do not begin to torment me !
41005008	For Jesus was commanding , Come out of the man , you unclean spirit !
41005009	And He asked him , What is your name ? He replied , My name is Legion , for we are many .
41005010	And he kept begging Him urgently not to send them [ himself and the other demons ] away out of that region .
41005011	Now a great herd of hogs was grazing there on the hillside .
41005012	And the demons begged Him , saying , Send us to the hogs , that we may go into them !
41005013	So He gave them permission . And the unclean spirits came out [ of the man ] and entered into the hogs ; and the herd , numbering about 2,000 , rushed headlong down the steep slope into the sea and were drowned in the sea .
41005014	The hog feeders ran away , and told [ it ] in the town and in the country . And [ the people ] came to see what it was that had taken place .
41005015	And they came to Jesus and looked intently and searchingly at the man who had been a demoniac , sitting there , clothed and in his right mind , [ the same man ] who had had the legion [ of demons ] ; and they were seized with alarm and struck with fear .
41005016	And those who had seen it related in full what had happened to the man possessed by demons and to the hogs .

41005022	Then one of the rulers of the synagogue came up , Jairus by name ; and seeing Him , he prostrated himself at His feet

41005024	And Jesus went with him ; and a great crowd kept following Him and pressed Him from all sides [ so as almost to suffocate Him ] .
41005025	And there was a woman who had had a flow of blood for twelve years ,
41005026	And who had endured much suffering under [ the hands of ] many physicians and had spent all that she had , and was no better but instead grew worse .

41005028	For she kept saying , If I only touch His garments , I shall be restored to health .
41005029	And immediately her flow of blood was dried up at the source , and [ suddenly ] she felt in her body that she was healed of her [ distressing ] ailment .
41005030	And Jesus , recognizing in Himself that the power proceeding from Him had gone forth , turned around immediately in the crowd and said , Who touched My clothes ?
41005031	And the disciples kept saying to Him , You see the crowd pressing hard around You from all sides , and You ask , Who touched Me ?
41005032	Still He kept looking around to see her who had done it .
41005033	But the woman , knowing what had been done for her , though alarmed and frightened and trembling , fell down before Him and told Him the whole truth .
41005034	And He said to her , Daughter , your faith ( your trust and confidence in Me , springing from faith in God ) has restored you to health . Go in ( into ) peace and be continually healed and freed from your [ distressing bodily ] disease .
41005035	While He was still speaking , there came some from the ruler’s house , who said [ to Jairus ] , Your daughter has died . Why bother and distress the Teacher any further ?
41005036	Overhearing but ignoring what they said , Jesus said to the ruler of the synagogue , Do not be seized with alarm and struck with fear ; only keep on believing .
41005037	And He permitted no one to accompany Him except Peter and James and John the brother of James .
41005038	When they arrived at the house of the ruler of the synagogue , He looked [ carefully and with understanding ] at [ the ] tumult and the people weeping and wailing loudly .
41005039	And when He had gone in , He said to them , Why do you make an uproar and weep ? The little girl is not dead but is sleeping .

41005042	And instantly the girl got up and started walking around -- for she was twelve years old . And they were utterly astonished and overcome with amazement .
41005043	And He strictly commanded and warned them that no one should know this , and He [ expressly ] told them to give her [ something ] to eat .
41006001	JESUS WENT away from there and came to His [ own ] country and hometown [ Nazareth ] , and His disciples followed [ with ] Him .
41006002	And on the Sabbath He began to teach in the synagogue ; and many who listened to Him were utterly astonished , saying , Where did this Man acquire all this ? What is the wisdom [ the broad and full intelligence which has been ] given to Him ? What mighty works and exhibitions of power are wrought by His hands !
41006003	Is not this the Carpenter , the son of Mary and the brother of James and Joses and Judas and Simon ? And are not His sisters here among us ? 41006004	But Jesus said to them , A prophet is not without honor ( deference , reverence ) except in his [ own ] country and among [ his ] relatives and in his [ own ] house .

Truly I tell you , it will be more tolerable for Sodom and Gomorrah in the judgment day than for that town .

41007001	NOW THERE gathered together to [ Jesus ] the Pharisees and some of the scribes who had come from Jerusalem ,
41007002	For they had seen that some of His disciples ate with common hands , that is , unwashed [ with hands defiled and unhallowed , because they had not given them a ceremonial washing ] --
41007003	For the Pharisees and all of the Jews do not eat unless [ merely for ceremonial reasons ] they wash their hands [ diligently up to the elbow ] with clenched fist , adhering [ carefully and faithfully ] to the tradition of [ practices and customs handed down to them by ] their forefathers [ to be observed ] .
41007004	And [ when they come ] from the marketplace , they do not eat unless they purify themselves ; and there are many other traditions [ oral , man-made laws handed down to them , which they observe faithfully and diligently , such as ] , the washing of cups and wooden pitchers and widemouthed jugs and utensils of copper and beds --
41007005	And the Pharisees and scribes kept asking [ Jesus ] , Why do Your disciples not order their way of living according to the tradition handed down by the forefathers [ to be observed ] , but eat with hands unwashed and ceremonially not purified ?
41007006	But He said to them , Excellently and truly [ so that there will be no room for blame ] did Isaiah prophesy of you , the pretenders and hypocrites , as it stands written : These people [ constantly ] honor Me with their lips , but their hearts hold off and are far distant from Me .

41007008	You disregard and give up and ask to depart from you the commandment of God and cling to the tradition of men [ keeping it carefully and faithfully ] .
41007009	And He said to them , You have a fine way of rejecting [ thus thwarting and nullifying and doing away with ] the commandment of God in order to keep your tradition ( your own human regulations ) !
41007010	For Moses said , Honor ( revere with tenderness of feeling and deference ) your father and your mother , and , He who curses or reviles or speaks evil of or abuses or treats improperly his father or mother , let him surely die .
41007011	But [ as for you ] you say , A man is exempt if he tells [ his ] father or [ his ] mother , What you would otherwise have gained from me [ everything I have that would have been of use to you ] is Corban , that is , is a gift [ already given as an offering to God ] ,
41007012	Then you no longer are permitting him to do anything for [ his ] father or mother [ but are letting him off from helping them ] .
41007013	Thus you are nullifying and making void and of no effect [ the authority of ] the Word of God through your tradition , which you [ in turn ] hand on . And many things of this kind you are doing .
41007014	And He called the people to [ Him ] again and said to them , Listen to Me , all of you , and understand [ what I say ] .
41007015	There is not [ even ] one thing outside a man which by going into him can pollute and defile him ; but the things which come out of a man are what defile him and make him unhallowed and unclean .
41007016	If any man has ears to hear , let him be listening [ and let him perceive and comprehend by hearing ] .

41007018	And He said to them , Then are you also unintelligent and dull and without understanding ? Do you not discern and see that whatever goes into a man from the outside cannot make him unhallowed or unclean ,
41007019	Since it does not reach and enter his heart but [ only his ] digestive tract , and so passes on [ into the place designed to receive waste ] ? Thus He was making and declaring all foods [ ceremonially ] clean [ that is , abolishing the ceremonial distinctions of the Levitical Law ] .
41007020	And He said , What comes out of a man is what makes a man unclean and renders [ him ] unhallowed .
41007021	For from within , [ that is ] out of the hearts of men , come base and wicked thoughts , sexual immorality , stealing , murder , adultery ,
41007022	Coveting ( a greedy desire to have more wealth ) , dangerous and destructive wickedness , deceit ; unrestrained ( indecent ) conduct ; an evil eye ( envy ) , slander ( evil speaking , malicious misrepresentation , abusiveness ) , pride ( the sin of an uplifted heart against God and man ) , foolishness ( folly , lack of sense , recklessness , thoughtlessness ) .
41007023	All these evil [ purposes and desires ] come from within , and they make the man unclean and render him unhallowed .
41007024	And Jesus arose and went away from there to the region of Tyre and Sidon . And He went into a house and did not want anyone to know [ that He was there ] ; but it was not possible for Him to be hidden [ from public notice ] .

41009031	For He was [ engaged for the time being in ] teaching His disciples . He said to them , The Son of Man is being delivered into the hands of men , and they will put Him to death ; and when He has been killed , after three days He will rise [ from death ] .
41009032	But they did not comprehend what He was saying , and they were afraid to ask Him [ what this statement meant ] .
41009033	And they arrived at Capernaum ; and when [ they were ] in the house , He asked them , What were you discussing and arguing about on the road ?
41009034	But they kept still , for on the road they had discussed and disputed with one another as to who was the greatest .
41009035	And He sat down and called the Twelve [ apostles ] , and He said to them , If anyone desires to be first , he must be last of all , and servant of all .
41009036	And He took a little child and put him in the center of their group ; and taking him in [ His ] arms , He said to them ,
41009037	Whoever in My name and for My sake accepts and receives and welcomes one such child also accepts and receives and welcomes Me ; and whoever so receives Me receives not only Me but Him Who sent Me .
41009038	John said to Him , Teacher , we saw a man who does not follow along with us driving out demons in Your name , and we forbade him to do it , because he is not one of our band [ of Your disciples ] .
41009039	But Jesus said , Do not restrain or hinder or forbid him ; for no one who does a mighty work in My name will soon afterward be able to speak evil of Me .
41009040	For he who is not against us is for us .
41009041	For I tell you truly , whoever gives you a cup of water to drink because you belong to and bear the name of Christ will by no means fail to get his reward .
41009042	And whoever causes one of these little ones ( these believers ) who acknowledge and cleave to Me to stumble and sin , it would be better ( more profitable and wholesome ) for him if a [ huge ] millstone were hung about his neck , and he were thrown into the sea .
41009043	And if your hand puts a stumbling block before you and causes you to sin , cut it off ! It is more profitable and wholesome for you to go into life [ that is really worthwhile ] maimed than with two hands to go to hell ( Gehenna ) , into the fire that cannot be put out .
41009045	And if your foot is a cause of stumbling and sin to you , cut it off ! It is more profitable and wholesome for you to enter into life [ that is really worthwhile ] crippled than , having two feet , to be cast into hell ( Gehenna ) .
41009047	And if your eye causes you to stumble and sin , pluck it out ! It is more profitable and wholesome for you to enter the kingdom of God with one eye than with two eyes to be thrown into hell ( Gehenna ) ,
41009048	Where their worm [ which preys on the inhabitants and is a symbol of the wounds inflicted on the man himself by his sins ] does not die , and the fire is not put out .
41009049	For everyone shall be salted with fire .
41009050	Salt is good ( beneficial ) , but if salt has lost its saltness , how will you restore [ the saltness to ] it ? Have salt within yourselves , and be at peace and live in harmony with one another .
41010001	AND [ Jesus ] left there [ Capernaum ] and went to the region of Judea and beyond [ east of ] the Jordan ; and crowds [ constantly ] gathered around Him again , and as was His custom , He began to teach them again .
41010002	And some Pharisees came up , and , in order to test Him and try to find a weakness in Him , asked , Is it lawful for a man to dismiss and repudiate and divorce his wife ?
41010003	He answered them , What did Moses command you ?
41010004	They replied , Moses allowed a man to write a bill of divorce and to put her away .

41012001	AND [ Jesus ] started to speak to them in parables [ with comparisons and illustrations ] . A man planted a vineyard and put a hedge around it and dug a pit for the winepress and built a tower and let it out [ for rent ] to vinedressers and went into another country .

41013029	So also , when you see these things happening , you may recognize and know that He is near , at [ the very ] door .
41013030	Surely I say to you , this generation ( the whole multitude of people living at that one time ) positively will not perish or pass away before all these things take place .
41013031	Heaven and earth will perish and pass away , but My words will not perish or pass away .
41013032	But of that day or that hour not a [ single ] person knows , not even the angels in heaven , nor the Son , but only the Father .
41013033	Be on your guard [ constantly alert ] , and watch and pray ; for you do not know when the time will come .
41013034	It is like a man [ already ] going on a journey ; when he leaves home , he puts his servants in charge , each with his particular task , and he gives orders to the doorkeeper to be constantly alert and on the watch .
41013035	Therefore watch ( give strict attention , be cautious and alert ) , for you do not know when the Master of the house is coming -- in the evening , or at midnight , or at cockcrowing , or in the morning --
41013036	[ Watch , I say ] lest He come suddenly and unexpectedly and find you asleep .
41013037	And what I say to you I say to everybody : Watch ( give strict attention , be cautious , active , and alert ) !
41014001	IT WAS now two days before the Passover and the Feast of Unleavened Bread , and the chief priests and the scribes were all the while seeking to arrest [ Jesus ] by secrecy and deceit and put [ Him ] to death ,
41014002	For they kept saying , It must not be during the Feast , for fear that there might be a riot of the people .

41014004	But there were some who were moved with indignation and said to themselves , To what purpose was the ointment ( perfume ) thus wasted ?
41014005	For it was possible to have sold this [ perfume ] for more than 300 denarii [ a laboring man’s wages for a year ] and to have given [ the money ] to the poor . And they censured and reproved her .

41014011	And when they heard it , they rejoiced and were delighted , and they promised to give him money . And he [ busying himself continually ] sought an opportunity to betray Him .
41014012	On the first day [ of the Feast ] of Unleavened Bread , when [ as was customary ] they killed the Passover lamb , [ Jesus’ ] disciples said to Him , Where do You wish us to go [ and ] prepare the Passover [ supper ] for You to eat ?
41014013	And He sent two of His disciples and said to them , Go into the city , and a man carrying an [ earthen ] jar or pitcher of water will meet you ; follow him .
41014014	And whatever [ house ] he enters , say to the master of the house , The Teacher says : Where is My guest room , where I may eat the Passover [ supper ] with My disciples ?
41014015	And he will [ himself ] show you a large upper room , furnished [ with carpets and with dining couches properly spread ] and ready ; there prepare for us .
41014016	Then the disciples set out and came to the city and found [ everything ] just as He had told them ; and they prepared the Passover .
41014017	And when it was evening , He came with the Twelve [ apostles ] .
41014018	And while they were at the table eating , Jesus said , Surely I say to you , one of you will betray Me , [ one ] who is eating [ here ] with Me .
41014019	And they began to show that they were sad and hurt , and to say to Him one after another , Is it I ? or , It is not I , is it ?
41014020	He replied to them , It is one of the Twelve [ apostles ] , one who is dipping [ bread ] into the [ same deep ] dish with Me .
41014021	For the Son of Man is going as it stands written concerning Him ; but woe to that man by whom the Son of Man is betrayed ! It would have been good ( profitable and wholesome ) for that man if he had never been born .
41014022	And while they were eating , He took a loaf [ of bread ] , praised God and gave thanks and asked Him to bless it to their use . [ Then ] He broke [ it ] and gave to them and said , Take . Eat . This is My body .
41014023	He also took a cup [ of the juice of grapes ] , and when He had given thanks , He gave [ it ] to them , and they all drank of it .
41014024	And He said to them , This is My blood [ which ratifies ] the new covenant , [ the blood ] which is being poured out for ( on account of ) many .
41014025	Solemnly and surely I tell you , I shall not again drink of the fruit of the vine till that day when I drink it of a new and a higher quality in God’s kingdom .
41014026	And when they had sung a hymn , they went out to the Mount of Olives .
41014027	And Jesus said to them , You will all fall away this night [ that is , you will be caused to stumble and will begin to distrust and desert Me ] , for it stands written , I will strike the Shepherd , and the sheep will be scattered .
41014028	But after I am raised [ to life ] , I will go before you into Galilee .
41014029	But Peter said to Him , Even if they all fall away and are caused to stumble and distrust and desert You , yet I will not [ do so ] !
41014030	And Jesus said to him , Truly I tell you , this very night , before a cock crows twice , you will utterly deny Me [ disclaiming all connection with Me ] three times .
41014031	But [ Peter ] said more vehemently and repeatedly , [ Even ] if it should be necessary for me to die with You , I will not deny or disown You ! And they all kept saying the same thing .
41014032	Then they went to a place called Gethsemane , and He said to His disciples , Sit down here while I pray .
41014033	And He took with Him Peter and James and John , and began to be struck with terror and amazement and deeply troubled and depressed .
41014034	And He said to them , My soul is exceedingly sad ( overwhelmed with grief ) so that it almost kills Me ! Remain here and keep awake and be watching .
41014035	And going a little farther , He fell on the ground and kept praying that if it were possible the [ fatal ] hour might pass from Him .
41014036	And He was saying , Abba , [ which means ] Father , everything is possible for You . Take away this cup from Me ; yet not what I will , but what You [ will ] .
41014037	And He came back and found them sleeping , and He said to Peter , Simon , are you asleep ? Have you not the strength to keep awake and watch [ with Me for ] one hour ?
41014038	Keep awake and watch and pray [ constantly ] , that you may not enter into temptation ; the spirit indeed is willing , but the flesh is weak .
41014039	He went away again and prayed , saying the same words .
41014040	And again He came back and found them sleeping , for their eyes were very heavy ; and they did not know what answer to give Him .
41014041	And He came back a third time and said to them , Are you still sleeping and resting ? It is enough [ of that ] ! The hour has come . The Son of Man is betrayed into the hands of sinful men ( men whose way or nature is to act in opposition to God ) .
41014042	Get up , let us be going ! See , My betrayer is at hand !
41014043	And at once , while He was still speaking , Judas came , one of the Twelve [ apostles ] , and with him a crowd of men with swords and clubs , [ who came ] from the chief priests and the scribes and the elders [ of the Sanhedrin ] .
41014044	Now the betrayer had given them a signal , saying , The One I shall kiss is [ the Man ] ; seize Him and lead [ Him ] away safely [ so as to prevent His escape ] .
41014045	And when he came , he went up to Jesus immediately and said , Master ! Master ! and he embraced Him and kissed Him fervently .
41014046	And they threw their hands on Him and arrested Him .
41014047	But one of the bystanders drew his sword and struck the bond servant of the high priest and cut off his ear .
41014048	And Jesus said to them , Have you come out with swords and clubs as [ you would ] against a robber to capture Me ?
41014049	I was with you daily in the temple [ porches and courts ] teaching , and you did not seize Me ; but [ this has happened ] that the Scriptures might be fulfilled .
41014050	Then [ His disciples ] , forsaking Him , fled , all [ of them ] .
41014051	And a young man was following Him , with nothing but a linen cloth ( sheet ) thrown about [ his ] naked [ body ] ; and they laid hold of him ,
41014052	But , leaving behind the linen cloth ( sheet ) , he fled from them naked .
41014053	And they led Jesus away to the high priest , and all the chief priests and the elders and the scribes were gathered together .
41014054	And Peter followed Him at a distance , even right into the courtyard of the high priest . And he was sitting [ in the firelight ] with the guards and warming himself at the fire .
41014055	Now the chief priests and the entire council ( the Sanhedrin ) were constantly seeking [ to get ] testimony against Jesus with a view to condemning Him and putting Him to death , but they did not find any .
41014056	For many were repeatedly bearing false witness against Him , but their testimonies did not agree .
41014057	And some stood up and were bearing false witness against Him , saying ,
41014058	We heard Him say , I will destroy this temple ( sanctuary ) which is made with hands , and in three days I will build another , made without hands .
41014059	Still not even [ in this ] did their testimony agree .
41014060	And the high priest stood up in the midst and asked Jesus , Have You not even one answer to make ? What [ about this which ] these [ men ] are testifying against You ?
41014061	But He kept still and did not answer at all . Again the high priest asked Him , Are You the Christ ( the Messiah , the Anointed One ) , the Son of the Blessed ?
41014062	And Jesus said , I AM ; and you will [ all ] see the Son of Man seated at the right hand of Power ( the Almighty ) and coming on the clouds of heaven .
41014063	Then the high priest tore his garments and said , What need have we for more witnesses ?
41014064	You have heard His blasphemy . What is your decision ? And they all condemned Him as being guilty and deserving of death .
41014065	And some of them began to spit on Him and to blindfold Him and to strike Him with their fists , saying to Him , Prophesy ! And the guards received Him with blows and by slapping Him .
41014066	While Peter was down below in the courtyard , one of the [ serving ] maids of the high priest came ;
41014067	And when she saw Peter warming himself , she gazed intently at him and said , You were with Jesus of Nazareth too .
41014068	But he denied it falsely and disowned Him , saying , I neither know nor understand what you say . Then he went outside [ the courtyard and was ] into the vestibule . And a cock crowed .
41014069	And the maidservant saw him , and began again to say to the bystanders , This [ man ] is [ one ] of them .
41014070	But again he denied it falsely and disowned Him . And after a short while , again the bystanders said to Peter , Really , you are one of them , for you are a Galilean and your dialect shows it .
41014071	Then he commenced invoking a curse on himself [ should he not be telling the truth ] and swearing , I do not know the Man about Whom you are talking !
41014072	And at once for the second time a cock crowed . And Peter remembered how Jesus said to him , Before a cock crows twice , you will utterly deny Me [ disclaiming all connection with Me ] three times . And having put his thought upon it [ and remembering ] , he broke down and wept aloud and lamented .
41015001	AND IMMEDIATELY when it was morning , the chief priests , with the elders and scribes and the whole council , held a consultation ; and when they had bound Jesus , they took Him away [ violently ] and handed Him over to Pilate .
41015002	And Pilate inquired of Him , Are You the King of the Jews ? And He replied , It is as you say .
41015003	And the chief priests kept accusing Him of many things .
41015004	And Pilate again asked Him , Have You no answer to make ? See how many charges they are bringing against You !
41015005	But Jesus made no further answer at all , so that Pilate wondered and marveled .
41015006	Now at the Feast he [ was accustomed to ] set free for them any one prisoner whom they requested .
41015007	And among the rioters in the prison who had committed murder in the insurrection there was a man named Barabbas .
41015008	And the throng came up and began asking Pilate to do as he usually did for them .
41015009	And he replied to them , Do you wish me to set free for you the King of the Jews ?
41015010	For he was aware that it was [ because they were prompted ] by envy that the chief priests had delivered Him up .
41015011	But the chief priests stirred up the crowd to get him to release for them Barabbas instead .
41015012	And again Pilate said to them , Then what shall I do with the Man Whom you call the King of the Jews ?
41015013	And they shouted back again , Crucify Him !
41015014	But Pilate said to them , Why ? What has He done that is evil ? But they shouted with all their might all the more , Crucify Him [ at once ] !
41015015	So Pilate , wishing to satisfy the crowd , set Barabbas free for them ; and after having Jesus whipped , he handed [ Him ] over to be crucified .
41015016	Then the soldiers led Him away to the courtyard inside the palace , that is , the Praetorium , and they called the entire detachment of soldiers together .
41015017	And they dressed Him in [ a ] purple [ robe ] , and , weaving together a crown of thorns , they placed it on Him .
41015018	And they began to salute Him , Hail ( greetings , good health to You , long life to You ) , King of the Jews !
41015019	And they struck His head with a staff made of a [ bamboo-like ] reed and spat on Him and kept bowing their knees in homage to Him .
41015020	And when they had [ finished ] making sport of Him , they took the purple [ robe ] off of Him and put His own clothes on Him . And they led Him out [ of the city ] to crucify Him .
41015021	And they forced a passerby , Simon of Cyrene , the father of Alexander and Rufus , who was coming in from the field ( country ) , to carry His cross .
41015022	And they led Him to Golgotha [ in Latin : Calvary ] , meaning The Place of a Skull .
41015023	And they [ attempted to ] give Him wine mingled with myrrh , but He would not take it .
41015024	And they crucified Him ; and they divided His garments and distributed them among themselves , throwing lots for them to decide who should take what .
41015025	And it was the third hour ( about nine o’clock in the morning ) when they crucified Him .
41015026	And the inscription of the accusation against Him was written above , The King of the Jews .
41015027	And with Him they crucified two robbers , one on [ His ] right hand and one on His left .
41015028	And the Scripture was fulfilled which says , He was counted among the transgressors .
41015029	And those who passed by kept reviling Him and reproaching Him abusively in harsh and insolent language , wagging their heads and saying , Aha ! You Who would destroy the temple and build it in three days ,
41015030	Now rescue Yourself [ from death ] , coming down from the cross !
41015031	So also the chief priests , with the scribes , made sport of Him to one another , saying , He rescued others [ from death ] ; Himself He is unable to rescue .
41015032	Let the Christ ( the Messiah ) , the King of Israel , come down now from the cross , that we may see [ it ] and trust in and rely on Him and adhere to Him ! Those who were crucified with Him also reviled and reproached Him [ speaking abusively , harshly , and insolently ] .
41015033	And when the sixth hour ( about midday ) had come , there was darkness over the whole land until the ninth hour ( about three o’clock ) .
41015034	And at the ninth hour Jesus cried with a loud voice , Eloi , Eloi , lama sabachthani ? -- which means , My God , My God , why have You forsaken Me [ deserting Me and leaving Me helpless and abandoned ] ?
41015035	And some of those standing by , [ and ] hearing it , said , See ! He is calling Elijah !
41015036	And one man ran , and , filling a sponge with vinegar ( a mixture of sour wine and water ) , put it on a staff made of a [ bamboo-like ] reed and gave it to Him to drink , saying , Hold off ! Let us see whether Elijah [ does ] come to take Him down .
41015037	And Jesus uttered a loud cry , and breathed out His life .
41015038	And the curtain [ of the Holy of Holies ] of the temple was torn in two from top to bottom .
41015039	And when the centurion who stood facing Him saw Him expire this way , he said , Really , this Man was God’s Son !
41015040	Now some women were there also , looking on from a distance , among whom were Mary Magdalene , and Mary the mother of James the younger and of Joses , and Salome ,
41015041	Who , when [ Jesus ] was in Galilee , were in the habit of accompanying and ministering to Him ; and [ there were ] also many other [ women ] who had come up with Him to Jerusalem .
41015042	As evening had already come , since it was the day of Preparation , that is , [ the day ] before the Sabbath ,
41015043	Joseph , he of Arimathea , noble and honorable in rank and a respected member of the council ( Sanhedrin ) , who was himself waiting for the kingdom of God , daring the consequences , took courage and ventured to go to Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus .
41015044	But Pilate wondered whether He was dead so soon , and , having called the centurion , he asked him whether [ Jesus ] was already dead .
41015045	And when he learned from the centurion [ that He was indeed dead ] , he gave the body to Joseph .
41015046	And Joseph bought a [ fine ] linen cloth [ for swathing dead bodies ] , and , taking Him down from the cross , he rolled Him up in the [ fine ] linen cloth and placed Him in a tomb which had been hewn out of a rock . Then he rolled a [ very large ] stone against the door of the tomb .
41015047	And Mary Magdalene and Mary [ the mother ] of Joses were [ attentively ] observing where He was laid .
41016001	AND WHEN the Sabbath was past [ that is , after the sun had set ] , Mary Magdalene , and Mary [ the mother ] of James , and Salome purchased sweet-smelling spices , so that they might go and anoint [ Jesus’ body ] .
41016002	And very early on the first day of the week they came to the tomb ; [ by then ] the sun had risen .
41016003	And they said to one another , Who will roll back the stone for us out of [ the groove across the floor at ] the door of the tomb ?
41016004	And when they looked up , they [ distinctly ] saw that the stone was already rolled back , for it was very large .
41016005	And going into the tomb , they saw a young man sitting [ there ] on the right [ side ] , clothed in a [ long , stately , sweeping ] robe of white , and they were utterly amazed and struck with terror .
41016006	And he said to them , Do not be amazed and terrified ; you are looking for Jesus of Nazareth , Who was crucified . He has risen ; He is not here . See the place where they laid Him .
41016007	But be going ; tell the disciples and Peter , He goes before you into Galilee ; you will see Him there , [ just ] as He told you .
41016008	Then they went out [ and ] fled from the tomb , for trembling and bewilderment and consternation had seized them . And they said nothing about it to anyone , for they were held by alarm and fear .
41016009	Now Jesus , having risen [ from death ] early on the first day of the week , appeared first to Mary Magdalene , from whom He had driven out seven demons .
41016010	She went and reported it to those who had been with Him , as they grieved and wept .
41016011	And when they heard that He was alive and that she had seen Him , they did not believe it .
41016012	After this , He appeared in a different form to two of them as they were walking [ along the way ] into the country .
41016013	And they returned [ to Jerusalem ] and told the others , but they did not believe them either .
41016014	Afterward He appeared to the Eleven [ apostles themselves ] as they reclined at table ; and He reproved and reproached them for their unbelief ( their lack of faith ) and their hardness of heart , because they had refused to believe those who had seen Him and looked at Him attentively after He had risen [ from death ] .
41016015	And He said to them , Go into all the world and preach and publish openly the good news ( the Gospel ) to every creature [ of the whole human race ] .
41016016	He who believes [ who adheres to and trusts in and relies on the Gospel and Him Whom it sets forth ] and is baptized will be saved [ from the penalty of eternal death ] ; but he who does not believe [ who does not adhere to and trust in and rely on the Gospel and Him Whom it sets forth ] will be condemned .
41016017	And these attesting signs will accompany those who believe : in My name they will drive out demons ; they will speak in new languages ;
41016018	They will pick up serpents ; and [ even ] if they drink anything deadly , it will not hurt them ; they will lay their hands on the sick , and they will get well .
41016019	So then the Lord Jesus , after He had spoken to them , was taken up into heaven and He sat down at the right hand of God .
41016020	And they went out and preached everywhere , while the Lord kept working with them and confirming the message by the attesting signs and miracles that closely accompanied [ it ] . Amen ( so be it ) .
42001001	SINCE [ as is well known ] many have undertaken to put in order and draw up a [ thorough ] narrative of the surely established deeds which have been accomplished and fulfilled in and among us ,
42001002	Exactly as they were handed down to us by those who from the [ official ] beginning [ of Jesus’ ministry ] were eyewitnesses and ministers of the Word [ that is , of the doctrine concerning the attainment through Christ of salvation in the kingdom of God ] ,
42001003	It seemed good and desirable to me , [ and so I have determined ] also after having searched out diligently and followed all things closely and traced accurately the course from the highest to the minutest detail from the very first , to write an orderly account for you , most excellent Theophilus ,
42001004	[ My purpose is ] that you may know the full truth and understand with certainty and security against error the accounts ( histories ) and doctrines of the faith of which you have been informed and in which you have been orally instructed .
42001005	In the days when Herod was king of Judea there was a certain priest whose name was Zachariah , of the daily service ( the division ) of Abia ; and his wife was also a descendant of Aaron , and her name was Elizabeth .
42001006	And they both were righteous in the sight of God , walking blamelessly in all the commandments and requirements of the Lord .
42001007	But they had no child , for Elizabeth was barren ; and both were far advanced in years .
42001008	Now while on duty , serving as priest before God in the order of his division ,
42001009	As was the custom of the priesthood , it fell to him by lot to enter [ the sanctuary of ] the temple of the Lord and burn incense .
42001010	And all the throng of people were praying outside [ in the court ] at the hour of incense [ burning ] .
42001011	And there appeared to him an angel of the Lord , standing at the right side of the altar of incense .
42001012	And when Zachariah saw him , he was troubled , and fear took possession of him .
42001013	But the angel said to him , Do not be afraid , Zachariah , because your petition was heard , and your wife Elizabeth will bear you a son , and you must call his name John [ God is favorable ] .
42001014	And you shall have joy and exultant delight , and many will rejoice over his birth ,
42001015	For he will be great and distinguished in the sight of the Lord . And he must drink no wine nor strong drink , and he will be filled with and controlled by the Holy Spirit even in and from his mother’s womb .
42001016	And he will turn back and cause to return many of the sons of Israel to the Lord their God ,
42001017	And he will [ himself ] go before Him in the spirit and power of Elijah , to turn back the hearts of the fathers to the children , and the disobedient and incredulous and unpersuadable to the wisdom of the upright [ which is the knowledge and holy love of the will of God ] -- in order to make ready for the Lord a people [ perfectly ] prepared [ in spirit , adjusted and disposed and placed in the right moral state ] .
42001018	And Zachariah said to the angel , By what shall I know and be sure of this ? For I am an old man , and my wife is well advanced in years .
42001019	And the angel replied to him , I am Gabriel . I stand in the [ very ] presence of God , and I have been sent to talk to you and to bring you this good news .
42001020	Now behold , you will be and will continue to be silent and not able to speak till the day when these things take place , because you have not believed what I told you ; but my words are of a kind which will be fulfilled in the appointed and proper time .
42001021	Now the people kept waiting for Zachariah , and they wondered at his delaying [ so long ] in the sanctuary .
42001022	But when he did come out , he was unable to speak to them ; and they [ clearly ] perceived that he had seen a vision in the sanctuary ; and he kept making signs to them , still he remained dumb .
42001023	And when his time of performing priestly functions was ended , he returned to his [ own ] house .
42001024	Now after this his wife Elizabeth became pregnant , and for five months she secluded herself entirely , saying , [ I have hid myself ]
42001025	Because thus the Lord has dealt with me in the days when He deigned to look on me to take away my reproach among men .
42001026	Now in the sixth month [ after that ] , the angel Gabriel was sent from God to a town of Galilee named Nazareth ,
42001027	To a girl never having been married and a virgin engaged to be married to a man whose name was Joseph , a descendant of the house of David ; and the virgin’s name was Mary .
42001028	And he came to her and said , Hail , O favored one [ endued with grace ] ! The Lord is with you ! Blessed ( favored of God ) are you before all other women !
42001029	But when she saw him , she was greatly troubled and disturbed and confused at what he said and kept revolving in her mind what such a greeting might mean .
42001030	And the angel said to her , Do not be afraid , Mary , for you have found grace ( free , spontaneous , absolute favor and loving-kindness ) with God .
42001031	And listen ! You will become pregnant and will give birth to a Son , and you shall call His name Jesus .
42001032	He will be great ( eminent ) and will be called the Son of the Most High ; and the Lord God will give to Him the throne of His forefather David ,
42001033	And He will reign over the house of Jacob throughout the ages ; and of His reign there will be no end .
42001034	And Mary said to the angel , How can this be , since I have no [ intimacy with any man as a ] husband ?
42001035	Then the angel said to her , The Holy Spirit will come upon you , and the power of the Most High will overshadow you [ like a shining cloud ] ; and so the holy ( pure , sinless ) Thing ( Offspring ) which shall be born of you will be called the Son of God .
42001036	And listen ! Your relative Elizabeth in her old age has also conceived a son , and this is now the sixth month with her who was called barren .
42001037	For with God nothing is ever impossible and no word from God shall be without power or impossible of fulfillment .
42001038	Then Mary said , Behold , I am the handmaiden of the Lord ; let it be done to me according to what you have said . And the angel left her .
42001039	And at that time Mary arose and went with haste into the hill country to a town of Judah ,
42001040	And she went to the house of Zachariah and , entering it , saluted Elizabeth .
42001041	And it occurred that when Elizabeth heard Mary’s greeting , the baby leaped in her womb , and Elizabeth was filled with and controlled by the Holy Spirit .
42001042	And she cried out with a loud cry , and then exclaimed , Blessed ( favored of God ) above all other women are you ! And blessed ( favored of God ) is the Fruit of your womb !
42001043	And how [ have I deserved that this honor should ] be granted to me , that the mother of my Lord should come to me ?
42001044	For behold , the instant the sound of your salutation reached my ears , the baby in my womb leaped for joy .
42001045	And blessed ( happy , to be envied ) is she who believed that there would be a fulfillment of the things that were spoken to her from the Lord .
42001046	And Mary said , My soul magnifies and extols the Lord ,
42001047	And my spirit rejoices in God my Savior ,
42001048	For He has looked upon the low station and humiliation of His handmaiden . For behold , from now on all generations [ of all ages ] will call me blessed and declare me happy and to be envied !
42001049	For He Who is almighty has done great things for me -- and holy is His name [ to be venerated in His purity , majesty and glory ] !
42001050	And His mercy ( His compassion and kindness toward the miserable and afflicted ) is on those who fear Him with godly reverence , from generation to generation and age to age .
42001051	He has shown strength and made might with His arm ; He has scattered the proud and haughty in and by the imagination and purpose and designs of their hearts .
42001052	He has put down the mighty from their thrones and exalted those of low degree .
42001053	He has filled and satisfied the hungry with good things , and the rich He has sent away empty-handed [ without a gift ] .
42001054	He has laid hold on His servant Israel [ to help him , to espouse his cause ] , in remembrance of His mercy ,
42001055	Even as He promised to our forefathers , to Abraham and to his descendants forever .
42001056	And Mary remained with her [ Elizabeth ] for about three months and [ then ] returned to her [ own ] home .
42001057	Now the time that Elizabeth should be delivered came , and she gave birth to a son .
42001058	And her neighbors and relatives heard that the Lord had shown great mercy on her , and they rejoiced with her .
42001059	And it occurred that on the eighth day , when they came to circumcise the child , they were intending to call him Zachariah after his father ,
42001060	But his mother answered , Not so ! But he shall be called John .
42001061	And they said to her , None of your relatives is called by that name .
42001062	And they inquired with signs to his father [ as to ] what he wanted to have him called .
42001063	Then Zachariah asked for a writing tablet and wrote , His name is John . And they were all astonished .
42001064	And at once his mouth was opened and his tongue loosed , and he began to speak , blessing and praising and thanking God .
42001065	And awe and reverential fear came on all their neighbors ; and all these things were discussed throughout the hill country of Judea .
42001066	And all who heard them laid them up in their hearts , saying , Whatever will this little boy be then ? For the hand of the Lord was [ so evidently ] with him [ protecting and aiding him ] .
42001067	Now Zachariah his father was filled with and controlled by the Holy Spirit and prophesied , saying ,
42001068	Blessed ( praised and extolled and thanked ) be the Lord , the God of Israel , because He has come and brought deliverance and redemption to His people !
42001069	And He has raised up a Horn of salvation [ a mighty and valiant Helper , the Author of salvation ] for us in the house of David His servant --
42001070	This is as He promised by the mouth of His holy prophets from the most ancient times [ in the memory of man ] --
42001071	That we should have deliverance and be saved from our enemies and from the hand of all who detest and pursue us with hatred ;
42001072	To make true and show the mercy and compassion and kindness [ promised ] to our forefathers and to remember and carry out His holy covenant [ to bless , which is all the more sacred because it is made by God Himself ] ,
42001073	That covenant He sealed by oath to our forefather Abraham :
42001074	To grant us that we , being delivered from the hand of our foes , might serve Him fearlessly
42001075	In holiness ( divine consecration ) and righteousness [ in accordance with the everlasting principles of right ] within His presence all the days of our lives .
42001076	And you , little one , shall be called a prophet of the Most High ; for you shall go on before the face of the Lord to make ready His ways ,
42001077	To bring and give the knowledge of salvation to His people in the forgiveness and remission of their sins .
42001078	Because of and through the heart of tender mercy and loving-kindness of our God , a Light from on high will dawn upon us and visit [ us ]
42001079	To shine upon and give light to those who sit in darkness and in the shadow of death , to direct and guide our feet in a straight line into the way of peace .
42001080	And the little boy grew and became strong in spirit ; and he was in the deserts ( wilderness ) until the day of his appearing to Israel [ the commencement of his public ministry ] .
42002001	IN THOSE days it occurred that a decree went out from Caesar Augustus that the whole Roman empire should be registered .
42002002	This was the first enrollment , and it was made when Quirinius was governor of Syria .
42002003	And all the people were going to be registered , each to his own city or town .
42002004	And Joseph also went up from Galilee from the town of Nazareth to Judea , to the town of David , which is called Bethlehem , because he was of the house and family of David ,
42002005	To be enrolled with Mary , his espoused ( married ) wife , who was about to become a mother .
42002006	And while they were there , the time came for her delivery ,
42002007	And she gave birth to her Son , her Firstborn ; and she wrapped Him in swaddling clothes and laid Him in a manger , because there was no room or place for them in the inn .

42002009	And behold , an angel of the Lord stood by them , and the glory of the Lord flashed and shone all about them , and they were terribly frightened .

42002016	So they went with haste and [ by searching ] found Mary and Joseph , and the Baby lying in a manger .
42002017	And when they saw it , they made known what had been told them concerning this Child ,
42002018	And all who heard it were astounded and marveled at what the shepherds told them .
42002019	But Mary was keeping within herself all these things ( sayings ) , weighing and pondering them in her heart .

42002024	And [ they came also ] to offer a sacrifice according to what is said in the Law of the Lord : a pair of turtledoves or two young pigeons .
