42009013	But He said to them , You [ yourselves ] give them [ food ] to eat . They said , We have no more than five loaves and two fish -- unless we are to go and buy food for all this crowd ,
42009014	For there were about 5,000 men . And [ Jesus ] said to His disciples , Have them [ sit down ] reclining in table groups ( companies ) of about fifty each .
42009015	And they did so , and made them all recline .
42009016	And taking the five loaves and the two fish , He looked up to heaven and [ praising God ] gave thanks and asked Him to bless them [ to their use ] . Then He broke them and gave them to the disciples to place before the multitude .
42009017	And all the people ate and were satisfied . And they gathered up what remained over -- twelve [ small hand ] baskets of broken pieces .
42009018	Now it occurred that as Jesus was praying privately , the disciples were with Him , and He asked them , Who do men say that I am ?
42009019	And they answered , John the Baptist ; but some say , Elijah ; and others , that one of the ancient prophets has come back to life .
42009020	And He said to them , But who do you [ yourselves ] say that I am ? And Peter replied , The Christ of God !
42009021	But He strictly charged and sharply commanded them [ under penalty ] to tell this to no one [ no one , whoever he might be ] ,
42009022	Saying , The Son of Man must suffer many things and be [ deliberately ] disapproved and repudiated and rejected on the part of the elders and chief priests and scribes , and be put to death and on the third day be raised [ again ] .
42009023	And He said to all , If any person wills to come after Me , let him deny himself [ disown himself , forget , lose sight of himself and his own interests , refuse and give up himself ] and take up his cross daily and follow Me [ cleave steadfastly to Me , conform wholly to My example in living and , if need be , in dying also ] .
42009024	For whoever would preserve his life and save it will lose and destroy it , but whoever loses his life for My sake , he will preserve and save it [ from the penalty of eternal death ] .
42009025	For what does it profit a man , if he gains the whole world and ruins or forfeits ( loses ) himself ?
42009026	Because whoever is ashamed of Me and of My teachings , of him will the Son of Man be ashamed when He comes in the [ threefold ] glory ( the splendor and majesty ) of Himself and of the Father and of the holy angels .
42009027	However I tell you truly , there are some of those standing here who will not taste death before they see the kingdom of God .
42009028	Now about eight days after these teachings , Jesus took with Him Peter and John and James and went up on the mountain to pray .
42009029	And as He was praying , the appearance of His countenance became altered ( different ) , and His raiment became dazzling white [ flashing with the brilliance of lightning ] .
42009030	And behold , two men were conversing with Him -- Moses and Elijah ,
42009031	Who appeared in splendor and majesty and brightness and were speaking of His exit [ from life ] , which He was about to bring to realization at Jerusalem .
42009032	Now Peter and those with him were weighed down with sleep , but when they fully awoke , they saw His glory ( splendor and majesty and brightness ) and the two men who stood with Him .
42009033	And it occurred as the men were parting from Him that Peter said to Jesus , Master , it is delightful and good that we are here ; and let us construct three booths or huts -- one for You and one for Moses and one for Elijah ! not noticing or knowing what he was saying .
42009034	But even as he was saying this , a cloud came and began to overshadow them , and they were seized with alarm and struck with fear as they entered into the cloud .
42009035	Then there came a voice out of the cloud , saying , This is My Son , My Chosen One or My Beloved ; listen to and yield to and obey Him !
42009036	And when the voice had died away , Jesus was found there alone . And they kept still , and told no one at that time any of these things that they had seen .
42009037	Now it occurred the next day , when they had come down from the mountain , that a great multitude met Him .
42009038	And behold , a man from the crowd shouted out , Master , I implore You to look at my son , for he is my only child ;
42009039	And behold , a spirit seizes him and suddenly he cries out ; it convulses him so that he foams at the mouth ; and he is sorely shattered , and it will scarcely leave him .
42009040	And I implored Your disciples to drive it out , but they could not .
42009041	Jesus answered , O [ faithless ones ] unbelieving and without trust in God , a perverse ( wayward , crooked and warped ) generation ! Until when and how long am I to be with you and bear with you ? Bring your son here [ to Me ] .
42009042	And even while he was coming , the demon threw him down and [ completely ] convulsed him . But Jesus censured and severely rebuked the unclean spirit and healed the child and restored him to his father .
42009043	And all were astounded at the evidence of God’s mighty power and His majesty and magnificence . But [ while ] they were all marveling at everything Jesus was doing , He said to His disciples ,
42009044	Let these words sink into your ears : the Son of Man is about to be delivered into the hands of men [ whose conduct is opposed to God ] .
42009045	However , they did not comprehend this saying ; and it was kept hidden from them , so that they should not grasp it and understand , and they were afraid to ask Him about the statement .
42009046	But a controversy arose among them as to which of them might be the greatest [ surpassing the others in excellence , worth , and authority ] .
42009047	But Jesus , as He perceived the thoughts of their hearts , took a little child and put him at His side
42009048	And told them , Whoever receives and accepts and welcomes this child in My name and for My sake receives and accepts and welcomes Me ; and whoever so receives Me so also receives Him Who sent Me . For he who is least and lowliest among you all -- he is [ the one who is truly ] great .
42009049	John said , Master , we saw a man driving out demons in Your name and we commanded him to stop it , for he does not follow along with us .
42009050	But Jesus told him , Do not forbid [ such people ] ; for whoever is not against you is for you .
42009051	Now when the time was almost come for Jesus to be received up [ to heaven ] , He steadfastly and determinedly set His face to go to Jerusalem .
42009052	And He sent messengers before Him ; and they reached and entered a Samaritan village to make [ things ] ready for Him ;
42009053	But [ the people ] would not welcome or receive or accept Him , because His face was [ set as if He was ] going to Jerusalem .
42009054	And when His disciples James and John observed this , they said , Lord , do You wish us to command fire to come down from heaven and consume them , even as Elijah did ?
42009055	But He turned and rebuked and severely censured them . He said , You do not know of what sort of spirit you are ,
42009056	For the Son of Man did not come to destroy men’s lives , but to save them [ from the penalty of eternal death ] . And they journeyed on to another village .
42009057	And it occurred that as they were going along the road , a man said to Him , Lord , I will follow You wherever You go .
42009058	And Jesus told him , Foxes have lurking holes and the birds of the air have roosts and nests , but the Son of Man has no place to lay His head .
42009059	And He said to another , Become My disciple , side with My party , and accompany Me ! But he replied , Lord , permit me first to go and bury ( await the death of ) my father .
42009060	But Jesus said to him , Allow the dead to bury their own dead ; but as for you , go and publish abroad throughout all regions the kingdom of God .
42009061	Another also said , I will follow You , Lord , and become Your disciple and side with Your party ; but let me first say good-bye to those at my home .
42009062	Jesus said to him , No one who puts his hand to the plow and looks back [ to the things behind ] is fit for the kingdom of God .
42010001	NOW AFTER this the Lord chose and appointed seventy others and sent them out ahead of Him , two by two , into every town and place where He Himself was about to come ( visit ) .
42010002	And He said to them , The harvest indeed is abundant [ there is much ripe grain ] , but the farmhands are few . Pray therefore the Lord of the harvest to send out laborers into His harvest .
42010003	Go your way ; behold , I send you out like lambs into the midst of wolves .
42010004	Carry no purse , no provisions bag , no [ change of ] sandals ; refrain from [ retarding your journey by ] saluting and wishing anyone well along the way .
42010005	Whatever house you enter , first say , Peace be to this household ! [ Freedom from all the distresses that result from sin be with this family ] .
42010006	And if anyone [ worthy ] of peace and blessedness is there , the peace and blessedness you wish shall come upon him ; but if not , it shall come back to you .
42010007	And stay on in the same house , eating and drinking what they provide , for the laborer is worthy of his wages . Do not keep moving from house to house .
42010008	Whenever you go into a town and they receive and accept and welcome you , eat what is set before you ;
42010009	And heal the sick in it and say to them , The kingdom of God has come close to you .
42010010	But whenever you go into a town and they do not receive and accept and welcome you , go out into its streets and say ,
42010011	Even the dust of your town that clings to our feet we are wiping off against you ; yet know and understand this : the kingdom of God has come near you .
42010012	I tell you , it shall be more tolerable in that day for Sodom than for that town .
42010013	Woe to you , Chorazin ! Woe to you , Bethsaida ! For if the mighty miracles performed in you had been performed in Tyre and Sidon , they would have repented long ago , sitting in sackcloth and ashes .
42010014	However , it shall be more tolerable in the judgment for Tyre and Sidon than for you .
42010015	And you , Capernaum , will you be exalted unto heaven ? You shall be brought down to Hades ( the regions of the dead ) .
42010016	He who hears and heeds you [ disciples ] hears and heeds Me ; and he who slights and rejects you slights and rejects Me ; and he who slights and rejects Me slights and rejects Him who sent Me .
42010017	The seventy returned with joy , saying , Lord , even the demons are subject to us in Your name !
42010018	And He said to them , I saw Satan falling like a lightning [ flash ] from heaven .
42010019	Behold ! I have given you authority and power to trample upon serpents and scorpions , and [ physical and mental strength and ability ] over all the power that the enemy [ possesses ] ; and nothing shall in any way harm you .
42010020	Nevertheless , do not rejoice at this , that the spirits are subject to you , but rejoice that your names are enrolled in heaven .
42010021	In that same hour He rejoiced and gloried in the Holy Spirit and said , I thank You , Father , Lord of heaven and earth , that You have concealed these things [ relating to salvation ] from the wise and understanding and learned , and revealed them to babes ( the childish , unskilled , and untaught ) . Yes , Father , for such was Your gracious will and choice and good pleasure .
42010022	All things have been given over into My power by My Father ; and no one knows Who the Son is except the Father , or Who the Father is except the Son and anyone to whom the Son may choose to reveal and make Him known .
42010023	Then turning to His disciples , He said privately , Blessed ( happy , to be envied ) are those whose eyes see what you see !
42010024	For I tell you that many prophets and kings longed to see what you see and they did not see it , and to hear what you hear and they did not hear it .
42010025	And then a certain lawyer arose to try ( test , tempt ) Him , saying , Teacher , what am I to do to inherit everlasting life [ that is , to partake of eternal salvation in the Messiah’s kingdom ] ?
42010026	Jesus said to him , What is written in the Law ? How do you read it ?
42010027	And he replied , You must love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your strength and with all your mind ; and your neighbor as yourself .
42010028	And Jesus said to him , You have answered correctly ; do this , and you will live [ enjoy active , blessed , endless life in the kingdom of God ] .
42010029	And he , determined to acquit himself of reproach , said to Jesus , And who is my neighbor ?
42010030	Jesus , taking him up , replied , A certain man was going from Jerusalem down to Jericho , and he fell among robbers , who stripped him of his clothes and belongings and beat him and went their way , [ unconcernedly ] leaving him half dead , as it happened .
42010031	Now by coincidence a certain priest was going down along that road , and when he saw him , he passed by on the other side .
42010032	A Levite likewise came down to the place and saw him , and passed by on the other side [ of the road ] .
42010033	But a certain Samaritan , as he traveled along , came down to where he was ; and when he saw him , he was moved with pity and sympathy [ for him ] ,
42010034	And went to him and dressed his wounds , pouring on [ them ] oil and wine . Then he set him on his own beast and brought him to an inn and took care of him .
42010035	And the next day he took out two denarii [ two day’s wages ] and gave [ them ] to the innkeeper , saying , Take care of him ; and whatever more you spend , I [ myself ] will repay you when I return .
42010036	Which of these three do you think proved himself a neighbor to him who fell among the robbers ?
42010037	He answered , The one who showed pity and mercy to him . And Jesus said to him , Go and do likewise .
42010038	Now while they were on their way , it occurred that Jesus entered a certain village , and a woman named Martha received and welcomed Him into her house .
42010039	And she had a sister named Mary , who seated herself at the Lord’s feet and was listening to His teaching .
42010040	But Martha [ overly occupied and too busy ] was distracted with much serving ; and she came up to Him and said , Lord , is it nothing to You that my sister has left me to serve alone ? Tell her then to help me [ to lend a hand and do her part along with me ] !
42010041	But the Lord replied to her by saying , Martha , Martha , you are anxious and troubled about many things ;
42010042	There is need of only one or but a few things . Mary has chosen the good portion [ that which is to her advantage ] , which shall not be taken away from her .
42011001	THEN HE was praying in a certain place ; and when He stopped , one of His disciples said to Him , Lord , teach us to pray , [ just ] as John taught his disciples .
42011002	And He said to them , When you pray , say : Our Father Who is in heaven , hallowed be Your name , Your kingdom come . Your will be done [ held holy and revered ] on earth as it is in heaven .
42011003	Give us daily our bread [ food for the morrow ] .
42011004	And forgive us our sins , for we ourselves also forgive everyone who is indebted to us [ who has offended us or done us wrong ] . And bring us not into temptation but rescue us from evil .
42011005	And He said to them , Which of you who has a friend will go to him at midnight and will say to him , Friend , lend me three loaves [ of bread ] ,
42011006	For a friend of mine who is on a journey has just come , and I have nothing to put before him ;
42011007	And he from within will answer , Do not disturb me ; the door is now closed , and my children are with me in bed ; I cannot get up and supply you [ with anything ] ?
42011008	I tell you , although he will not get up and supply him anything because he is his friend , yet because of his shameless persistence and insistence he will get up and give him as much as he needs .
42011009	So I say to you , Ask and keep on asking and it shall be given you ; seek and keep on seeking and you shall find ; knock and keep on knocking and the door shall be opened to you .
42011010	For everyone who asks and keeps on asking receives ; and he who seeks and keeps on seeking finds ; and to him who knocks and keeps on knocking , the door shall be opened .
42011011	What father among you , if his son asks for a loaf of bread , will give him a stone ; or if he asks for a fish , will instead of a fish give him a serpent ?
42011012	Or if he asks for an egg , will give him a scorpion ?
42011013	If you then , evil as you are , know how to give good gifts [ gifts that are to their advantage ] to your children , how much more will your heavenly Father give the Holy Spirit to those who ask and continue to ask Him !
42011014	Now Jesus was driving out a demon that was dumb ; and it occurred that when the demon had gone out , the dumb man spoke . And the crowds marveled .
42011015	But some of them said , He drives out demons [ because He is in league with and ] by Beelzebub , the prince of demons ,
42011016	While others , to try and test and tempt Him , demanded a sign of Him from heaven .
42011017	But He , [ well ] aware of their intent and purpose , said to them , Every kingdom split up against itself is doomed and brought to desolation , and so house falls upon house . [ The disunited household will collapse . ]
42011018	And if Satan also is divided against himself , how will his kingdom last ? For you say that I expel demons with the help of and by Beelzebub .
42011019	Now if I expel demons with the help of and by Beelzebub , with whose help and by whom do your sons drive them out ? Therefore they shall be your judges .
42011020	But if I drive out the demons by the finger of God , then the kingdom of God has [ already ] come upon you .
42011021	When the strong man , fully armed , [ from his courtyard ] guards his own dwelling , his belongings are undisturbed [ his property is at peace and is secure ] .
42011022	But when one stronger than he attacks him and conquers him , he robs him of his whole armor on which he had relied and divides up and distributes all his goods as plunder ( spoil ) .
42011023	He who is not with Me [ siding and believing with Me ] is against Me , and he who does not gather with Me [ engage in My interest ] , scatters .
42011024	When the unclean spirit has gone out of a person , it roams through waterless places in search [ of a place ] of rest ( release , refreshment , ease ) ; and finding none it says , I will go back to my house from which I came .
42011025	And when it arrives , it finds [ the place ] swept and put in order and furnished and decorated .
42011026	And it goes and brings other spirits , seven [ of them ] , more evil than itself , and they enter in , settle down , and dwell there ; and the last state of that person is worse than the first .
42011027	Now it occurred that as He was saying these things , a certain woman in the crowd raised her voice and said to Him , Blessed ( happy and to be envied ) is the womb that bore You and the breasts that You sucked !
42011028	But He said , Blessed ( happy and to be envied ) rather are those who hear the Word of God and obey and practice it !
42011029	Now as the crowds were [ increasingly ] thronging Him , He began to say , This present generation is a wicked one ; it seeks and demands a sign ( miracle ) , but no sign shall be given to it except the sign of Jonah [ the prophet ] .
42011030	For [ just ] as Jonah became a sign to the people of Nineveh , so will also the Son of Man be [ a sign ] to this age and generation .
42011031	The queen of the South will arise in the judgment with the people of this age and generation and condemn them ; for she came from the ends of the [ inhabited ] earth to listen to the wisdom of Solomon , and notice , here is more than Solomon .
42011032	The men of Nineveh will appear as witnesses at the judgment with this generation and will condemn it ; for they repented at the preaching of Jonah , and behold , here is more than Jonah .
42011033	No one after lighting a lamp puts it in a cellar or crypt or under a bushel measure , but on a lampstand , that those who are coming in may see the light .
42011034	Your eye is the lamp of your body ; when your eye ( your conscience ) is sound and fulfilling its office , your whole body is full of light ; but when it is not sound and is not fulfilling its office , your body is full of darkness .
42011035	Be careful , therefore , that the light that is in you is not darkness .
42011036	If then your entire body is illuminated , having no part dark , it will be wholly bright [ with light ] , as when a lamp with its bright rays gives you light .
42011037	Now while Jesus was speaking , a Pharisee invited Him to take dinner with him , so He entered and reclined at table .
42011038	The Pharisee noticed and was astonished [ to see ] that Jesus did not first wash before dinner .
42011039	But the Lord said to him , Now you Pharisees cleanse the outside of the cup and of the plate , but inside you yourselves are full of greed and robbery and extortion and malice and wickedness .
42011040	You senseless ( foolish , stupid ) ones [ acting without reflection or intelligence ] ! Did not He Who made the outside make the inside also ?
42011041	But [ dedicate your inner self and ] give as donations to the poor of those things which are within [ of inward righteousness ] and behold , everything is purified and clean for you .
42011042	But woe to you , Pharisees ! For you tithe mint and rue and every [ little ] herb , but disregard and neglect justice and the love of God . These you ought to have done without leaving the others undone .
42011043	Woe to you , Pharisees ! For you love the best seats in the synagogues and [ you love ] to be greeted and bowed down to in the [ public ] marketplaces .
42011044	Woe to you ! For you are like graves which are not marked or seen , and men walk over them without being aware of it [ and are ceremonially defiled ] .
42011045	One of the experts in the [ Mosaic ] Law answered Him , Teacher , in saying this , You reproach and outrage and affront even us !
42011046	But He said , Woe to you , the lawyers , also ! For you load men with oppressive burdens hard to bear , and you do not personally [ even gently ] touch the burdens with one of your fingers .
42011047	Woe to you ! For you are rebuilding and repairing the tombs of the prophets , whom your fathers killed ( destroyed ) .
42011048	So you bear witness and give your full approval and consent to the deeds of your fathers ; for they actually killed them , and you rebuild and repair monuments to them .
42011049	For this reason also the wisdom of God said , I will send them prophets and apostles , [ some ] of whom they will put to death and persecute ,
42011050	So that the blood of all the prophets shed from the foundation of the world may be charged against and required of this age and generation ,
42011051	From the blood of Abel to the blood of Zechariah , who was slain between the altar and the sanctuary . Yes , I tell you , it shall be charged against and required of this age and generation .
42011052	Woe to you , lawyers ( experts in the Mosaic Law ) ! For you have taken away the key to knowledge ; you did not go in yourselves , and you hindered and prevented those who were entering .
42011053	As He left there , the scribes and the Pharisees [ followed Him closely , and they ] began to be enraged with and set themselves violently against Him and to draw Him out and provoke Him to speak of many things ,
42011054	Secretly watching and plotting and lying in wait for Him , to seize upon something He might say [ that they might accuse Him ] .
42012001	IN THE meanwhile , when so many thousands of the people had gathered that they were trampling on one another , Jesus commenced by saying primarily to His disciples , Be on your guard against the leaven ( ferment ) of the Pharisees , which is hypocrisy [ producing unrest and violent agitation ] .
42012002	Nothing is [ so closely ] covered up that it will not be revealed , or hidden that it will not be known .
42012003	Whatever you have spoken in the darkness shall be heard and listened to in the light , and what you have whispered in [ people’s ] ears and behind closed doors will be proclaimed upon the housetops .
42012004	I tell you , My friends , do not dread and be afraid of those who kill the body and after that have nothing more that they can do .
42012005	But I will warn you whom you should fear : fear Him Who , after killing , has power to hurl into hell ( Gehenna ) ; yes , I say to you , fear Him !
42012006	Are not five sparrows sold for two pennies ? And [ yet ] not one of them is forgotten or uncared for in the presence of God .
42012007	But [ even ] the very hairs of your head are all numbered . Do not be struck with fear or seized with alarm ; you are of greater worth than many [ flocks ] of sparrows .
42012008	And I tell you , Whoever declares openly [ speaking out freely ] and confesses that he is My worshiper and acknowledges Me before men , the Son of Man also will declare and confess and acknowledge him before the angels of God .
42012009	But he who disowns and denies and rejects and refuses to acknowledge Me before men will be disowned and denied and rejected and refused acknowledgement in the presence of the angels of God .
42012010	And everyone who makes a statement or speaks a word against the Son of Man , it will be forgiven him ; but he who blasphemes against the Holy Spirit [ that is , whoever intentionally comes short of the reverence due the Holy Spirit ] , it will not be forgiven him [ for him there is no forgiveness ] .
42012011	And when they bring you before the synagogues and the magistrates and the authorities , do not be anxious [ beforehand ] how you shall reply in defense or what you are to say .
42012012	For the Holy Spirit will teach you in that very hour and moment what [ you ] ought to say .
42012013	Someone from the crowd said to Him , Master , order my brother to divide the inheritance and share it with me .
42012014	But He told him , Man , who has appointed Me a judge or umpire and divider over you ?
42012015	And He said to them , Guard yourselves and keep free from all covetousness ( the immoderate desire for wealth , the greedy longing to have more ) ; for a man’s life does not consist in and is not derived from possessing overflowing abundance or that which is over and above his needs .
42012016	Then He told them a parable , saying , The land of a rich man was fertile and yielded plentifully .
42012017	And he considered and debated within himself , What shall I do ? I have no place [ in which ] to gather together my harvest .
42012018	And he said , I will do this : I will pull down my storehouses and build larger ones , and there I will store all my grain or produce and my goods .
42012019	And I will say to my soul , Soul , you have many good things laid up , [ enough ] for many years . Take your ease ; eat , drink , and enjoy yourself merrily .
42012020	But God said to him , You fool ! This very night they [ the messengers of God ] will demand your soul of you ; and all the things that you have prepared , whose will they be ?
42012021	So it is with the one who continues to lay up and hoard possessions for himself and is not rich [ in his relation ] to God [ this is how he fares ] .
42012022	And [ Jesus ] said to His disciples , Therefore I tell you , do not be anxious and troubled [ with cares ] about your life , as to what you will [ have to ] eat ; or about your body , as to what you will [ have to ] wear .
42012023	For life is more than food , and the body [ more ] than clothes .
42012024	Observe and consider the ravens ; for they neither sow nor reap , they have neither storehouse nor barn ; and [ yet ] God feeds them . Of how much more worth are you than the birds !
42012025	And which of you by being overly anxious and troubled with cares can add a cubit to his stature or a moment [ unit ] of time to his age [ the length of his life ] ?
42012026	If then you are not able to do such a little thing as that , why are you anxious and troubled with cares about the rest ?
42012027	Consider the lilies , how they grow . They neither [ wearily ] toil nor spin nor weave ; yet I tell you , even Solomon in all his glory ( his splendor and magnificence ) was not arrayed like one of these .
42012028	But if God so clothes the grass in the field , which is alive today , and tomorrow is thrown into the furnace , how much more will He clothe you , O you [ people ] of little faith ?
42012029	And you , do not seek [ by meditating and reasoning to inquire into ] what you are to eat and what you are to drink ; nor be of anxious ( troubled ) mind [ unsettled , excited , worried , and in suspense ] ;
42012030	For all the pagan world is [ greedily ] seeking these things , and your Father knows that you need them .
42012031	Only aim at and strive for and seek His kingdom , and all these things shall be supplied to you also .
42012032	Do not be seized with alarm and struck with fear , little flock , for it is your Father’s good pleasure to give you the kingdom !
42012033	Sell what you possess and give donations to the poor ; provide yourselves with purses and handbags that do not grow old , an unfailing and inexhaustible treasure in the heavens , where no thief comes near and no moth destroys .
42012034	For where your treasure is , there will your heart be also .
42012035	Keep your loins girded and your lamps burning ,
42012036	And be like men who are waiting for their master to return home from the marriage feast , so that when he returns from the wedding and comes and knocks , they may open to him immediately .
42012037	Blessed ( happy , fortunate , and to be envied ) are those servants whom the master finds awake and alert and watching when he comes . Truly I say to you , he will gird himself and have them recline at table and will come and serve them !
42012038	If he comes in the second watch ( before midnight ) or the third watch ( after midnight ) , and finds them so , blessed ( happy , fortunate , and to be envied ) are those servants !
42012039	But of this be assured : if the householder had known at what time the burglar was coming , he would have been awake and alert and watching and would not have permitted his house to be dug through and broken into .
42012040	You also must be ready , for the Son of Man is coming at an hour and a moment when you do not anticipate it .
42012041	Peter said , Lord , are You telling this parable for us , or for all alike ?
42012042	And the Lord said , Who then is that faithful steward , the wise man whom his master will set over those in his household service to supply them their allowance of food at the appointed time ?
42012043	Blessed ( happy and to be envied ) is that servant whom his master finds so doing when he arrives .
42012044	Truly I tell you , he will set him in charge over all his possessions .
42012045	But if that servant says in his heart , My master is late in coming , and begins to strike the menservants and the maids and to eat and drink and get drunk ,
42012046	The master of that servant will come on a day when he does not expect him and at an hour of which he does not know , and will punish him and cut him off and assign his lot with the unfaithful .
42012047	And that servant who knew his master’s will but did not get ready or act as he would wish him to act shall be beaten with many [ lashes ] .
42012048	But he who did not know and did things worthy of a beating shall be beaten with few [ lashes ] . For everyone to whom much is given , of him shall much be required ; and of him to whom men entrust much , they will require and demand all the more .
42012049	I have come to cast fire upon the earth , and how I wish that it were already kindled !
42012050	I have a baptism with which to be baptized , and how greatly and sorely I am urged on ( impelled , constrained ) until it is accomplished !
42012051	Do you suppose that I have come to give peace upon earth ? No , I say to you , but rather division ;
42012052	For from now on in one house there will be five divided [ among themselves ] , three against two and two against three .
42012053	They will be divided , father against son and son against father , mother against daughter and daughter against mother , mother-in-law against her daughter-in-law and daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law .
42012054	He also said to the crowds of people , When you see a cloud rising in the west , at once you say , It is going to rain ! And so it does .
42012055	And when [ you see that ] a south wind is blowing , you say , There will be severe heat ! And it occurs .
42012056	You playactors ( hypocrites ) ! You know how [ intelligently ] to discern and interpret and prove the looks of the earth and sky ; but how is it that you do not know how to discern and interpret and apply the proof to this present time ?
42012057	And why do you not judge what is just and personally decide what is right ?
42012058	Then as you go with your accuser before a magistrate , on the way make a diligent effort to settle and be quit ( free ) of him , lest he drag you to the judge , and the judge turn you over to the officer , and the officer put you in prison .
42012059	I tell you , you will never get out until you have paid the very last [ fraction of a ] cent .
42013001	JUST AT that time there [ arrived ] some people who informed Jesus about the Galileans whose blood Pilate had mixed with their sacrifices .
42013002	And He replied by saying to them , Do you think that these Galileans were greater sinners than all the other Galileans because they have suffered in this way ?
42013003	I tell you , No ; but unless you repent ( change your mind for the better and heartily amend your ways , with abhorrence of your past sins ) , you will all likewise perish and be lost eternally .
42013004	Or those eighteen on whom the tower in Siloam fell and killed them -- do you think that they were more guilty offenders ( debtors ) than all the others who dwelt in Jerusalem ?
42013005	I tell you , No ; but unless you repent ( change your mind for the better and heartily amend your ways , with abhorrence of your past sins ) , you will all likewise perish and be lost eternally .
42013006	And He told them this parable : A certain man had a fig tree , planted in his vineyard , and he came looking for fruit on it , but did not find [ any ] .
42013007	So he said to the vinedresser , See here ! For these three years I have come looking for fruit on this fig tree and I find none . Cut it down ! Why should it continue also to use up the ground [ to deplete the soil , intercept the sun , and take up room ] ?
42013008	But he replied to him , Leave it alone , sir , [ just ] this one more year , till I dig around it and put manure [ on the soil ] .
42013009	Then perhaps it will bear fruit after this ; but if not , you can cut it down and out .
42013010	Now Jesus was teaching in one of the synagogues on the Sabbath .
42013011	And there was a woman there who for eighteen years had had an infirmity caused by a spirit ( a demon of sickness ) . She was bent completely forward and utterly unable to straighten herself up or to look upward .
42013012	And when Jesus saw her , He called [ her to Him ] and said to her , Woman , you are released from your infirmity !
42013013	Then He laid [ His ] hands on her , and instantly she was made straight , and she recognized and thanked and praised God .
42013014	But the leader of the synagogue , indignant because Jesus had healed on the Sabbath , said to the crowd , There are six days on which work ought to be done ; so come on those days and be cured , and not on the Sabbath day .
42013015	But the Lord replied to him , saying , You playactors ( hypocrites ) ! Does not each one of you on the Sabbath loose his ox or his donkey from the stall and lead it out to water it ?
42013016	And ought not this woman , a daughter of Abraham , whom Satan has kept bound for eighteen years , be loosed from this bond on the Sabbath day ?
42013017	Even as He said this , all His opponents were put to shame , and all the people were rejoicing over all the glorious things that were being done by Him .
42013018	This led Him to say , What is the kingdom of God like ? And to what shall I compare it ?
42013019	It is like a grain of mustard seed , which a man took and planted in his own garden ; and it grew and became a tree , and the wild birds found shelter and roosted and nested in its branches .
42013020	And again He said , To what shall I liken the kingdom of God ?
42013021	It is like leaven which a woman took and hid in three measures of wheat flour or meal until it was all leavened ( fermented ) .
42013022	[ Jesus ] journeyed on through towns and villages , teaching , and making His way toward Jerusalem .
42013023	And someone asked Him , Lord , will only a few be saved ( rescued , delivered from the penalties of the last judgment , and made partakers of the salvation by Christ ) ? And He said to them ,
42013024	Strive to enter by the narrow door [ force yourselves through it ] , for many , I tell you , will try to enter and will not be able .
42013025	When once the Master of the house gets up and closes the door , and you begin to stand outside and to knock at the door [ again and again ] , saying , Lord , open to us ! He will answer you , I do not know where [ what household -- certainly not Mine ] you come from .
42013026	Then you will begin to say , We ate and drank in Your presence , and You taught in our streets .
42013027	But He will say , I tell you , I do not know where [ what household -- certainly not Mine ] you come from ; depart from Me , all you wrongdoers !
42013028	There will be weeping and grinding of teeth when you see Abraham and Isaac and Jacob and all the prophets in the kingdom of God , but you yourselves being cast forth ( banished , driven away ) .
42013029	And [ people ] will come from east and west , and from north and south , and sit down ( feast at table ) in the kingdom of God .
42013030	And behold , there are some [ now ] last who will be first [ then ] , and there are some [ now ] first who will be last [ then ] .
42013031	At that very hour some Pharisees came up and said to Him , Go away from here , for Herod is determined to kill You .
42013032	And He said to them , Go and tell that fox [ sly and crafty , skulking and cowardly ] , Behold , I drive out demons and perform healings today and tomorrow , and on the third day I finish ( complete ) My course .
42013033	Nevertheless , I must continue on My way today and tomorrow and the day after that -- for it will never do for a prophet to be destroyed away from Jerusalem !
42013034	O Jerusalem , Jerusalem , you who continue to kill the prophets and to stone those who are sent to you ! How often I have desired and yearned to gather your children together [ around Me ] , as a hen [ gathers ] her young under her wings , but you would not !
42013035	Behold , your house is forsaken ( abandoned , left to you destitute of God’s help ) ! And I tell you , you will not see Me again until the time comes when you shall say , Blessed ( to be celebrated with praises ) is He Who comes in the name of the Lord !
42014001	IT OCCURRED one Sabbath , when [ Jesus ] went for a meal at the house of one of the ruling Pharisees , that they were [ engaged in ] watching Him [ closely ] .
42014002	And behold , [ just ] in front of Him there was a man who had dropsy .
42014003	And Jesus asked the lawyers and the Pharisees , Is it lawful and right to cure on the Sabbath or not ?
42014004	But they kept silent . Then He took hold [ of the man ] and cured him and sent him away .
42014005	And He said to them , Which of you , having a son or a donkey or an ox that has fallen into a well , will not at once pull him out on the Sabbath day ?
42014006	And they were unable to reply to this .
42014007	Now He told a parable to those who were invited , [ when ] He noticed how they were selecting the places of honor , saying to them ,
42014008	When you are invited by anyone to a marriage feast , do not recline on the chief seat [ in the place of honor ] , lest a more distinguished person than you has been invited by him ,
42014009	And he who invited both of you will come to you and say , Let this man have the place [ you have taken ] . Then , with humiliation and a guilty sense of impropriety , you will begin to take the lowest place .
42014010	But when you are invited , go and recline in the lowest place , so that when your host comes in , he may say to you , Friend , go up higher ! Then you will be honored in the presence of all who sit [ at table ] with you .
42014011	For everyone who exalts himself will be humbled ( ranked below others who are honored or rewarded ) , and he who humbles himself ( keeps a modest opinion of himself and behaves accordingly ) will be exalted ( elevated in rank ) .
42014012	Jesus also said to the man who had invited Him , When you give a dinner or a supper , do not invite your friends or your brothers or your relatives or your wealthy neighbors , lest perhaps they also invite you in return , and so you are paid back .
42014013	But when you give a banquet or a reception , invite the poor , the disabled , the lame , and the blind .
42014014	Then you will be blessed ( happy , fortunate , and to be envied ) , because they have no way of repaying you , and you will be recompensed at the resurrection of the just ( upright ) .
42014015	When one of those who reclined [ at the table ] with Him heard this , he said to Him , Blessed ( happy , fortunate , and to be envied ) is he who shall eat bread in the kingdom of God !
42014016	But Jesus said to him , A man was once giving a great supper and invited many ;
42014017	And at the hour for the supper he sent his servant to say to those who had been invited , Come , for all is now ready .
42014018	But they all alike began to make excuses and to beg off . The first said to him , I have bought a piece of land , and I have to go out and see it ; I beg you , have me excused .
42014019	And another said , I have bought five yoke of oxen , and I am going to examine and put my approval on them ; I beg you , have me excused .
42014020	And another said , I have married a wife , and because of this I am unable to come .
42014021	So the servant came and reported these [ answers ] to his master . Then the master of the house said in wrath to his servant , Go quickly into the great streets and the small streets of the city and bring in here the poor and the disabled and the blind and the lame .
42014022	And the servant [ returning ] said , Sir , what you have commanded me to do has been done , and yet there is room .
42014023	Then the master said to the servant , Go out into the highways and hedges and urge and constrain [ them ] to yield and come in , so that my house may be filled .
42014024	For I tell you , not one of those who were invited shall taste my supper .
42014025	Now huge crowds were going along with [ Jesus ] , and He turned and said to them ,
42014026	If anyone comes to Me and does not hate his [ own ] father and mother [ in the sense of indifference to or relative disregard for them in comparison with his attitude toward God ] and [ likewise ] his wife and children and brothers and sisters -- [ yes ] and even his own life also -- he cannot be My disciple .
42014027	Whoever does not persevere and carry his own cross and come after ( follow ) Me cannot be My disciple .
42014028	For which of you , wishing to build a farm building , does not first sit down and calculate the cost [ to see ] whether he has sufficient means to finish it ?
42014029	Otherwise , when he has laid the foundation and is unable to complete [ the building ] , all who see it will begin to mock and jeer at him ,
42014030	Saying , This man began to build and was not able ( worth enough ) to finish .
42014031	Or what king , going out to engage in conflict with another king , will not first sit down and consider and take counsel whether he is able with ten thousand [ men ] to meet him who comes against him with twenty thousand ?
42014032	And if he cannot [ do so ] , when the other king is still a great way off , he sends an envoy and asks the terms of peace .
42014033	So then , any of you who does not forsake ( renounce , surrender claim to , give up , say good-bye to ) all that he has cannot be My disciple .
42014034	Salt is good [ an excellent thing ] , but if salt has lost its strength and has become saltless ( insipid , flat ) , how shall its saltness be restored ?
42014035	It is fit neither for the land nor for the manure heap ; men throw it away . He who has ears to hear , let him listen and consider and comprehend by hearing !
42015001	NOW THE tax collectors and [ notorious and especially wicked ] sinners were all coming near to [ Jesus ] to listen to Him .
42015002	And the Pharisees and the scribes kept muttering and indignantly complaining , saying , This man accepts and receives and welcomes [ preeminently wicked ] sinners and eats with them .
42015003	So He told them this parable :
42015004	What man of you , if he has a hundred sheep and should lose one of them , does not leave the ninety-nine in the wilderness ( desert ) and go after the one that is lost until he finds it ?
42015005	And when he has found it , he lays it on his [ own ] shoulders , rejoicing .
42015006	And when he gets home , he summons together [ his ] friends and [ his ] neighbors , saying to them , Rejoice with me , because I have found my sheep which was lost .
42015007	Thus , I tell you , there will be more joy in heaven over one [ especially ] wicked person who repents ( changes his mind , abhorring his errors and misdeeds , and determines to enter upon a better course of life ) than over ninety-nine righteous persons who have no need of repentance .
42015008	Or what woman , having ten [ silver ] drachmas [ each one equal to a day’s wages ] , if she loses one coin , does not light a lamp and sweep the house and look carefully and diligently until she finds it ?
42015009	And when she has found it , she summons her [ women ] friends and neighbors , saying , Rejoice with me , for I have found the silver coin which I had lost .
42015010	Even so , I tell you , there is joy among and in the presence of the angels of God over one [ especially ] wicked person who repents ( changes his mind for the better , heartily amending his ways , with abhorrence of his past sins ) .
42015011	And He said , There was a certain man who had two sons ;
42015012	And the younger of them said to his father , Father , give me the part of the property that falls [ to me ] . And he divided the estate between them .
42015013	And not many days after that , the younger son gathered up all that he had and journeyed into a distant country , and there he wasted his fortune in reckless and loose [ from restraint ] living .
42015014	And when he had spent all he had , a mighty famine came upon that country , and he began to fall behind and be in want .
42015015	So he went and forced ( glued ) himself upon one of the citizens of that country , who sent him into his fields to feed hogs .
42015016	And he would gladly have fed on and filled his belly with the carob pods that the hogs were eating , but [ they could not satisfy his hunger and ] nobody gave him anything [ better ] .
42015017	Then when he came to himself , he said , How many hired servants of my father have enough food , and [ even food ] to spare , but I am perishing ( dying ) here of hunger !
42015018	I will get up and go to my father , and I will say to him , Father , I have sinned against heaven and in your sight .
42015019	I am no longer worthy to be called your son ; [ just ] make me like one of your hired servants .
42015020	So he got up and came to his [ own ] father . But while he was still a long way off , his father saw him and was moved with pity and tenderness [ for him ] ; and he ran and embraced him and kissed him [ fervently ] .
42015021	And the son said to him , Father , I have sinned against heaven and in your sight ; I am no longer worthy to be called your son [ I no longer deserve to be recognized as a son of yours ] !
42015022	But the father said to his bond servants , Bring quickly the best robe ( the festive robe of honor ) and put it on him ; and give him a ring for his hand and sandals for his feet .
42015023	And bring out that [ wheat- ] fattened calf and kill it ; and let us revel and feast and be happy and make merry ,
42015024	Because this my son was dead and is alive again ; he was lost and is found ! And they began to revel and feast and make merry .
42015025	But his older son was in the field ; and as he returned and came near the house , he heard music and dancing .
42015026	And having called one of the servant [ boys ] to him , he began to ask what this meant .
42015027	And he said to him , Your brother has come , and your father has killed that [ wheat- ] fattened calf , because he has received him back safe and well .
42015028	But [ the elder brother ] was angry [ with deep-seated wrath ] and resolved not to go in . Then his father came out and began to plead with him ,
42015029	But he answered his father , Look ! These many years I have served you , and I have never disobeyed your command . Yet you never gave me [ so much as ] a [ little ] kid , that I might revel and feast and be happy and make merry with my friends ;
42015030	But when this son of yours arrived , who has devoured your estate with immoral women , you have killed for him that [ wheat- ] fattened calf !
42015031	And the father said to him , Son , you are always with me , and all that is mine is yours .
42015032	But it was fitting to make merry , to revel and feast and rejoice , for this brother of yours was dead and is alive again ! He was lost and is found !
42016001	ALSO [ Jesus ] said to the disciples , There was a certain rich man who had a manager of his estate , and accusations [ against this man ] were brought to him , that he was squandering his [ master’s ] possessions .
42016002	And he called him and said to him , What is this that I hear about you ? Turn in the account of your management [ of my affairs ] , for you can be [ my ] manager no longer .
42016003	And the manager of the estate said to himself , What shall I do , seeing that my master is taking the management away from me ? I am not able to dig , and I am ashamed to beg .
42016004	I have come to know what I will do , so that they [ my master’s debtors ] may accept and welcome me into their houses when I am put out of the management .
42016005	So he summoned his master’s debtors one by one , and he said to the first , How much do you owe my master ?
42016006	He said , A hundred measures [ about 900 gallons ] of oil . And he said to him , Take back your written acknowledgement of obligation , and sit down quickly and write fifty [ about 450 gallons ] .
42016007	After that he said to another , And how much do you owe ? He said , A hundred measures [ about 900 bushels ] of wheat . He said to him , Take back your written acknowledgement of obligation , and write eighty [ about 700 bushels ] .
42016008	And [ his ] master praised the dishonest ( unjust ) manager for acting shrewdly and prudently ; for the sons of this age are shrewder and more prudent and wiser in [ relation to ] their own generation [ to their own age and kind ] than are the sons of light .
42016009	And I tell you , make friends for yourselves by means of unrighteous mammon ( deceitful riches , money , possessions ) , so that when it fails , they [ those you have favored ] may receive and welcome you into the everlasting habitations ( dwellings ) .
42016010	He who is faithful in a very little [ thing ] is faithful also in much , and he who is dishonest and unjust in a very little [ thing ] is dishonest and unjust also in much .
42016011	Therefore if you have not been faithful in the [ case of ] unrighteous mammon ( deceitful riches , money , possessions ) , who will entrust to you the true riches ?
42016012	And if you have not proved faithful in that which belongs to another [ whether God or man ] , who will give you that which is your own [ that is , the true riches ] ?
42016013	No servant is able to serve two masters ; for either he will hate the one and love the other , or he will stand by and be devoted to the one and despise the other . You cannot serve God and mammon ( riches , or anything in which you trust and on which you rely ) .
42016014	Now the Pharisees , who were covetous and lovers of money , heard all these things [ taken together ] , and they began to sneer at and ridicule and scoff at Him .
42016015	But He said to them , You are the ones who declare yourselves just and upright before men , but God knows your hearts . For what is exalted and highly thought of among men is detestable and abhorrent ( an abomination ) in the sight of God .
42016016	Until John came , there were the Law and the Prophets ; since then the good news ( the Gospel ) of the kingdom of God is being preached , and everyone strives violently to go in [ would force his own way rather than God’s way into it ] .
42016017	Yet it is easier for heaven and earth to pass away than for one dot of the Law to fail and become void .
42016018	Whoever divorces ( dismisses and repudiates ) his wife and marries another commits adultery , and he who marries a woman who is divorced from her husband commits adultery .
42016019	There was a certain rich man who [ habitually ] clothed himself in purple and fine linen and reveled and feasted and made merry in splendor every day .
42016020	And at his gate there was [ carelessly ] dropped down and left a certain utterly destitute man named Lazarus , [ reduced to begging alms and ] covered with [ ulcerated ] sores .
42016021	He [ eagerly ] desired to be satisfied with what fell from the rich man’s table ; moreover , the dogs even came and licked his sores .
42016022	And it occurred that the man [ reduced to ] begging died and was carried by the angels to Abraham’s bosom . The rich man also died and was buried .
42016023	And in Hades ( the realm of the dead ) , being in torment , he lifted up his eyes and saw Abraham far away , and Lazarus in his bosom .
42016024	And he cried out and said , Father Abraham , have pity and mercy on me and send Lazarus to dip the tip of his finger in water and cool my tongue , for I am in anguish in this flame .
42016025	But Abraham said , Child , remember that you in your lifetime fully received [ what is due you in ] comforts and delights , and Lazarus in like manner the discomforts and distresses ; but now he is comforted here and you are in anguish .
42016026	And besides all this , between us and you a great chasm has been fixed , in order that those who want to pass from this [ place ] to you may not be able , and no one may pass from there to us .
42016027	And [ the man ] said , Then , father , I beseech you to send him to my father’s house --
42016028	For I have five brothers -- so that he may give [ solemn ] testimony and warn them , lest they too come into this place of torment .
42016029	But Abraham said , They have Moses and the Prophets ; let them hear and listen to them .
42016030	But he answered , No , father Abraham , but if someone from the dead goes to them , they will repent ( change their minds for the better and heartily amend their ways , with abhorrence of their past sins ) .
42016031	He said to him , If they do not hear and listen to Moses and the Prophets , neither will they be persuaded and convinced and believe [ even ] if someone should rise from the dead .
42017001	AND [ Jesus ] said to His disciples , Temptations ( snares , traps set to entice to sin ) are sure to come , but woe to him by or through whom they come !
42017002	It would be more profitable for him if a millstone were hung around his neck and he were hurled into the sea than that he should cause to sin or be a snare to one of these little ones [ lowly in rank or influence ] .
42017003	Pay attention and always be on your guard [ looking out for one another ] . If your brother sins ( misses the mark ) , solemnly tell him so and reprove him , and if he repents ( feels sorry for having sinned ) , forgive him .
42017004	And even if he sins against you seven times in a day , and turns to you seven times and says , I repent [ I am sorry ] , you must forgive him ( give up resentment and consider the offense as recalled and annulled ) .
42017005	The apostles said to the Lord , Increase our faith ( that trust and confidence that spring from our belief in God ) .
42017006	And the Lord answered , If you had faith ( trust and confidence in God ) even [ so small ] like a grain of mustard seed , you could say to this mulberry tree , Be pulled up by the roots , and be planted in the sea , and it would obey you .
42017007	Will any man of you who has a servant plowing or tending sheep say to him when he has come in from the field , Come at once and take your place at the table ?
42017008	Will he not instead tell him , Get my supper ready and gird yourself and serve me while I eat and drink ; then afterward you yourself shall eat and drink ?
42017009	Is he grateful and does he praise the servant because he did what he was ordered to do ?
42017010	Even so on your part , when you have done everything that was assigned and commanded you , say , We are unworthy servants [ possessing no merit , for we have not gone beyond our obligation ] ; we have [ merely ] done what was our duty to do .
42017011	As He went on His way to Jerusalem , it occurred that [ Jesus ] was passing [ along the border ] between Samaria and Galilee .
42017012	And as He was going into one village , He was met by ten lepers , who stood at a distance .

42017021	Nor will people say , Look ! Here [ it is ] ! or , See , [ it is ] there ! For behold , the kingdom of God is within you [ in your hearts ] and among you [ surrounding you ] .

42017035	There will be two women grinding together ; one will be taken and the other will be left .
42017036	Two men will be in the field ; one will be taken and the other will be left .

42018001	ALSO [ Jesus ] told them a parable to the effect that they ought always to pray and not to turn coward ( faint , lose heart , and give up ) .

42019001	AND [ Jesus ] entered Jericho and was passing through it .
42019002	And there was a man called Zacchaeus , a chief tax collector , and [ he was ] rich .
42019003	And he was trying to see Jesus , which One He was , but he could not on account of the crowd , because he was small in stature .
42019004	So he ran on ahead and climbed up in a sycamore tree in order to see Him , for He was about to pass that way .
42019005	And when Jesus reached the place , He looked up and said to him , Zacchaeus , hurry and come down ; for I must stay at your house today .
42019006	So he hurried and came down , and he received and welcomed Him joyfully .
42019007	And when the people saw it , they all muttered among themselves and indignantly complained , He has gone in to be the guest of and lodge with a man who is devoted to sin and preeminently a sinner .
42019008	So then Zacchaeus stood up and solemnly declared to the Lord , See , Lord , the half of my goods I [ now ] give [ by way of restoration ] to the poor , and if I have cheated anyone out of anything , I [ now ] restore four times as much .
42019009	And Jesus said to him , Today is [ Messianic and spiritual ] salvation come to [ all the members of ] this household , since Zacchaeus too is a [ real spiritual ] son of Abraham ;
42019010	For the Son of Man came to seek and to save that which was lost .
42019011	Now as they were listening to these things , He proceeded to tell a parable , because He was approaching Jerusalem and because they thought that the kingdom of God was going to be brought to light and shown forth immediately .
42019012	He therefore said , A certain nobleman went into a distant country to obtain for himself a kingdom and then to return .
42019013	Calling ten of his [ own ] bond servants , he gave them ten minas [ each equal to about one hundred days’ wages or nearly twenty dollars ] and said to them , Buy and sell with these while I go and then return .
42019014	But his citizens detested him and sent an embassy after him to say , We do not want this man to become ruler over us .
42019015	When he returned after having received the kingdom , he ordered these bond servants to whom he had given the money to be called to him , that he might know how much each one had made by buying and selling .
42019016	The first one came before him , and he said , Lord , your mina has made ten [ additional ] minas .
42019017	And he said to him , Well done , excellent bond servant ! Because you have been faithful and trustworthy in a very little [ thing ] , you shall have authority over ten cities .
42019018	The second one also came and said , Lord , your mina has made five more minas .
42019019	And he said also to him , And you will take charge over five cities .
42019020	Then another came and said , Lord , here is your mina , which I have kept laid up in a handkerchief .
42019021	For I was [ constantly ] afraid of you , because you are a stern ( hard , severe ) man ; you pick up what you did not lay down , and you reap what you did not sow .
42019022	He said to the servant , I will judge and condemn you out of your own mouth , you wicked slave ! You knew [ did you ] that I was a stern ( hard , severe ) man , picking up what I did not lay down , and reaping what I did not sow ?
42019023	Then why did you not put my money in a bank , so that on my return , I might have collected it with interest ?
42019024	And he said to the bystanders , Take the mina away from him and give it to him who has the ten minas .
42019025	And they said to him , Lord , he has ten minas [ already ] !
42019026	And [ said Jesus , ] I tell you that to everyone who gets and has will more be given , but from the man who does not get and does not have , even what he has will be taken away .
42019027	[ The indignant king ended by saying ] But as for these enemies of mine who did not want me to reign over them -- bring them here and slaughter them in my presence !
42019028	And after saying these things , Jesus went on ahead of them , going up to Jerusalem .
42019029	When He came near Bethphage and Bethany at the mount called [ the Mount of ] Olives , He sent two of His disciples ,
42019030	Telling [ them ] , Go into the village yonder ; there , as you go in , you will find a donkey’s colt tied , on which no man has ever yet sat . Loose it and bring [ it here ] .
42019031	If anybody asks you , Why are you untying [ it ] ? you shall say this : Because the Lord has need of it .
42019032	So those who were sent went away and found it [ just ] as He had told them .
42019033	And as they were loosening the colt , its owners said to them , Why are you untying the colt ?
42019034	And they said , The Lord has need of it .
42019035	And they brought it to Jesus ; then they threw their garments over the colt and set Jesus upon it .
42019036	And as He rode along , the people kept spreading their garments on the road .
42019037	As He was approaching [ the city ] , at the descent of the Mount of Olives , the whole crowd of the disciples began to rejoice and to praise God [ extolling Him exultantly and ] loudly for all the mighty miracles and works of power that they had witnessed ,
42019038	Crying , Blessed ( celebrated with praises ) is the King Who comes in the name of the Lord ! Peace in heaven [ freedom there from all the distresses that are experienced as the result of sin ] and glory ( majesty and splendor ) in the highest [ heaven ] !
42019039	And some of the Pharisees from the throng said to Jesus , Teacher , reprove Your disciples !
42019040	He replied , I tell you that if these keep silent , the very stones will cry out .
42019041	And as He approached , He saw the city , and He wept [ audibly ] over it ,
42019042	Exclaiming , Would that you had known personally , even at least in this your day , the things that make for peace ( for freedom from all the distresses that are experienced as the result of sin and upon which your peace -- your security , safety , prosperity , and happiness -- depends ) ! But now they are hidden from your eyes .
42019043	For a time is coming upon you when your enemies will throw up a bank [ with pointed stakes ] about you and surround you and shut you in on every side .
42019044	And they will dash you down to the ground , you [ Jerusalem ] and your children within you ; and they will not leave in you one stone upon another , [ all ] because you did not come progressively to recognize and know and understand [ from observation and experience ] the time of your visitation [ that is , when God was visiting you , the time in which God showed Himself gracious toward you and offered you salvation through Christ ] .
42019045	Then He went into the temple [ enclosure ] and began to drive out those who were selling ,
42019046	Telling them , It is written , My house shall be a house of prayer ; but you have made it a cave of robbers .
42019047	And He continued to teach day after day in the temple [ porches and courts ] . The chief priests and scribes and the leading men of the people were seeking to put Him to death ,
42019048	But they did not discover anything they could do , for all the people hung upon His words and stuck by Him .
42020001	ONE DAY as Jesus was instructing the people in the temple [ porches ] and preaching the good news ( the Gospel ) , the chief priests and the scribes came up with the elders ( members of the Sanhedrin )
42020002	And said to Him , Tell us by what [ sort of ] authority You are doing these things ? Or who is it who gave You this authority ?
42020003	He replied to them , I will also ask you a question . Now answer Me :
42020004	Was the baptism of John from heaven , or from men ?
42020005	And they argued and discussed [ it ] and reasoned together with themselves , saying , If we reply , From heaven , He will say , Why then did you not believe him ?
42020006	But if we answer , From men , all the people will stone us to death , for they are long since firmly convinced that John was a prophet .
42020007	So they replied that they did not know from where it came .
42020008	Then Jesus said to them , Neither will I tell you by what authority I do these things .
42020009	Then He began to relate to the people this parable ( this story to figuratively portray what He had to say ) : A man planted a vineyard and leased it to some vinedressers and went into another country for a long stay .
42020010	When the [ right ] season came , he sent a bond servant to the tenants , that they might give him [ his part ] of the fruit of the vineyard ; but the tenants beat ( thrashed ) him and sent him away empty-handed .
42020011	And he sent still another servant ; him they also beat ( thrashed ) and dishonored and insulted him disgracefully and sent him away empty-handed .
42020012	And he sent yet a third ; this one they wounded and threw out [ of the vineyard ] .
42020013	Then the owner of the vineyard said , What shall I do ? I will send my beloved son ; it is probable that they will respect him .
42020014	But when the tenants saw him , they argued among themselves , saying , This is the heir ; let us kill him , so that the inheritance may be ours .
42020015	So they drove him out of the vineyard and killed him . What then will the owner of the vineyard do to them ?
42020016	He will come and [ utterly ] put an end to those tenants and will give the vineyard to others . When they [ the chief priests and the scribes and the elders ] heard this , they said , May it never be !
42020017	But [ Jesus ] looked at them and said , What then is [ the meaning of ] this that is written : The [ very ] Stone which the builders rejected has become the chief Stone of the corner [ Cornerstone ] ?
42020018	Everyone who falls on that Stone will be broken [ in pieces ] ; but upon whomever It falls , It will crush him [ winnow him and scatter him as dust ] .
42020019	The scribes and the chief priests desired and tried to find a way to arrest Him at that very hour , but they were afraid of the people ; for they discerned that He had related this parable against them .
42020020	So they watched [ for an opportunity to ensnare ] Him , and sent spies who pretended to be upright ( honest and sincere ) , that they might lay hold of something He might say , so as to turn Him over to the control and authority of the governor .
42020021	They asked Him , Teacher , we know that You speak and teach what is right , and that You show no partiality to anyone but teach the way of God honestly and in truth .
42020022	Is it lawful for us to give tribute to Caesar or not ?
42020023	But He recognized and understood their cunning and unscrupulousness and said to them ,
42020024	Show Me a denarius ( a coin ) ! Whose image and inscription does it have ? They answered , Caesar’s .
42020025	He said to them , Then render to Caesar the things that are Caesar’s , and to God the things that are God’s .
42020026	So they could not in the presence of the people take hold of anything He said to turn it against Him ; but marveling at His reply , they were silent .
42020027	Also there came to Him some Sadducees , those who say that there is no resurrection .
42020028	And they asked Him a question , saying , Teacher , Moses wrote for us [ a law ] that if a man’s brother dies , leaving a wife and no children , the man shall take the woman and raise up offspring for his brother .
42020029	Now there were seven brothers ; and the first took a wife and died without [ having any ] children .
42020030	And the second
42020031	And then the third took her , and in like manner all seven , and they died , leaving no children .
42020032	Last of all , the woman died also .
42020033	Now in the resurrection whose wife will the woman be ? For the seven married her .
42020034	And Jesus said to them , The people of this world and present age marry and are given in marriage ;
42020035	But those who are considered worthy to gain that other world and that future age and to attain to the resurrection from the dead neither marry nor are given in marriage ;
42020036	For they cannot die again , but they are angel-like and equal to angels . And being sons of and sharers in the resurrection , they are sons of God .
42020037	But that the dead are raised [ from death ] -- even Moses made known and showed in the passage concerning the [ burning ] bush , where he calls the Lord , The God of Abraham , the God of Isaac , and the God of Jacob .
42020038	Now He is not the God of the dead , but of the living , for to Him all men are alive [ whether in the body or out of it ] and they are alive [ not dead ] unto Him [ in definite relationship to Him ] .
42020039	And some of the scribes replied , Teacher , you have spoken well and expertly [ so that there is no room for blame ] .
42020040	For they did not dare to question Him further .
42020041	But He asked them , How can people say that the Christ ( the Messiah , the Anointed One ) is David’s Son ?
42020042	For David himself says in [ the ] Book of Psalms , The Lord said to my Lord , Sit at My right hand
42020043	Until I make Your enemies a footstool for Your feet .
42020044	So David calls Him Lord ; how then is He his Son ?
42020045	And with all the people listening , He said to His disciples ,
42020046	Beware of the scribes , who like to walk about in long robes and love to be saluted [ with honor ] in places where people congregate and love the front and best seats in the synagogues and places of distinction at feasts ,
42020047	Who make away with and devour widows’ houses , and [ to cover it up ] with pretense make long prayers . They will receive the greater condemnation ( the heavier sentence , the severer punishment ) .
42021001	LOOKING UP , [ Jesus ] saw the rich people putting their gifts into the treasury .
42021002	And He saw also a poor widow putting in two mites ( copper coins ) .
42021003	And He said , Truly I say to you , this poor widow has put in more than all of them ;
42021004	For they all gave out of their abundance ( their surplus ) ; but she has contributed out of her lack and her want , putting in all that she had on which to live .
42021005	And as some were saying of the temple that it was decorated with handsome ( shapely and magnificent ) stones and consecrated offerings [ laid up to be kept ] , He said ,
42021006	As for all this that you [ thoughtfully ] look at , the time will come when there shall not be left here one stone upon another that will not be thrown down .
42021007	And they asked Him , Teacher , when will this happen ? And what sign will there be when this is about to occur ?
42021008	And He said , Be on your guard and be careful that you are not led astray ; for many will come in My name [ appropriating to themselves the name Messiah which belongs to Me ] , saying , I am He ! and , The time is at hand ! Do not go out after them .
42021009	And when you hear of wars and insurrections ( disturbances , disorder , and confusion ) , do not become alarmed and panic-stricken and terrified ; for all this must take place first , but the end will not [ come ] immediately .
42021010	Then He told them , Nation will rise against nation , and kingdom against kingdom .
42021011	There will be mighty and violent earthquakes , and in various places famines and pestilences ( plagues : malignant and contagious or infectious epidemic diseases which are deadly and devastating ) ; and there will be sights of terror and great signs from heaven .
42021012	But previous to all this , they will lay their hands on you and persecute you , turning you over to the synagogues and prisons , and you will be led away before kings and governors for My name’s sake .
42021013	This will be a time ( an opportunity ) for you to bear testimony .
42021014	Resolve and settle it in your minds not to meditate and prepare beforehand how you are to make your defense and how you will answer .
42021015	For I [ Myself ] will give you a mouth and such utterance and wisdom that all of your foes combined will be unable to stand against or refute .
42021016	You will be delivered up and betrayed even by parents and brothers and relatives and friends , and [ some ] of you they will put to death .
42021017	And you will be hated ( despised ) by everyone because [ you bear ] My name and for its sake .
42021018	But not a hair of your head shall perish .
42021019	By your steadfastness and patient endurance you shall win the true life of your souls .
42021020	But when you see Jerusalem surrounded by armies , then know and understand that its desolation has come near .
42021021	Then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains , and let those who are inside [ the city ] get out of it , and let not those who are out in the country come into it ;
42021022	For those are days of vengeance [ of rendering full justice or satisfaction ] , that all things that are written may be fulfilled .
42021023	Alas for those who are pregnant and for those who have babies which they are nursing in those days ! For great misery and anguish and distress shall be upon the land and indignation and punishment and retribution upon this people .
42021024	They will fall by the mouth and the edge of the sword and will be led away as captives to and among all nations ; and Jerusalem will be trodden down by the Gentiles until the times of the Gentiles are fulfilled ( completed ) .
42021025	And there will be signs in the sun and moon and stars ; and upon the earth [ there will be ] distress ( trouble and anguish ) of nations in bewilderment and perplexity [ without resources , left wanting , embarrassed , in doubt , not knowing which way to turn ] at the roaring ( the echo ) of the tossing of the sea ,
42021026	Men swooning away or expiring with fear and dread and apprehension and expectation of the things that are coming on the world ; for the [ very ] powers of the heavens will be shaken and caused to totter .
42021027	And then they will see the Son of Man coming in a cloud with great ( transcendent and overwhelming ) power and [ all His kingly ] glory ( majesty and splendor ) .
42021028	Now when these things begin to occur , look up and lift up your heads , because your redemption ( deliverance ) is drawing near .
42021029	And He told them a parable : Look at the fig tree and all the trees ;
42021030	When they put forth their buds and come out in leaf , you see for yourselves and perceive and know that summer is already near .
42021031	Even so , when you see these things taking place , understand and know that the kingdom of God is at hand .
42021032	Truly I tell you , this generation ( those living at that definite period of time ) will not perish and pass away until all has taken place .
42021033	The sky and the earth ( the universe , the world ) will pass away , but My words will not pass away .
42021034	But take heed to yourselves and be on your guard , lest your hearts be overburdened and depressed ( weighed down ) with the giddiness and headache and nausea of self-indulgence , drunkenness , and worldly worries and cares pertaining to [ the business of ] this life , and [ lest ] that day come upon you suddenly like a trap or a noose ;
42021035	For it will come upon all who live upon the face of the entire earth .
42021036	Keep awake then and watch at all times [ be discreet , attentive , and ready ] , praying that you may have the full strength and ability and be accounted worthy to escape all these things [ taken together ] that will take place , and to stand in the presence of the Son of Man .
42021037	Now in the daytime Jesus was teaching in [ the porches and courts of ] the temple , but at night He would go out and stay on the mount called Olivet .
42021038	And early in the morning all the people came to Him in the temple [ porches or courts ] to listen to Him .
42022001	NOW THE Festival of Unleavened Bread was drawing near , which is called the Passover .
42022002	And the chief priests and the scribes were seeking how to do away with [ Jesus ] , for they feared the people .
42022003	But [ then ] Satan entered into Judas , called Iscariot , who was one of the Twelve [ apostles ] .
42022004	And he went away and discussed with the chief priests and captains how he might betray Him and deliver Him up to them .
42022005	And they were delighted and pledged [ themselves ] to give him money .
42022006	So he agreed [ to this ] , and sought an opportunity to betray Him to them [ without an uprising ] in the absence of the throng .
42022007	Then came the day of Unleavened Bread on which the Passover [ lamb ] had to be slain .
42022008	So Jesus sent Peter and John , saying , Go and prepare for us the Passover meal , that we may eat it .
42022009	They said to Him , Where do You want us to prepare [ it ] ?
42022010	He said to them , Behold , when you have gone into the city , a man carrying an earthen jug or pitcher of water will meet you ; follow him into the house which he enters ,
42022011	And say to the master of the house , The Teacher asks you , Where is the guest room , where I may eat the Passover [ meal ] with My disciples ?
42022012	And he will show you a large room upstairs , furnished [ with carpets and with couches properly spread ] ; there make [ your ] preparations .
