42022013	And they went and found it [ just ] as He had said to them ; and they made ready the Passover [ supper ] .
42022014	And when the hour came , [ Jesus ] reclined at table , and the apostles with Him .
42022015	And He said to them , I have earnestly and intensely desired to eat this Passover with you before I suffer ;
42022016	For I say to you , I shall eat it no more until it is fulfilled in the kingdom of God .
42022017	And He took a cup , and when He had given thanks , He said , Take this and divide and distribute it among yourselves ;
42022018	For I say to you that from now on I shall not drink of the fruit of the vine at all until the kingdom of God comes .
42022019	Then He took a loaf [ of bread ] , and when He had given thanks , He broke [ it ] and gave it to them saying , This is My body which is given for you ; do this in remembrance of Me .
42022020	And in like manner , He took the cup after supper , saying , This cup is the new testament or covenant [ ratified ] in My blood , which is shed ( poured out ) for you .
42022021	But , behold , the hand of him who is now engaged in betraying Me is with Me on the table .
42022022	For the Son of Man is going as it has been determined and appointed , but woe to that man by whom He is betrayed and delivered up !
42022023	And they began to inquire among themselves which of them it was who was about to do this .
42022024	Now an eager contention arose among them [ as to ] which of them was considered and reputed to be the greatest .
42022025	But Jesus said to them , The kings of the Gentiles are deified by them and exercise lordship [ ruling as emperor-gods ] over them ; and those in authority over them are called benefactors and well-doers .
42022026	But this is not to be so with you ; on the contrary , let him who is the greatest among you become like the youngest , and him who is the chief and leader like one who serves .
42022027	For who is the greater , the one who reclines at table ( the master ) , or the one who serves ? Is it not the one who reclines at table ? But I am in your midst as One Who serves .
42022028	And you are those who have remained [ throughout ] and persevered with Me in My trials ;
42022029	And as My Father has appointed a kingdom and conferred it on Me , so do I confer on you [ the privilege and decree ] ,
42022030	That you may eat and drink at My table in My kingdom and sit on thrones , judging the twelve tribes of Israel .
42022031	Simon , Simon ( Peter ) , listen ! Satan has asked excessively that [ all of ] you be given up to him [ out of the power and keeping of God ] , that he might sift [ all of ] you like grain ,
42022032	But I have prayed especially for you [ Peter ] , that your [ own ] faith may not fail ; and when you yourself have turned again , strengthen and establish your brethren .
42022033	And [ Simon Peter ] said to Him , Lord , I am ready to go with You both to prison and to death .
42022034	But Jesus said , I tell you , Peter , before a [ single ] cock shall crow this day , you will three times [ utterly ] deny that you know Me .
42022035	And He said to them , When I sent you out with no purse or [ provision ] bag or sandals , did you lack anything ? They answered , Nothing !
42022036	Then He said to them , But now let him who has a purse take it , and also [ his provision ] bag ; and let him who has no sword sell his mantle and buy a sword .
42022037	For I tell you that this Scripture must yet be fulfilled in Me : And He was counted and classed among the wicked ( the outlaws , the criminals ) ; for what is written about Me has its fulfillment [ has reached its end and is finally settled ] .
42022038	And they said , Look , Lord ! Here are two swords . And He said to them , It is enough .
42022039	And He came out and went , as was His habit , to the Mount of Olives , and the disciples also followed Him .
42022040	And when He came to the place , He said to them , Pray that you may not [ at all ] enter into temptation .
42022041	And He withdrew from them about a stone’s throw and knelt down and prayed ,
42022042	Saying , Father , if You are willing , remove this cup from Me ; yet not My will , but [ always ] Yours be done .
42022043	And there appeared to Him an angel from heaven , strengthening Him in spirit .
42022044	And being in an agony [ of mind ] , He prayed [ all the ] more earnestly and intently , and His sweat became like great clots of blood dropping down upon the ground .
42022045	And when He got up from prayer , He came to the disciples and found them sleeping from grief ,
42022046	And He said to them , Why do you sleep ? Get up and pray that you may not enter [ at all ] into temptation .
42022047	And while He was still speaking , behold , there came a crowd , and the man called Judas , one of the Twelve [ apostles ] , was going before [ leading ] them . He drew near to Jesus to kiss Him ,
42022048	But Jesus said to him , Judas ! Would you betray and deliver up the Son of Man with a kiss ?
42022049	And when those who were around Him saw what was about to happen , they said , Lord , shall we strike with the sword ?
42022050	And one of them struck the bond servant of the high priest and cut off his ear , the right one .
42022051	But Jesus said , Permit them to go so far [ as to seize Me ] . And He touched the little ( insignificant ) ear and healed him .
42022052	Then Jesus said to those who had come out against Him -- the chief priests and captains of the temple and elders [ of the Sanhedrin ] -- Have you come out with swords and clubs as [ you would ] against a robber ?
42022053	When I was with you day after day in the temple [ enclosure ] , you did not stretch forth [ your ] hands against Me . But this is your hour -- and the power [ which ] darkness [ gives you has its way ] .
42022054	Then they seized Him and led Him away , bringing Him into the house of the high priest . Peter was following at a distance .
42022055	And when they had kindled a fire in the middle of the courtyard and were seated together , Peter sat among them .
42022056	Then a servant girl , seeing him as he sat in the firelight and gazing [ intently ] at him , said , This man too was with Him .
42022057	But he denied it and said , Woman , I do not know Him !
42022058	And a little later someone else saw him and said , You are one of them also . But Peter said , Man , I am not !
42022059	And when about an hour more had elapsed , still another emphatically insisted , It is the truth that this man also was with Him , for he too is a Galilean !
42022060	But Peter said , Man , I do not know what you are talking about . And instantly , while he was still speaking , the cock crowed .
42022061	And the Lord turned and looked at Peter . And Peter recalled the Lord’s words , how He had told him , Before the cock crows today , you will deny Me thrice .
42022062	And he went out and wept bitterly [ that is , with painfully moving grief ] .
42022063	Now the men who had Jesus in custody treated Him with contempt and scoffed at and ridiculed Him and beat Him ;
42022064	They blindfolded Him also and asked Him , Prophesy ! Who is it that struck You ?
42022065	And they said many other evil and slanderous and insulting words against Him , reviling Him .
42022066	As soon as it was day , the assembly of the elders of the people gathered together , both chief priests and scribes ; and they led Him into their council ( the Sanhedrin ) , and they said ,
42022067	If You are the Christ ( the Messiah ) , tell us . But He said to them , If I tell you , you will not believe ( trust in , cleave to , and rely on what I say ) ,
42022068	And if I question you , you will not answer .
42022069	But hereafter ( from this time on ) , the Son of Man shall be seated at the right hand of the power of God .
42022070	And they all said , You are the Son of God , then ? And He said to them , It is just as you say ; I AM .
42022071	And they said , What further evidence do we need ? For we have heard [ it ] ourselves from His own mouth !
42023001	THEN THE whole assembly of them got up and conducted [ Jesus ] before Pilate .
42023002	And they began to accuse Him , asserting , We found this Man perverting ( misleading , corrupting , and turning away ) our nation and forbidding to pay tribute to Caesar , saying that He Himself is Christ ( the Messiah , the Anointed One ) , a King !
42023003	So Pilate asked Him , Are You the King of the Jews ? And He answered him , [ It is just as ] you say . [ I AM . ]
42023004	And Pilate said to the chief priests and the throngs , I find no guilt or crime in this Man .
42023005	But they were urgent and emphatic , saying , He stirs up and excites the people , teaching throughout all Judea -- from Galilee , where He began , even to this place .
42023006	Upon hearing this , Pilate asked whether the Man was a Galilean .
42023007	And when he found out [ certainly ] that He belonged to Herod’s jurisdiction , he sent Him up to Herod [ a higher authority ] , who was also in Jerusalem in those days .
42023008	Now when Herod saw Jesus , he was exceedingly glad , for he had eagerly desired to see Him for a long time because of what he had heard concerning Him , and he was hoping to witness some sign ( some striking evidence or spectacular performance ) done by Him .
42023009	So he asked Him many questions , but He made no reply .
42023010	Meanwhile , the chief priests and the scribes stood by , continuing vehemently and violently to accuse Him .
42023011	And Herod , with his soldiers , treated Him with contempt and scoffed at and ridiculed Him ; then , dressing Him up in bright and gorgeous apparel , he sent Him back to Pilate .
42023012	And that very day Herod and Pilate became friends with each other -- [ though ] they had been at enmity before this .
42023013	Pilate then called together the chief priests and the rulers and the people ,
42023014	And said to them , You brought this Man before me as One Who was perverting and misleading and turning away and corrupting the people ; and behold , after examining Him before you , I have not found any offense ( crime or guilt ) in this Man in regard to your accusations against Him ;
42023015	No , nor indeed did Herod , for he sent Him back to us ; behold , He has done nothing deserving of death .
42023016	I will therefore chastise Him and deliver Him amended ( reformed , taught His lesson ) and release Him .
42023017	For it was necessary for him to release to them one prisoner at the Feast .
42023018	But they all together raised a deep cry [ from the depths of their throats ] , saying , Away with this Man ! Release to us Barabbas !
42023019	He was a man who had been thrown into prison for raising a riot in the city , and for murder .
42023020	Once more Pilate called to them , wishing to release Jesus ;
42023021	But they kept shouting out , Crucify , crucify Him !
42023022	A third time he said to them , Why ? What wrong has He done ? I have found [ no offense or crime or guilt ] in Him nothing deserving of death ; I will therefore chastise Him [ in order to teach Him better ] and release Him .
42023023	But they were insistent and urgent , demanding with loud cries that He should be crucified . And their voices prevailed ( accomplished their purpose ) .
42023024	And Pilate gave sentence , that what they asked should be done .
42023025	So he released the man who had been thrown into prison for riot and murder , for whom they continued to ask , but Jesus he delivered up to be done with as they willed .
42023026	And as they led Him away , they seized one Simon of Cyrene , who was coming in from the country , and laid on him the cross and made him carry it behind Jesus .
42023027	And there accompanied [ Jesus ] a great multitude of the people , [ including ] women who bewailed and lamented Him .
42023028	But Jesus , turning toward them , said , Daughters of Jerusalem , do not weep for Me , but weep for yourselves and for your children .
42023029	For behold , the days are coming during which they will say , Blessed ( happy , fortunate , and to be envied ) are the barren , and the wombs that have not borne , and the breasts that have never nursed [ babies ] !
42023030	Then they will begin to say to the mountains , Fall on us ! and to the hills , Cover ( conceal , hide ) us !
42023031	For if they do these things when the timber is green , what will happen when it is dry ?
42023032	Two others also , who were criminals , were led away to be executed with Him .
42023033	And when they came to the place which is called The Skull [ Latin : Calvary ; Hebrew : Golgotha ] , there they crucified Him , and [ along with ] the criminals , one on the right and one on the left .
42023034	And Jesus prayed , Father , forgive them , for they know not what they do . And they divided His garments and distributed them by casting lots for them .
42023035	Now the people stood by [ calmly and leisurely ] watching ; but the rulers scoffed and sneered ( turned up their noses ) at Him , saying , He rescued others [ from death ] ; let Him now rescue Himself , if He is the Christ ( the Messiah ) of God , His Chosen One !
42023036	The soldiers also ridiculed and made sport of Him , coming up and offering Him vinegar ( a sour wine mixed with water )
42023037	And saying , If you are the King of the Jews , save ( rescue ) Yourself [ from death ] .
42023038	For there was also an inscription above Him in letters of Greek and Latin and Hebrew : This is the King of the Jews .
42023039	One of the criminals who was suspended kept up a railing at Him , saying , Are You not the Christ ( the Messiah ) ? Rescue Yourself and us [ from death ] !
42023040	But the other one reproved him , saying , Do you not even fear God , seeing you yourself are under the same sentence of condemnation and suffering the same penalty ?
42023041	And we indeed suffer it justly , receiving the due reward of our actions ; but this Man has done nothing out of the way [ nothing strange or eccentric or perverse or unreasonable ] .
42023042	Then he said to Jesus , Lord , remember me when You come in Your kingly glory !
42023043	And He answered him , Truly I tell you , today you shall be with Me in Paradise .
42023044	It was now about the sixth hour ( midday ) , and darkness enveloped the whole land and earth until the ninth hour ( about three o’clock in the afternoon ) ,
42023045	While the sun’s light faded or was darkened ; and the curtain [ of the Holy of Holies ] of the temple was torn in two .
42023046	And Jesus , crying out with a loud voice , said , Father , into Your hands I commit My spirit ! And with these words , He expired .
42023047	Now the centurion , having seen what had taken place , recognized God and thanked and praised Him , and said , Indeed , without question , this Man was upright ( just and innocent ) !
42023048	And all the throngs that had gathered to see this spectacle , when they saw what had taken place , returned to their homes , beating their breasts .
42023049	And all the acquaintances of [ Jesus ] and the women who had followed Him from Galilee stood at a distance and watched these things .
42023050	Now notice , there was a man named Joseph from the Jewish town of Arimathea . He was a member of the council ( the Sanhedrin ) , and a good ( upright , advantageous ) man , and righteous ( in right standing with God and man ) ,
42023051	Who had not agreed with or assented to the purpose and action of the others ; and he was expecting and waiting for the kingdom of God .
42023052	This man went to Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus .
42023053	Then he took it down and rolled it up in a linen cloth for swathing dead bodies and laid Him in a rock-hewn tomb , where no one had ever yet been laid .
42023054	It was the day of Preparation [ for the Sabbath ] , and the Sabbath was dawning ( approaching ) .
42023055	The women who had come with [ Jesus ] from Galilee followed closely and saw the tomb and how His body was laid .
42023056	Then they went back and made ready spices and ointments ( perfumes ) . On the Sabbath day they rested in accordance with the commandment .
42024001	BUT ON the first day of the week , at early dawn , [ the women ] went to the tomb , taking the spices which they had made ready .
42024002	And they found the stone rolled back from the tomb ,
42024003	But when they went inside , they did not find the body of the Lord Jesus .
42024004	And while they were perplexed and wondering what to do about this , behold , two men in dazzling raiment suddenly stood beside them .
42024005	And as [ the women ] were frightened and were bowing their faces to the ground , the men said to them , Why do you look for the living among [ those who are ] dead ?
42024006	He is not here , but has risen ! Remember how He told you while He was still in Galilee
42024007	That the Son of Man must be given over into the hands of sinful men ( men whose way or nature is to act in opposition to God ) and be crucified and on the third day rise [ from death ] .
42024008	And they remembered His words .
42024009	And having returned from the tomb , they reported all these things [ taken together ] to the eleven apostles and to all the rest .
42024010	Now it was Mary Magdalene and Joanna and Mary the mother of James , and the other women with them , who reported these things to the apostles .
42024011	But these reports seemed to the men an idle tale ( madness , feigned things , nonsense ) , and they did not believe the women .
42024012	But Peter got up and ran to the tomb ; and stooping down and looking in , he saw the linen cloths alone by themselves , and he went away , wondering about and marveling at what had happened .
42024013	And behold , that very day two of [ the disciples ] were going to a village called Emmaus , [ which is ] about seven miles from Jerusalem .
42024014	And they were talking with each other about all these things that had occurred .
42024015	And while they were conversing and discussing together , Jesus Himself caught up with them and was already accompanying them .
42024016	But their eyes were held , so that they did not recognize Him .
42024017	And He said to them , What is this discussion that you are exchanging ( throwing back and forth ) between yourselves as you walk along ? And they stood still , looking sad and downcast .
42024018	Then one of them , named Cleopas , answered Him , Do you alone dwell as a stranger in Jerusalem and not know the things that have occurred there in these days ?
42024019	And He said to them , What [ kind of ] things ? And they said to Him , About Jesus of Nazareth , Who was a Prophet mighty in work and word before God and all the people --
42024020	And how our chief priests and rulers gave Him up to be sentenced to death , and crucified Him .
42024021	But we were hoping that it was He Who would redeem and set Israel free . Yes , and besides all this , it is now the third day since these things occurred .
42024022	And moreover , some women of our company astounded us and drove us out of our senses . They were at the tomb early [ in the morning ]
42024023	But did not find His body ; and they returned saying that they had [ even ] seen a vision of angels , who said that He was alive !
42024024	So some of those [ who were ] with us went to the tomb and they found it just as the women had said , but Him they did not see .
42024025	And [ Jesus ] said to them , O foolish ones [ sluggish in mind , dull of perception ] and slow of heart to believe ( adhere to and trust in and rely on ) everything that the prophets have spoken !
42024026	Was it not necessary and essentially fitting that the Christ ( the Messiah ) should suffer all these things before entering into His glory ( His majesty and splendor ) ?
42024027	Then beginning with Moses and [ throughout ] all the Prophets , He went on explaining and interpreting to them in all the Scriptures the things concerning and referring to Himself .
42024028	Then they drew near the village to which they were going , and He acted as if He would go further .
42024029	But they urged and insisted , saying to Him , Remain with us , for it is toward evening , and the day is now far spent . So He went in to stay with them .
42024030	And it occurred that as He reclined at table with them , He took [ a loaf of ] bread and praised [ God ] and gave thanks and asked a blessing , and then broke it and was giving it to them
42024031	When their eyes were [ instantly ] opened and they [ clearly ] recognized Him , and He vanished ( departed invisibly ) .
42024032	And they said to one another , Were not our hearts greatly moved and burning within us while He was talking with us on the road and as He opened and explained to us [ the sense of ] the Scriptures ?
42024033	And rising up that very hour , they went back to Jerusalem , where they found the Eleven [ apostles ] gathered together and those who were with them ,
42024034	Who said , The Lord really has risen and has appeared to Simon ( Peter ) !
42024035	Then they [ themselves ] related [ in full ] what had happened on the road , and how He was known and recognized by them in the breaking of bread .
42024036	Now while they were talking about this , Jesus Himself took His stand among them and said to them , Peace ( freedom from all the distresses that are experienced as the result of sin ) be to you !
42024037	But they were so startled and terrified that they thought they saw a spirit .
42024038	And He said to them , Why are you disturbed and troubled , and why do such doubts and questionings arise in your hearts ?
42024039	See My hands and My feet , that it is I Myself ! Feel and handle Me and see , for a spirit does not have flesh and bones , as you see that I have .
42024040	And when He had said this , He showed them His hands and His feet .
42024041	And while [ since ] they still could not believe it for sheer joy and marveled , He said to them , Have you anything here to eat ?
42024042	They gave Him a piece of broiled fish ,
42024043	And He took [ it ] and ate [ it ] before them .
42024044	Then He said to them , This is what I told you while I was still with you : everything which is written concerning Me in the Law of Moses and the Prophets and the Psalms must be fulfilled .
42024045	Then He [ thoroughly ] opened up their minds to understand the Scriptures ,
42024046	And said to them , Thus it is written that the Christ ( the Messiah ) should suffer and on the third day rise from ( among ) the dead ,
42024047	And that repentance [ with a view to and as the condition of ] forgiveness of sins should be preached in His name to all nations , beginning from Jerusalem .
42024048	You are witnesses of these things .
42024049	And behold , I will send forth upon you what My Father has promised ; but remain in the city [ Jerusalem ] until you are clothed with power from on high .
42024050	Then He conducted them out as far as Bethany , and , lifting up His hands , He invoked a blessing on them .
42024051	And it occurred that while He was blessing them , He parted from them and was taken up into heaven .
42024052	And they , worshiping Him , went back to Jerusalem with great joy ;
42024053	And they were continually in the temple celebrating with praises and blessing and extolling God . Amen ( so be it ) .
43001001	IN THE beginning [ before all time ] was the Word ( Christ ) , and the Word was with God , and the Word was God Himself .
43001002	He was present originally with God .
43001003	All things were made and came into existence through Him ; and without Him was not even one thing made that has come into being .
43001004	In Him was Life , and the Life was the Light of men .
43001005	And the Light shines on in the darkness , for the darkness has never overpowered it [ put it out or absorbed it or appropriated it , and is unreceptive to it ] .
43001006	There came a man sent from God , whose name was John .
43001007	This man came to witness , that he might testify of the Light , that all men might believe in it [ adhere to it , trust it , and rely upon it ] through him .
43001008	He was not the Light himself , but came that he might bear witness regarding the Light .
43001009	There it was -- the true Light [ was then ] coming into the world [ the genuine , perfect , steadfast Light ] that illumines every person .
43001010	He came into the world , and though the world was made through Him , the world did not recognize Him [ did not know Him ] .
43001011	He came to that which belonged to Him [ to His own -- His domain , creation , things , world ] , and they who were His own did not receive Him and did not welcome Him .
43001012	But to as many as did receive and welcome Him , He gave the authority ( power , privilege , right ) to become the children of God , that is , to those who believe in ( adhere to , trust in , and rely on ) His name --
43001013	Who owe their birth neither to bloods nor to the will of the flesh [ that of physical impulse ] nor to the will of man [ that of a natural father ] , but to God . [ They are born of God ! ]
43001014	And the Word ( Christ ) became flesh ( human , incarnate ) and tabernacled ( fixed His tent of flesh , lived awhile ) among us ; and we [ actually ] saw His glory ( His honor , His majesty ) , such glory as an only begotten son receives from his father , full of grace ( favor , loving-kindness ) and truth .
43001015	John testified about Him and cried out , This was He of Whom I said , He Who comes after me has priority over me , for He was before me . [ He takes rank above me , for He existed before I did . He has advanced before me , because He is my Chief . ]
43001016	For out of His fullness ( abundance ) we have all received [ all had a share and we were all supplied with ] one grace after another and spiritual blessing upon spiritual blessing and even favor upon favor and gift [ heaped ] upon gift .
43001017	For while the Law was given through Moses , grace ( unearned , undeserved favor and spiritual blessing ) and truth came through Jesus Christ .
43001018	No man has ever seen God at any time ; the only unique Son , or the only begotten God , Who is in the bosom [ in the intimate presence ] of the Father , He has declared Him [ He has revealed Him and brought Him out where He can be seen ; He has interpreted Him and He has made Him known ] .
43001019	And this is the testimony of John when the Jews sent priests and Levites to him from Jerusalem to ask him , Who are you ?
43001020	He confessed ( admitted the truth ) and did not try to conceal it , but acknowledged , I am not the Christ !
43001021	They asked him , What then ? Are you Elijah ? And he said , I am not ! Are you the Prophet ? And he answered , No !
43001022	Then they said to him , Who are you ? Tell us , so that we may give an answer to those who sent us . What do you say about yourself ?
43001023	He said , I am the voice of one crying aloud in the wilderness [ the voice of one shouting in the desert ] , Prepare the way of the Lord [ level , straighten out , the path of the Lord ] , as the prophet Isaiah said .
43001024	The messengers had been sent from the Pharisees .
43001025	And they asked him , Why then are you baptizing if you are not the Christ , nor Elijah , nor the Prophet ?
43001026	John answered them , I [ only ] baptize in ( with ) water . Among you there stands One Whom you do not recognize and with Whom you are not acquainted and of Whom you know nothing .
43001027	It is He Who , coming after me , is preferred before me , the string of Whose sandal I am not worthy to unloose .
43001028	These things occurred in Bethany ( Bethabara ) across the Jordan [ at the Jordan crossing ] , where John was then baptizing .
43001029	The next day John saw Jesus coming to him and said , Look ! There is the Lamb of God , Who takes away the sin of the world !
43001030	This is He of Whom I said , After me comes a Man Who has priority over me [ Who takes rank above me ] because He was before me and existed before I did .
43001031	And I did not know Him and did not recognize Him [ myself ] ; but it is in order that He should be made manifest and be revealed to Israel [ be brought out where we can see Him ] that I came baptizing in ( with ) water .
43001032	John gave further evidence , saying , I have seen the Spirit descending as a dove out of heaven , and it dwelt on Him [ never to depart ] .
43001033	And I did not know Him nor recognize Him , but He Who sent me to baptize in ( with ) water said to me , Upon Him Whom you shall see the Spirit descend and remain , that One is He Who baptizes with the Holy Spirit .
43001034	And I have seen [ that happen -- I actually did see it ] and my testimony is that this is the Son of God !
43001035	Again the next day John was standing with two of his disciples ,
43001036	And he looked at Jesus as He walked along , and said , Look ! There is the Lamb of God !
43001037	The two disciples heard him say this , and they followed Him .
43001038	But Jesus turned , and as He saw them following Him , He said to them , What are you looking for ? [ And what is it you wish ? ] And they answered Him , Rabbi -- which translated is Teacher -- where are You staying ?
43001039	He said to them , Come and see . So they went and saw where He was staying , and they remained with Him that day . It was then about the tenth hour ( about four o’clock in the afternoon ) .
43001040	One of the two who heard what John said and followed Jesus was Andrew , Simon Peter’s brother .
43001041	He first sought out and found his own brother Simon and said to him , We have found ( discovered ) the Messiah ! -- which translated is the Christ ( the Anointed One ) .
43001042	Andrew then led ( brought ) Simon to Jesus . Jesus looked at him and said , You are Simon son of John . You shall be called Cephas -- which translated is Peter [ Stone ] .
43001043	The next day Jesus desired and decided to go into Galilee ; and He found Philip and said to him , Join Me as My attendant and follow Me .
43001044	Now Philip was from Bethsaida , of the same city as Andrew and Peter .
43001045	Philip sought and found Nathanael and told him , We have found ( discovered ) the One Moses in the Law and also the Prophets wrote about -- Jesus from Nazareth , the [ legal ] son of Joseph !
43001046	Nathanael answered him , [ Nazareth ! ] Can anything good come out of Nazareth ? Philip replied , Come and see !
43001047	Jesus saw Nathanael coming toward Him and said concerning him , See ! Here is an Israelite indeed [ a true descendant of Jacob ] , in whom there is no guile nor deceit nor falsehood nor duplicity !
43001048	Nathanael said to Jesus , How do You know me ? [ How is it that You know these things about me ? ] Jesus answered him , Before [ ever ] Philip called you , when you were still under the fig tree , I saw you .
43001049	Nathanael answered , Teacher , You are the Son of God ! You are the King of Israel !
43001050	Jesus replied , Because I said to you , I saw you beneath the fig tree , do you believe in and rely on and trust in Me ? You shall see greater things than this !
43001051	Then He said to him , I assure you , most solemnly I tell you all , you shall see heaven opened , and the angels of God ascending and descending upon the Son of Man !
43002001	ON THE third day there was a wedding at Cana of Galilee , and the mother of Jesus was there .
43002002	Jesus also was invited with His disciples to the wedding .
43002003	And when the wine was all gone , the mother of Jesus said to Him , They have no more wine !
43002004	Jesus said to her , [ Dear ] woman , what is that to you and to Me ? [ What do we have in common ? Leave it to Me . ] My time ( hour to act ) has not yet come .
43002005	His mother said to the servants , Whatever He says to you , do it .
43002006	Now there were six waterpots of stone standing there , as the Jewish custom of purification ( ceremonial washing ) demanded , holding twenty to thirty gallons apiece .
43002007	Jesus said to them , Fill the waterpots with water . So they filled them up to the brim .
43002008	Then He said to them , Draw some out now and take it to the manager of the feast [ to the one presiding , the superintendent of the banquet ] . So they took him some .
43002009	And when the manager tasted the water just now turned into wine , not knowing where it came from -- though the servants who had drawn the water knew -- he called the bridegroom
43002010	And said to him , Everyone else serves his best wine first , and when people have drunk freely , then he serves that which is not so good ; but you have kept back the good wine until now !
43002011	This , the first of His signs ( miracles , wonderworks ) , Jesus performed in Cana of Galilee , and manifested His glory [ by it He displayed His greatness and His power openly ] , and His disciples believed in Him [ adhered to , trusted in , and relied on Him ] .
43002012	After that He went down to Capernaum with His mother and brothers and disciples , and they stayed there only a few days .
43002013	Now the Passover of the Jews was approaching , so Jesus went up to Jerusalem .
43002014	There He found in the temple [ enclosure ] those who were selling oxen and sheep and doves , and the money changers sitting there [ also at their stands ] .
43002015	And having made a lash ( a whip ) of cords , He drove them all out of the temple [ enclosure ] -- both the sheep and the oxen -- spilling and scattering the brokers’ money and upsetting and tossing around their trays ( their stands ) .
43002016	Then to those who sold the doves He said , Take these things away ( out of here ) ! Make not My Father’s house a house of merchandise ( a marketplace , a sales shop ) !
43002017	And His disciples remembered that it is written [ in the Holy Scriptures ] , Zeal ( the fervor of love ) for Your house will eat Me up . [ I will be consumed with jealousy for the honor of Your house . ]
43002018	Then the Jews retorted , What sign can You show us , seeing You do these things ? [ What sign , miracle , token , indication can You give us as evidence that You have authority and are commissioned to act in this way ? ]
43002019	Jesus answered them , Destroy ( undo ) this temple , and in three days I will raise it up again .
43002020	Then the Jews replied , It took forty-six years to build this temple ( sanctuary ) , and will You raise it up in three days ?
43002021	But He had spoken of the temple which was His body .
43002022	When therefore He had risen from the dead , His disciples remembered that He said this . And so they believed and trusted and relied on the Scripture and the word ( message ) Jesus had spoken .
43002023	But when He was in Jerusalem during the Passover Feast , many believed in His name [ identified themselves with His party ] after seeing His signs ( wonders , miracles ) which He was doing .
43002024	But Jesus [ for His part ] did not trust Himself to them , because He knew all [ men ] ;
43002025	And He did not need anyone to bear witness concerning man [ needed no evidence from anyone about men ] , for He Himself knew what was in human nature . [ He could read men’s hearts . ]
43003001	NOW THERE was a certain man among the Pharisees named Nicodemus , a ruler ( a leader , an authority ) among the Jews ,
43003002	Who came to Jesus at night and said to Him , Rabbi , we know and are certain that You have come from God [ as ] a Teacher ; for no one can do these signs ( these wonderworks , these miracles -- and produce the proofs ) that You do unless God is with him .
43003003	Jesus answered him , I assure you , most solemnly I tell you , that unless a person is born again ( anew , from above ) , he cannot ever see ( know , be acquainted with , and experience ) the kingdom of God .
43003004	Nicodemus said to Him , How can a man be born when he is old ? Can he enter his mother’s womb again and be born ?
43003005	Jesus answered , I assure you , most solemnly I tell you , unless a man is born of water and [ even ] the Spirit , he cannot [ ever ] enter the kingdom of God .
43003006	What is born of [ from ] the flesh is flesh [ of the physical is physical ] ; and what is born of the Spirit is spirit .
43003007	Marvel not [ do not be surprised , astonished ] at My telling you , You must all be born anew ( from above ) .
43003008	The wind blows ( breathes ) where it wills ; and though you hear its sound , yet you neither know where it comes from nor where it is going . So it is with everyone who is born of the Spirit .
43003009	Nicodemus answered by asking , How can all this be possible ?
43003010	Jesus replied , Are you the teacher of Israel , and yet do not know nor understand these things ? [ Are they strange to you ? ]
43003011	I assure you , most solemnly I tell you , We speak only of what we know [ we know absolutely what we are talking about ] ; we have actually seen what we are testifying to [ we were eyewitnesses of it ] . And still you do not receive our testimony [ you reject and refuse our evidence -- that of Myself and of all those who are born of the Spirit ] .
43003012	If I have told you of things that happen right here on the earth and yet none of you believes Me , how can you believe ( trust Me , adhere to Me , rely on Me ) if I tell you of heavenly things ?
43003013	And yet no one has ever gone up to heaven , but there is One Who has come down from heaven -- the Son of Man [ Himself ] , Who is ( dwells , has His home ) in heaven .
43003014	And just as Moses lifted up the serpent in the desert [ on a pole ] , so must [ so it is necessary that ] the Son of Man be lifted up [ on the cross ] ,
43003015	In order that everyone who believes in Him [ who cleaves to Him , trusts Him , and relies on Him ] may not perish , but have eternal life and [ actually ] live forever !
43003016	For God so greatly loved and dearly prized the world that He [ even ] gave up His only begotten ( unique ) Son , so that whoever believes in ( trusts in , clings to , relies on ) Him shall not perish ( come to destruction , be lost ) but have eternal ( everlasting ) life .
43003017	For God did not send the Son into the world in order to judge ( to reject , to condemn , to pass sentence on ) the world , but that the world might find salvation and be made safe and sound through Him .
43003018	He who believes in Him [ who clings to , trusts in , relies on Him ] is not judged [ he who trusts in Him never comes up for judgment ; for him there is no rejection , no condemnation -- he incurs no damnation ] ; but he who does not believe ( cleave to , rely on , trust in Him ) is judged already [ he has already been convicted and has already received his sentence ] because he has not believed in and trusted in the name of the only begotten Son of God . [ He is condemned for refusing to let his trust rest in Christ’s name . ]
43003019	The [ basis of the ] judgment ( indictment , the test by which men are judged , the ground for the sentence ) lies in this : the Light has come into the world , and people have loved the darkness rather than and more than the Light , for their works ( deeds ) were evil .
43003020	For every wrongdoer hates ( loathes , detests ) the Light , and will not come out into the Light but shrinks from it , lest his works ( his deeds , his activities , his conduct ) be exposed and reproved .
43003021	But he who practices truth [ who does what is right ] comes out into the Light ; so that his works may be plainly shown to be what they are -- wrought with God [ divinely prompted , done with God’s help , in dependence upon Him ] .
43003022	After this , Jesus and His disciples went into the land ( the countryside ) of Judea , where He remained with them , and baptized .
43003023	But John also was baptizing at Aenon near Salim , for there was an abundance of water there , and the people kept coming and being baptized .
43003024	For John had not yet been thrown into prison .
43003025	Therefore there arose a controversy between some of John’s disciples and a Jew in regard to purification .
43003026	So they came to John and reported to him , Rabbi , the Man Who was with you on the other side of the Jordan [ at the Jordan crossing ] -- and to Whom you yourself have borne testimony -- notice , here He is baptizing too , and everybody is flocking to Him !
43003027	John answered , A man can receive nothing [ he can claim nothing , he can take unto himself nothing ] except as it has been granted to him from heaven . [ A man must be content to receive the gift which is given him from heaven ; there is no other source . ]
43003028	You yourselves are my witnesses [ you personally bear me out ] that I stated , I am not the Christ ( the Anointed One , the Messiah ) , but I have [ only ] been sent before Him [ in advance of Him , to be His appointed forerunner , His messenger , His announcer ] .
43003029	He who has the bride is the bridegroom ; but the groomsman who stands by and listens to him rejoices greatly and heartily on account of the bridegroom’s voice . This then is my pleasure and joy , and it is now complete .
43003030	He must increase , but I must decrease . [ He must grow more prominent ; I must grow less so . ]
43003031	He Who comes from above ( heaven ) is [ far ] above all [ others ] ; he who comes from the earth belongs to the earth , and talks the language of earth [ his words are from an earthly standpoint ] . He Who comes from heaven is [ far ] above all others [ far superior to all others in prominence and in excellence ] .
43003032	It is to what He has [ actually ] seen and heard that He bears testimony , and yet no one accepts His testimony [ no one receives His evidence as true ] .
43003033	Whoever receives His testimony has set his seal of approval to this : God is true . [ That man has definitely certified , acknowledged , declared once and for all , and is himself assured that it is divine truth that God cannot lie ] .
43003034	For since He Whom God has sent speaks the words of God [ proclaims God’s own message ] , God does not give Him His Spirit sparingly or by measure , but boundless is the gift God makes of His Spirit !
43003035	The Father loves the Son and has given ( entrusted , committed ) everything into His hand .
43003036	And he who believes in ( has faith in , clings to , relies on ) the Son has ( now possesses ) eternal life . But whoever disobeys ( is unbelieving toward , refuses to trust in , disregards , is not subject to ) the Son will never see ( experience ) life , but [ instead ] the wrath of God abides on him . [ God’s displeasure remains on him ; His indignation hangs over him continually . ]
43004001	NOW WHEN the Lord knew ( learned , became aware ) that the Pharisees had been told that Jesus was winning and baptizing more disciples than John --
43004002	Though Jesus Himself did not baptize , but His disciples --
43004003	He left Judea and returned to Galilee .
43004004	It was necessary for Him to go through Samaria .
43004005	And in doing so , He arrived at a Samaritan town called Sychar , near the tract of land that Jacob gave to his son Joseph .
43004006	And Jacob’s well was there . So Jesus , tired as He was from His journey , sat down [ to rest ] by the well . It was then about the sixth hour ( about noon ) .
43004007	Presently , when a woman of Samaria came along to draw water , Jesus said to her , Give Me a drink --
43004008	For His disciples had gone off into the town to buy food --
43004009	The Samaritan woman said to Him , How is it that You , being a Jew , ask me , a Samaritan [ and a ] woman , for a drink ? -- For the Jews have nothing to do with the Samaritans --
43004010	Jesus answered her , If you had only known and had recognized God’s gift and Who this is that is saying to you , Give Me a drink , you would have asked Him [ instead ] and He would have given you living water .
43004011	She said to Him , Sir , You have nothing to draw with [ no drawing bucket ] and the well is deep ; how then can You provide living water ? [ Where do You get Your living water ? ]
43004012	Are You greater than and superior to our ancestor Jacob , who gave us this well and who used to drink from it himself , and his sons and his cattle also ?
43004013	Jesus answered her , All who drink of this water will be thirsty again .
43004014	But whoever takes a drink of the water that I will give him shall never , no never , be thirsty any more . But the water that I will give him shall become a spring of water welling up ( flowing , bubbling ) [ continually ] within him unto ( into , for ) eternal life .
43004015	The woman said to Him , Sir , give me this water , so that I may never get thirsty nor have to come [ continually all the way ] here to draw .
43004016	At this , Jesus said to her , Go , call your husband and come back here .
43004017	The woman answered , I have no husband . Jesus said to her , You have spoken truly in saying , I have no husband .
43004018	For you have had five husbands , and the man you are now living with is not your husband . In this you have spoken truly .
43004019	The woman said to Him , Sir , I see and understand that You are a prophet .
43004020	Our forefathers worshiped on this mountain , but you [ Jews ] say that Jerusalem is the place where it is necessary and proper to worship .
43004021	Jesus said to her , Woman , believe Me , a time is coming when you will worship the Father neither [ merely ] in this mountain nor [ merely ] in Jerusalem .
43004022	You [ Samaritans ] do not know what you are worshiping [ you worship what you do not comprehend ] . We do know what we are worshiping [ we worship what we have knowledge of and understand ] , for [ after all ] salvation comes from [ among ] the Jews .
43004023	A time will come , however , indeed it is already here , when the true ( genuine ) worshipers will worship the Father in spirit and in truth ( reality ) ; for the Father is seeking just such people as these as His worshipers .
43004024	God is a Spirit ( a spiritual Being ) and those who worship Him must worship Him in spirit and in truth ( reality ) .
43004025	The woman said to Him , I know that Messiah is coming , He Who is called the Christ ( the Anointed One ) ; and when He arrives , He will tell us everything we need to know and make it clear to us .
43004026	Jesus said to her , I Who now speak with you am He .
43004027	Just then His disciples came and they wondered ( were surprised , astonished ) to find Him talking with a woman [ a married woman ] . However , not one of them asked Him , What are You inquiring about ? or What do You want ? or , Why do You speak with her ?
43004028	Then the woman left her water jar and went away to the town . And she began telling the people ,
43004029	Come , see a Man Who has told me everything that I ever did ! Can this be [ is not this ] the Christ ? [ Must not this be the Messiah , the Anointed One ? ]
43004030	So the people left the town and set out to go to Him .
43004031	Meanwhile , the disciples urged Him saying , Rabbi , eat something .
43004032	But He assured them , I have food ( nourishment ) to eat of which you know nothing and have no idea .
43004033	So the disciples said one to another , Has someone brought Him something to eat ?
43004034	Jesus said to them , My food ( nourishment ) is to do the will ( pleasure ) of Him Who sent Me and to accomplish and completely finish His work .
43004035	Do you not say , It is still four months until harvest time comes ? Look ! I tell you , raise your eyes and observe the fields and see how they are already white for harvesting .
43004036	Already the reaper is getting his wages [ he who does the cutting now has his reward ] , for he is gathering fruit ( crop ) unto life eternal , so that he who does the planting and he who does the reaping may rejoice together .
43004037	For in this the saying holds true , One sows and another reaps .
43004038	I sent you to reap a crop for which you have not toiled . Other men have labored and you have stepped in to reap the results of their work .
43004039	Now numerous Samaritans from that town believed in and trusted in Him because of what the woman said when she declared and testified , He told me everything that I ever did .
43004040	So when the Samaritans arrived , they asked Him to remain with them , and He did stay there two days .
43004041	Then many more believed in and adhered to and relied on Him because of His personal message [ what He Himself said ] .
43004042	And they told the woman , Now we no longer believe ( trust , have faith ) just because of what you said ; for we have heard Him ourselves [ personally ] , and we know that He truly is the Savior of the world , the Christ .
43004043	But after these two days Jesus went on from there into Galilee --
43004044	Although He Himself declared that a prophet has no honor in his own country .
43004045	However , when He came into Galilee , the Galileans also welcomed Him and took Him to their hearts eagerly , for they had seen everything that He did in Jerusalem during the Feast ; for they too had attended the Feast .
43004046	So Jesus came again to Cana of Galilee , where He had turned the water into wine . And there was a certain royal official whose son was lying ill in Capernaum .
43004047	Having heard that Jesus had come back from Judea into Galilee , he went away to meet Him and began to beg Him to come down and cure his son , for he was lying at the point of death .
43004048	Then Jesus said to him , Unless you see signs and miracles happen , you [ people ] never will believe ( trust , have faith ) at all .
43004049	The king’s officer pleaded with Him , Sir , do come down at once before my little child is dead !
43004050	Jesus answered him , Go in peace ; your son will live ! And the man put his trust in what Jesus said and started home .
43004051	But even as he was on the road going down , his servants met him and reported , saying , Your son lives !
43004052	So he asked them at what time he had begun to get better . They said , Yesterday during the seventh hour ( about one o’clock in the afternoon ) the fever left him .
43004053	Then the father knew that it was at that very hour when Jesus had said to him , Your son will live . And he and his entire household believed ( adhered to , trusted in , and relied on Jesus ) .
43004054	This is the second sign ( wonderwork , miracle ) that Jesus performed after He had come out of Judea into Galilee .
43005001	LATER ON there was a Jewish festival ( feast ) for which Jesus went up to Jerusalem .
43005002	Now there is in Jerusalem a pool near the Sheep Gate . This pool in the Hebrew is called Bethesda , having five porches ( alcoves , colonnades , doorways ) .
43005003	In these lay a great number of sick folk -- some blind , some crippled , and some paralyzed ( shriveled up ) -- waiting for the bubbling up of the water .
43005004	For an angel of the Lord went down at appointed seasons into the pool and moved and stirred up the water ; whoever then first , after the stirring up of the water , stepped in was cured of whatever disease with which he was afflicted .
43005005	There was a certain man there who had suffered with a deep-seated and lingering disorder for thirty-eight years .
43005006	When Jesus noticed him lying there [ helpless ] , knowing that he had already been a long time in that condition , He said to him , Do you want to become well ? [ Are you really in earnest about getting well ? ]
43005007	The invalid answered , Sir , I have nobody when the water is moving to put me into the pool ; but while I am trying to come [ into it ] myself , somebody else steps down ahead of me .
43005008	Jesus said to him , Get up ! Pick up your bed ( sleeping pad ) and walk !
43005009	Instantly the man became well and recovered his strength and picked up his bed and walked . But that happened on the Sabbath .
43005010	So the Jews kept saying to the man who had been healed , It is the Sabbath , and you have no right to pick up your bed [ it is not lawful ] .
43005011	He answered them , The Man Who healed me and gave me back my strength , He Himself said to me , Pick up your bed and walk !
43005012	They asked him , Who is the Man Who told you , Pick up your bed and walk ?
43005013	Now the invalid who had been healed did not know who it was , for Jesus had quietly gone away [ had passed on unnoticed ] , since there was a crowd in the place .
43005014	Afterward , when Jesus found him in the temple , He said to him , See , you are well ! Stop sinning or something worse may happen to you .
43005015	The man went away and told the Jews that it was Jesus Who had made him well .
43005016	For this reason the Jews began to persecute ( annoy , torment ) Jesus and sought to kill Him , because He was doing these things on the Sabbath .
43005017	But Jesus answered them , My Father has worked [ even ] until now , [ He has never ceased working ; He is still working ] and I , too , must be at [ divine ] work .
43005018	This made the Jews more determined than ever to kill Him [ to do away with Him ] ; because He not only was breaking ( weakening , violating ) the Sabbath , but He actually was speaking of God as being [ in a special sense ] His own Father , making Himself equal [ putting Himself on a level ] with God .
43005019	So Jesus answered them by saying , I assure you , most solemnly I tell you , the Son is able to do nothing of Himself ( of His own accord ) ; but He is able to do only what He sees the Father doing , for whatever the Father does is what the Son does in the same way [ in His turn ] .
43005020	The Father dearly loves the Son and discloses to ( shows ) Him everything that He Himself does . And He will disclose to Him ( let Him see ) greater things yet than these , so that you may marvel and be full of wonder and astonishment .
43005021	Just as the Father raises up the dead and gives them life [ makes them live on ] , even so the Son also gives life to whomever He wills and is pleased to give it .
43005022	Even the Father judges no one , for He has given all judgment ( the last judgment and the whole business of judging ) entirely into the hands of the Son ,
43005023	So that all men may give honor ( reverence , homage ) to the Son just as they give honor to the Father . [ In fact ] whoever does not honor the Son does not honor the Father , Who has sent Him .
43005024	I assure you , most solemnly I tell you , the person whose ears are open to My words [ who listens to My message ] and believes and trusts in and clings to and relies on Him Who sent Me has ( possesses now ) eternal life . And he does not come into judgment [ does not incur sentence of judgment , will not come under condemnation ] , but he has already passed over out of death into life .
43005025	Believe Me when I assure you , most solemnly I tell you , the time is coming and is here now when the dead shall hear the voice of the Son of God and those who hear it shall live .
43005026	For even as the Father has life in Himself and is self-existent , so He has given to the Son to have life in Himself and be self-existent .
43005027	And He has given Him authority and granted Him power to execute ( exercise , practice ) judgment because He is a Son of man [ very man ] .
43005028	Do not be surprised and wonder at this , for the time is coming when all those who are in the tombs shall hear His voice ,
43005029	And they shall come out -- those who have practiced doing good [ will come out ] to the resurrection of [ new ] life , and those who have done evil will be raised for judgment [ raised to meet their sentence ] .
43005030	I am able to do nothing from Myself [ independently , of My own accord -- but only as I am taught by God and as I get His orders ] . Even as I hear , I judge [ I decide as I am bidden to decide . As the voice comes to Me , so I give a decision ] , and My judgment is right ( just , righteous ) , because I do not seek or consult My own will [ I have no desire to do what is pleasing to Myself , My own aim , My own purpose ] but only the will and pleasure of the Father Who sent Me .
43005031	If I alone testify in My behalf , My testimony is not valid and cannot be worth anything .
43005032	There is Another Who testifies concerning Me , and I know and am certain that His evidence on My behalf is true and valid .
43005033	You yourselves have sent [ an inquiry ] to John and he has been a witness to the truth .
43005034	But I do not receive [ a mere ] human witness [ the evidence which I accept on My behalf is not from man ] ; but I simply mention all these things in order that you may be saved ( made and kept safe and sound ) .
43005035	John was the lamp that kept on burning and shining [ to show you the way ] , and you were willing for a while to delight ( sun ) yourselves in his light .
43005036	But I have as My witness something greater ( weightier , higher , better ) than that of John ; for the works that the Father has appointed Me to accomplish and finish , the very same works that I am now doing , are a witness and proof that the Father has sent Me .
43005037	And the Father Who sent Me has Himself testified concerning Me . Not one of you has ever given ear to His voice or seen His form ( His face -- what He is like ) . [ You have always been deaf to His voice and blind to the vision of Him . ]
43005038	And you have not His word ( His thought ) living in your hearts , because you do not believe and adhere to and trust in and rely on Him Whom He has sent . [ That is why you do not keep His message living in you , because you do not believe in the Messenger Whom He has sent . ]
43005039	You search and investigate and pore over the Scriptures diligently , because you suppose and trust that you have eternal life through them . And these [ very Scriptures ] testify about Me !
43005040	And still you are not willing [ but refuse ] to come to Me , so that you might have life .
43005041	I receive not glory from men [ I crave no human honor , I look for no mortal fame ] ,
43005042	But I know you and recognize and understand that you have not the love of God in you .
43005043	I have come in My Father’s name and with His power , and you do not receive Me [ your hearts are not open to Me , you give Me no welcome ] ; but if another comes in his own name and his own power and with no other authority but himself , you will receive him and give him your approval .
43005044	How is it possible for you to believe [ how can you learn to believe ] , you who [ are content to seek and ] receive praise and honor and glory from one another , and yet do not seek the praise and honor and glory which come from Him Who alone is God ?
43005045	Put out of your minds the thought and do not suppose [ as some of you are supposing ] that I will accuse you before the Father . There is one who accuses you -- it is Moses , the very one on whom you have built your hopes [ in whom you trust ] .
43005046	For if you believed and relied on Moses , you would believe and rely on Me , for he wrote about Me [ personally ] .
43005047	But if you do not believe and trust his writings , how then will you believe and trust My teachings ? [ How shall you cleave to and rely on My words ? ]
43006001	AFTER THIS , Jesus went to the farther side of the Sea of Galilee -- that is , the Sea of Tiberias .
43006002	And a great crowd was following Him because they had seen the signs ( miracles ) which He [ continually ] performed upon those who were sick .
43006003	And Jesus walked up the mountainside and sat down there with His disciples .
43006004	Now the Passover , the feast of the Jews , was approaching .
43006005	Jesus looked up then , and seeing that a vast multitude was coming toward Him , He said to Philip , Where are we to buy bread , so that all these people may eat ?
43006006	But He said this to prove ( test ) him , for He well knew what He was about to do .
43006007	Philip answered Him , Two hundred pennies’ ( forty dollars ) worth of bread is not enough that everyone may receive even a little .
43006008	Another of His disciples , Andrew , Simon Peter’s brother , said to Him ,
43006009	There is a little boy here , who has [ with him ] five barley loaves , and two small fish ; but what are they among so many people ?
43006010	Jesus said , Make all the people recline ( sit down ) . Now the ground ( a pasture ) was covered with thick grass at the spot , so the men threw themselves down , about 5,000 in number .
43006011	Jesus took the loaves , and when He had given thanks , He distributed to the disciples and the disciples to the reclining people ; so also [ He did ] with the fish , as much as they wanted .
43006012	When they had all had enough , He said to His disciples , Gather up now the fragments ( the broken pieces that are left over ) , so that nothing may be lost and wasted .
43006013	So accordingly they gathered them up , and they filled twelve [ small hand ] baskets with fragments left over by those who had eaten from the five barley loaves .
43006014	When the people saw the sign ( miracle ) that Jesus had performed , they began saying , Surely and beyond a doubt this is the Prophet Who is to come into the world !
43006015	Then Jesus , knowing that they meant to come and seize Him that they might make Him king , withdrew again to the hillside by Himself alone .
43006016	When evening came , His disciples went down to the sea ,
43006017	And they took a boat and were going across the sea to Capernaum . It was now dark , and still Jesus had not [ yet ] come back to them .
43006018	Meanwhile , the sea was getting rough and rising high because of a great and violent wind that was blowing .
43006019	[ However ] when they had rowed three or four miles , they saw Jesus walking on the sea and approaching the boat . And they were afraid ( terrified ) .
43006020	But Jesus said to them , It is I ; be not afraid ! [ I AM ; stop being frightened ! ]
43006021	Then they were quite willing and glad for Him to come into the boat . And now the boat went at once to the land they had steered toward . [ And immediately they reached the shore toward which they had been slowly making their way . ]
43006022	The next day the crowd [ that still remained ] standing on the other side of the sea realized that there had been only one small boat there , and that Jesus had not gone into it with His disciples , but that His disciples had gone away by themselves .
43006023	But now some other boats from Tiberias had come in near the place where they ate the bread after the Lord had given thanks .
43006024	So the people , finding that neither Jesus nor His disciples were there , themselves got into the small boats and came to Capernaum looking for Jesus .
43006025	And when they found Him on the other side of the lake , they said to Him , Rabbi ! When did You come here ?
43006026	Jesus answered them , I assure you , most solemnly I tell you , you have been searching for Me , not because you saw the miracles and signs but because you were fed with the loaves and were filled and satisfied .
43006027	Stop toiling and doing and producing for the food that perishes and decomposes [ in the using ] , but strive and work and produce rather for the [ lasting ] food which endures [ continually ] unto life eternal ; the Son of Man will give ( furnish ) you that , for God the Father has authorized and certified Him and put His seal of endorsement upon Him .
43006028	They then said , What are we to do , that we may [ habitually ] be working the works of God ? [ What are we to do to carry out what God requires ? ]
43006029	Jesus replied , This is the work ( service ) that God asks of you : that you believe in the One Whom He has sent [ that you cleave to , trust , rely on , and have faith in His Messenger ] .
43006030	Therefore they said to Him , What sign ( miracle , wonderwork ) will You perform then , so that we may see it and believe and rely on and adhere to You ? What [ supernatural ] work have You [ to show what You can do ] ?
43006031	Our forefathers ate the manna in the wilderness ; as the Scripture says , He gave them bread out of heaven to eat .
43006032	Jesus then said to them , I assure you , most solemnly I tell you , Moses did not give you the Bread from heaven [ what Moses gave you was not the Bread from heaven ] , but it is My Father Who gives you the true heavenly Bread .
43006033	For the Bread of God is He Who comes down out of heaven and gives life to the world .
43006034	Then they said to Him , Lord , give us this bread always ( all the time ) !
43006035	Jesus replied , I am the Bread of Life . He who comes to Me will never be hungry , and he who believes in and cleaves to and trusts in and relies on Me will never thirst any more ( at any time ) .
43006036	But [ as ] I told you , although you have seen Me , still you do not believe and trust and have faith .
43006037	All whom My Father gives ( entrusts ) to Me will come to Me ; and the one who comes to Me I will most certainly not cast out [ I will never , no never , reject one of them who comes to Me ] .
43006038	For I have come down from heaven not to do My own will and purpose but to do the will and purpose of Him Who sent Me .
43006039	And this is the will of Him Who sent Me , that I should not lose any of all that He has given Me , but that I should give new life and raise [ them all ] up at the last day .
43006040	For this is My Father’s will and His purpose , that everyone who sees the Son and believes in and cleaves to and trusts in and relies on Him should have eternal life , and I will raise him up [ from the dead ] at the last day .
43006041	Now the Jews murmured and found fault with and grumbled about Jesus because He said , I am [ Myself ] the Bread that came down from heaven .
43006042	They kept asking , Is not this Jesus , the Son of Joseph , Whose father and mother we know ? How then can He say , I have come down from heaven ?
43006043	So Jesus answered them , Stop grumbling and saying things against Me to one another .
43006044	No one is able to come to Me unless the Father Who sent Me attracts and draws him and gives him the desire to come to Me , and [ then ] I will raise him up [ from the dead ] at the last day .
43006045	It is written in [ the book of ] the Prophets , And they shall all be taught of God [ have Him in person for their Teacher ] . Everyone who has listened to and learned from the Father comes to Me --
43006046	Which does not imply that anyone has seen the Father [ not that anyone has ever seen Him ] except He [ Who was with the Father ] Who comes from God ; He [ alone ] has seen the Father .
43006047	I assure you , most solemnly I tell you , he who believes in Me [ who adheres to , trusts in , relies on , and has faith in Me ] has ( now possesses ) eternal life .
43006048	I am the Bread of Life [ that gives life -- the Living Bread ] .
43006049	Your forefathers ate the manna in the wilderness , and [ yet ] they died .
43006050	[ But ] this is the Bread that comes down from heaven , so that [ any ] one may eat of it and never die .
43006051	I [ Myself ] am this Living Bread that came down from heaven . If anyone eats of this Bread , he will live forever ; and also the Bread that I shall give for the life of the world is My flesh ( body ) .
43006052	Then the Jews angrily contended with one another , saying , How is He able to give us His flesh to eat ?
43006053	And Jesus said to them , I assure you , most solemnly I tell you , you cannot have any life in you unless you eat the flesh of the Son of Man and drink His blood [ unless you appropriate His life and the saving merit of His blood ] .
43006054	He who feeds on My flesh and drinks My blood has ( possesses now ) eternal life , and I will raise him up [ from the dead ] on the last day .
43006055	For My flesh is true and genuine food , and My blood is true and genuine drink .
43006056	He who feeds on My flesh and drinks My blood dwells continually in Me , and I [ in like manner dwell continually ] in him .
43006057	Just as the living Father sent Me and I live by ( through , because of ) the Father , even so whoever continues to feed on Me [ whoever takes Me for his food and is nourished by Me ] shall [ in his turn ] live through and because of Me .
43006058	This is the Bread that came down from heaven . It is not like the manna which our forefathers ate , and yet died ; he who takes this Bread for his food shall live forever .
43006059	He said these things in a synagogue while He was teaching at Capernaum .
43006060	When His disciples heard this , many of them said , This is a hard and difficult and strange saying ( an offensive and unbearable message ) . Who can stand to hear it ? [ Who can be expected to listen to such teaching ? ]
43006061	But Jesus , knowing within Himself that His disciples were complaining and protesting and grumbling about it , said to them : Is this a stumbling block and an offense to you ? [ Does this upset and displease and shock and scandalize you ? ]
43006062	What then [ will be your reaction ] if you should see the Son of Man ascending to [ the place ] where He was before ?
43006063	It is the Spirit Who gives life [ He is the Life-giver ] ; the flesh conveys no benefit whatever [ there is no profit in it ] . The words ( truths ) that I have been speaking to you are spirit and life .
43006064	But [ still ] some of you fail to believe and trust and have faith . For Jesus knew from the first who did not believe and had no faith and who would betray Him and be false to Him .
43006065	And He said , This is why I told you that no one can come to Me unless it is granted him [ unless he is enabled to do so ] by the Father .
43006066	After this , many of His disciples drew back ( returned to their old associations ) and no longer accompanied Him .
43006067	Jesus said to the Twelve , Will you also go away ? [ And do you too desire to leave Me ? ]
43006068	Simon Peter answered , Lord , to whom shall we go ? You have the words ( the message ) of eternal life .
43006069	And we have learned to believe and trust , and [ more ] we have come to know [ surely ] that You are the Holy One of God , the Christ ( the Anointed One ) , the Son of the living God .
43006070	Jesus answered them , Did I not choose you , the Twelve ? And [ yet ] one of you is a devil ( of the evil one and a false accuser ) .
43006071	He was speaking of Judas , the son of Simon Iscariot , for he was about to betray Him , [ although ] he was one of the Twelve .
43007001	AFTER THIS , Jesus went from place to place in Galilee , for He would not travel in Judea because the Jews were seeking to kill Him .
43007002	Now the Jewish Feast of Tabernacles was drawing near .
43007003	So His brothers said to Him , Leave here and go into Judea , so that Your disciples [ there ] may also see the works that You do . [ This is no place for You . ]
43007004	For no one does anything in secret when he wishes to be conspicuous and secure publicity . If You [ must ] do these things [ if You must act like this ] , show Yourself openly and make Yourself known to the world !
43007005	For [ even ] His brothers did not believe in or adhere to or trust in or rely on Him either .
43007006	Whereupon Jesus said to them , My time ( opportunity ) has not come yet ; but any time is suitable for you and your opportunity is ready any time [ is always here ] .
43007007	The world cannot [ be expected to ] hate you , but it does hate Me because I denounce it for its wicked works and reveal that its doings are evil .
43007008	Go to the Feast yourselves . I am not [ yet ] going up to the Festival , because My time is not ripe . [ My term is not yet completed ; it is not time for Me to go . ]
43007009	Having said these things to them , He stayed behind in Galilee .
43007010	But afterward , when His brothers had gone up to the Feast , He went up also , not publicly [ not with a caravan ] , but by Himself quietly and as if He did not wish to be observed .
43007011	Therefore the Jews kept looking for Him at the Feast and asking , Where can He be ? [ Where is that Fellow ? ]
43007012	And there was among the mass of the people much whispered discussion and hot disputing about Him . Some were saying , He is good ! [ He is a good Man ! ] Others said , No , He misleads and deceives the people [ gives them false ideas ] !
43007013	But no one dared speak out boldly about Him for fear of [ the leaders of ] the Jews .
43007014	When the Feast was already half over , Jesus went up into the temple [ court ] and began to teach .
43007015	The Jews were astonished . They said , How is it that this Man has learning [ is so versed in the sacred Scriptures and in theology ] when He has never studied ?
43007016	Jesus answered them by saying , My teaching is not My own , but His Who sent Me .
43007017	If any man desires to do His will ( God’s pleasure ) , he will know ( have the needed illumination to recognize , and can tell for himself ) whether the teaching is from God or whether I am speaking from Myself and of My own accord and on My own authority .
43007018	He who speaks on his own authority seeks to win honor for himself . [ He whose teaching originates with himself seeks his own glory . ] But He Who seeks the glory and is eager for the honor of Him Who sent Him , He is true ; and there is no unrighteousness or falsehood or deception in Him .
43007019	Did not Moses give you the Law ? And yet not one of you keeps the Law . [ If that is the truth ] why do you seek to kill Me [ for not keeping it ] ?
43007020	The crowd answered Him , You are possessed by a demon ! [ You are raving ! ] Who seeks to kill You ?
43007021	Jesus answered them , I did one work , and you all are astounded .
43007022	Now Moses established circumcision among you -- though it did not originate with Moses but with the previous patriarchs -- and you circumcise a person [ even ] on the Sabbath day .
43007023	If , to avoid breaking the Law of Moses , a person undergoes circumcision on the Sabbath day , have you any cause to be angry with ( indignant with , bitter against ) Me for making a man’s whole body well on the Sabbath ?
43007024	Be honest in your judgment and do not decide at a glance ( superficially and by appearances ) ; but judge fairly and righteously .
43007025	Then some of the Jerusalem people said , Is not this the Man they seek to kill ?
43007026	And here He is speaking openly , and they say nothing to Him ! Can it be possible that the rulers have discovered and know that this is truly the Christ ?
43007027	No , we know where this Man comes from ; when the Christ arrives , no one is to know from what place He comes .
43007028	Whereupon Jesus called out as He taught in the temple [ porches ] , Do you know Me , and do you know where I am from ? I have not come on My own authority and of My own accord and as self-appointed , but the One Who sent Me is true ( real , genuine , steadfast ) ; and Him you do not know !
43007029	I know Him [ Myself ] because I come from His [ very ] presence , and it was He [ personally ] Who sent Me .
43007030	Therefore they were eager to arrest Him , but no one laid a hand on Him , for His hour ( time ) had not yet come .
43007031	And besides , many of the multitude believed in Him [ adhered to Him , trusted in Him , relied on Him ] . And they kept saying , When the Christ comes , will He do [ can He be expected to do ] more miracles and produce more proofs and signs than what this Man has done ?
43007032	The Pharisees learned how the people were saying these things about Him under their breath ; and the chief priests and Pharisees sent attendants ( guards ) to arrest Him .
43007033	Therefore Jesus said , For a little while I am [ still ] with you , and then I go back to Him Who sent Me .
43007034	You will look for Me , but you will not [ be able to ] find Me ; where I am , you cannot come .
43007035	Then the Jews said among themselves , Where does this Man intend to go that we shall not find Him ? Will He go to the Jews who are scattered in the Dispersion among the Greeks , and teach the Greeks ?
43007036	What does this statement of His mean , You will look for Me and not be able to find Me , and , Where I am , you cannot come ?
43007037	Now on the final and most important day of the Feast , Jesus stood , and He cried in a loud voice , If any man is thirsty , let him come to Me and drink !
43007038	He who believes in Me [ who cleaves to and trusts in and relies on Me ] as the Scripture has said , From his innermost being shall flow [ continuously ] springs and rivers of living water .
43007039	But He was speaking here of the Spirit , Whom those who believed ( trusted , had faith ) in Him were afterward to receive . For the [ Holy ] Spirit had not yet been given , because Jesus was not yet glorified ( raised to honor ) .
43007040	Listening to those words , some of the multitude said , This is certainly and beyond doubt the Prophet !
43007041	Others said , This is the Christ ( the Messiah , Anointed One ) ! But some said , What ? Does the Christ come out of Galilee ?
43007042	Does not the Scripture tell us that the Christ will come from the offspring of David and from Bethlehem , the village where David lived ?
43007043	So there arose a division and dissension among the people concerning Him .
43007044	Some of them wanted to arrest Him , but no one [ ventured and ] laid hands on Him .
43007045	Meanwhile the attendants ( guards ) had gone back to the chief priests and Pharisees , who asked them , Why have you not brought Him here with you ?
43007046	The attendants replied , Never has a man talked as this Man talks ! [ No mere man has ever spoken as He speaks ! ]
43007047	The Pharisees said to them , Are you also deluded and led astray ? [ Are you also swept off your feet ? ]
43007048	Has any of the authorities or of the Pharisees believed in Him ?
43007049	As for this multitude ( rabble ) that does not know the Law , they are contemptible and doomed and accursed !
43007050	Then Nicodemus , who came to Jesus before at night and was one of them , asked ,
43007051	Does our Law convict a man without giving him a hearing and finding out what he has done ?
43007052	They answered him , Are you too from Galilee ? Search [ the Scriptures yourself ] , and you will see that no prophet comes ( will rise to prominence ) from Galilee .
43007053	And they went [ back ] , each to his own house .
43008001	BUT JESUS went to the Mount of Olives .
43008002	Early in the morning ( at dawn ) , He came back into the temple [ court ] , and the people came to Him in crowds . He sat down and was teaching them ,
43008003	When the scribes and Pharisees brought a woman who had been caught in adultery . They made her stand in the middle of the court and put the case before Him .
43008004	Teacher , they said , This woman has been caught in the very act of adultery .
43008005	Now Moses in the Law commanded us that such [ women -- offenders ] shall be stoned to death . But what do You say [ to do with her -- what is Your sentence ] ?
43008006	This they said to try ( test ) Him , hoping they might find a charge on which to accuse Him . But Jesus stooped down and wrote on the ground with His finger .
43008007	However , when they persisted with their question , He raised Himself up and said , Let him who is without sin among you be the first to throw a stone at her .
43008008	Then He bent down and went on writing on the ground with His finger .
43008009	They listened to Him , and then they began going out , conscience-stricken , one by one , from the oldest down to the last one of them , till Jesus was left alone , with the woman standing there before Him in the center of the court .
43008010	When Jesus raised Himself up , He said to her , Woman , where are your accusers ? Has no man condemned you ?
43008011	She answered , No one , Lord ! And Jesus said , I do not condemn you either . Go on your way and from now on sin no more .
