43008012	Once more Jesus addressed the crowd . He said , I am the Light of the world . He who follows Me will not be walking in the dark , but will have the Light which is Life .
43008013	Whereupon the Pharisees told Him , You are testifying on Your own behalf ; Your testimony is not valid and is worthless .
43008014	Jesus answered , Even if I do testify on My own behalf , My testimony is true and reliable and valid , for I know where I came from and where I am going ; but you do not know where I come from or where I am going .
43008015	You [ set yourselves up to ] judge according to the flesh ( by what you see ) . [ You condemn by external , human standards . ] I do not [ set Myself up to ] judge or condemn or sentence anyone .
43008016	Yet even if I do judge , My judgment is true [ My decision is right ] ; for I am not alone [ in making it ] , but [ there are two of Us ] I and the Father , Who sent Me .
43008017	In your [ own ] Law it is written that the testimony ( evidence ) of two persons is reliable and valid .
43008018	I am One [ of the Two ] bearing testimony concerning Myself ; and My Father , Who sent Me , He also testifies about Me .
43008019	Then they said to Him , Where is this Father of Yours ? Jesus answered , You know My Father as little as you know Me . If you knew Me , you would know My Father also .
43008020	Jesus said these things in the treasury while He was teaching in the temple [ court ] ; but no one ventured to arrest Him , because His hour had not yet come .
43008021	Therefore He said again to them , I am going away , and you will be looking for Me , and you will die in ( under the curse of ) your sin . Where I am going , it is not possible for you to come .
43008022	At this the Jews began to ask among themselves , Will He kill Himself ? Is that why He says , Where I am going , it is not possible for you to come ?
43008023	He said to them , You are from below ; I am from above . You are of this world ( of this earthly order ) ; I am not of this world .
43008024	That is why I told you that you will die in ( under the curse of ) your sins ; for if you do not believe that I am He [ Whom I claim to be -- if you do not adhere to , trust in , and rely on Me ] , you will die in your sins .
43008025	Then they said to Him , Who are You anyway ? Jesus replied , [ Why do I even speak to you ! ] I am exactly what I have been telling you from the first .
43008026	I have much to say about you and to judge and condemn . But He Who sent Me is true ( reliable ) , and I tell the world [ only ] the things that I have heard from Him .
43008027	They did not perceive ( know , understand ) that He was speaking to them about the Father .
43008028	So Jesus added , When you have lifted up the Son of Man [ on the cross ] , you will realize ( know , understand ) that I am He [ for Whom you look ] and that I do nothing of Myself ( of My own accord or on My own authority ) , but I say [ exactly ] what My Father has taught Me .
43008029	And He Who sent Me is ever with Me ; My Father has not left Me alone , for I always do what pleases Him .
43008030	As He said these things , many believed in Him [ trusted , relied on , and adhered to Him ] .
43008031	So Jesus said to those Jews who had believed in Him , If you abide in My word [ hold fast to My teachings and live in accordance with them ] , you are truly My disciples .
43008032	And you will know the Truth , and the Truth will set you free .
43008033	They answered Him , We are Abraham’s offspring ( descendants ) and have never been in bondage to anybody . What do You mean by saying , You will be set free ?
43008034	Jesus answered them , I assure you , most solemnly I tell you , Whoever commits and practices sin is the slave of sin .
43008035	Now a slave does not remain in a household permanently ( forever ) ; the son [ of the house ] does remain forever .
43008036	So if the Son liberates you [ makes you free men ] , then you are really and unquestionably free .
43008037	[ Yes ] I know that you are Abraham’s offspring ; yet you plan to kill Me , because My word has no entrance ( makes no progress , does not find any place ) in you .
43008038	I tell the things which I have seen and learned at My Father’s side , and your actions also reflect what you have heard and learned from your father .
43008039	They retorted , Abraham is our father . Jesus said , If you were [ truly ] Abraham’s children , then you would do the works of Abraham [ follow his example , do as Abraham did ] .
43008040	But now [ instead ] you are wanting and seeking to kill Me , a Man Who has told you the truth which I have heard from God . This is not the way Abraham acted .
43008041	You are doing the works of your [ own ] father . They said to Him , We are not illegitimate children and born out of fornication ; we have one Father , even God .
43008042	Jesus said to them , If God were your Father , you would love Me and respect Me and welcome Me gladly , for I proceeded ( came forth ) from God [ out of His very presence ] . I did not even come on My own authority or of My own accord ( as self-appointed ) ; but He sent Me .
43008043	Why do you misunderstand what I say ? It is because you are unable to hear what I am saying . [ You cannot bear to listen to My message ; your ears are shut to My teaching . ]
43008044	You are of your father , the devil , and it is your will to practice the lusts and gratify the desires [ which are characteristic ] of your father . He was a murderer from the beginning and does not stand in the truth , because there is no truth in him . When he speaks a falsehood , he speaks what is natural to him , for he is a liar [ himself ] and the father of lies and of all that is false .
43008045	But because I speak the truth , you do not believe Me [ do not trust Me , do not rely on Me , or adhere to Me ] .
43008046	Who of you convicts Me of wrongdoing or finds Me guilty of sin ? Then if I speak truth , why do you not believe Me [ trust Me , rely on , and adhere to Me ] ?
43008047	Whoever is of God listens to God . [ Those who belong to God hear the words of God . ] This is the reason that you do not listen [ to those words , to Me ] : because you do not belong to God and are not of God or in harmony with Him .
43008048	The Jews answered Him , Are we not right when we say You are a Samaritan and that You have a demon [ that You are under the power of an evil spirit ] ?
43008049	Jesus answered , I am not possessed by a demon . On the contrary , I honor and reverence My Father and you dishonor ( despise , vilify , and scorn ) Me .
43008050	However , I am not in search of honor for Myself . [ I do not seek and am not aiming for My own glory . ] There is One Who [ looks after that ; He ] seeks [ My glory ] , and He is the Judge .
43008051	I assure you , most solemnly I tell you , if anyone observes My teaching [ lives in accordance with My message , keeps My word ] , he will by no means ever see and experience death .
43008052	The Jews said to Him , Now we know that You are under the power of a demon ( insane ) . Abraham died , and also the prophets , yet You say , If a man keeps My word , he will never taste of death into all eternity .
43008053	Are You greater than our father Abraham ? He died , and all the prophets died ! Who do You make Yourself out to be ?
43008054	Jesus answered , If I were to glorify Myself ( magnify , praise , and honor Myself ) , I would have no real glory , for My glory would be nothing and worthless . [ My honor must come to Me from My Father . ] It is My Father Who glorifies Me [ Who extols Me , magnifies , and praises Me ] , of Whom you say that He is your God .
43008055	Yet you do not know Him or recognize Him and are not acquainted with Him , but I know Him . If I should say that I do not know Him , I would be a liar like you . But I know Him and keep His word [ obey His teachings , am faithful to His message ] .
43008056	Your forefather Abraham was extremely happy at the hope and prospect of seeing My day ( My incarnation ) ; and he did see it and was delighted .
43008057	Then the Jews said to Him , You are not yet fifty years old , and have You seen Abraham ?
43008058	Jesus replied , I assure you , most solemnly I tell you , before Abraham was born , I AM .
43008059	So they took up stones to throw at Him , but Jesus , by mixing with the crowd , concealed Himself and went out of the temple [ enclosure ] .
43009001	AS HE passed along , He noticed a man blind from his birth .
43009002	His disciples asked Him , Rabbi , who sinned , this man or his parents , that he should be born blind ?
43009003	Jesus answered , It was not that this man or his parents sinned , but he was born blind in order that the workings of God should be manifested ( displayed and illustrated ) in him .
43009004	We must work the works of Him Who sent Me and be busy with His business while it is daylight ; night is coming on , when no man can work .
43009005	As long as I am in the world , I am the world’s Light .
43009006	When He had said this , He spat on the ground and made clay ( mud ) with His saliva , and He spread it [ as ointment ] on the man’s eyes .
43009007	And He said to him , Go , wash in the Pool of Siloam -- which means Sent . So he went and washed , and came back seeing .
43009008	When the neighbors and those who used to know him by sight as a beggar saw him , they said , Is not this the man who used to sit and beg ?
43009009	Some said , It is he . Others said , No , but he looks very much like him . But he said , Yes , I am the man .
43009010	So they said to him , How were your eyes opened ?
43009011	He replied , The Man called Jesus made mud and smeared it on my eyes and said to me , Go to Siloam and wash . So I went and washed , and I obtained my sight !
43009012	They asked him , Where is He ? He said , I do not know .
43009013	Then they conducted to the Pharisees the man who had formerly been blind .
43009014	Now it was on the Sabbath day that Jesus mixed the mud and opened the man’s eyes .
43009015	So now again the Pharisees asked him how he received his sight . And he said to them , He smeared mud on my eyes , and I washed , and now I see .
43009016	Then some of the Pharisees said , This Man [ Jesus ] is not from God , because He does not observe the Sabbath . But others said , How can a man who is a sinner ( a bad man ) do such signs and miracles ? So there was a difference of opinion among them .
43009017	Accordingly they said to the blind man again , What do you say about Him , seeing that He opened your eyes ? And he said , He is [ He must be ] a prophet !
43009018	However , the Jews did not believe that he had [ really ] been blind and that he had received his sight until they called ( summoned ) the parents of the man .
43009019	They asked them , Is this your son , whom you reported as having been born blind ? How then does he see now ?
43009020	His parents answered , We know that this is our son , and that he was born blind .
43009021	But as to how he can now see , we do not know ; or who has opened his eyes , we do not know . He is of age . Ask him ; let him speak for himself and give his own account of it .
43009022	His parents said this because they feared [ the leaders of ] the Jews ; for the Jews had already agreed that if anyone should acknowledge Jesus to be the Christ , he should be expelled and excluded from the synagogue .
43009023	On that account his parents said , He is of age ; ask him .
43009024	So the second time they summoned the man who had been born blind , and said to him , Now give God the glory ( praise ) . This Fellow we know is only a sinner ( a wicked person ) .
43009025	Then he answered , I do not know whether He is a sinner and wicked or not . But one thing I do know , that whereas I was blind before , now I see .
43009026	So they said to him , What did He [ actually ] do to you ? How did He open your eyes ?
43009027	He answered , I already told you and you would not listen . Why do you want to hear it again ? Can it be that you wish to become His disciples also ?
43009028	And they stormed at him [ they jeered , they sneered , they reviled him ] and retorted , You are His disciple yourself , but we are the disciples of Moses .
43009029	We know for certain that God spoke with Moses , but as for this Fellow , we know nothing about where He hails from .
43009030	The man replied , Well , this is astonishing ! Here a Man has opened my eyes , and yet you do not know where He comes from . [ That is amazing ! ]
43009031	We know that God does not listen to sinners ; but if anyone is God-fearing and a worshiper of Him and does His will , He listens to him .
43009032	Since the beginning of time it has never been heard that anyone opened the eyes of a man born blind .
43009033	If this Man were not from God , He would not be able to do anything like this .
43009034	They retorted , You were wholly born in sin [ from head to foot ] ; and do you [ presume to ] teach us ? So they cast him out [ threw him clear outside the synagogue ] .
43009035	Jesus heard that they had put him out , and meeting him He said , Do you believe in and adhere to the Son of Man or the Son of God ?
43009036	He answered , Who is He , Sir ? Tell me , that I may believe in and adhere to Him .
43009037	Jesus said to him , You have seen Him ; [ in fact ] He is talking to you right now .
43009038	He called out , Lord , I believe ! [ I rely on , I trust , I cleave to You ! ] And he worshiped Him .
43009039	Then Jesus said , I came into this world for judgment [ as a Separator , in order that there may be separation between those who believe on Me and those who reject Me ] , to make the sightless see and to make those who see become blind .
43009040	Some Pharisees who were near , hearing this remark , said to Him , Are we also blind ?
43009041	Jesus said to them , If you were blind , you would have no sin ; but because you now claim to have sight , your sin remains . [ If you were blind , you would not be guilty of sin ; but because you insist , We do see clearly , you are unable to escape your guilt . ]
43010001	I ASSURE you , most solemnly I tell you , he who does not enter by the door into the sheepfold , but climbs up some other way ( elsewhere , from some other quarter ) is a thief and a robber .
43010002	But he who enters by the door is the shepherd of the sheep .
43010003	The watchman opens the door for this man , and the sheep listen to his voice and heed it ; and he calls his own sheep by name and brings ( leads ) them out .
43010004	When he has brought his own sheep outside , he walks on before them , and the sheep follow him because they know his voice .
43010005	They will never [ on any account ] follow a stranger , but will run away from him because they do not know the voice of strangers or recognize their call .
43010006	Jesus used this parable ( illustration ) with them , but they did not understand what He was talking about .
43010007	So Jesus said again , I assure you , most solemnly I tell you , that I Myself am the Door for the sheep .
43010008	All others who came [ as such ] before Me are thieves and robbers , but the [ true ] sheep did not listen to and obey them .
43010009	I am the Door ; anyone who enters in through Me will be saved ( will live ) . He will come in and he will go out [ freely ] , and will find pasture .
43010010	The thief comes only in order to steal and kill and destroy . I came that they may have and enjoy life , and have it in abundance ( to the full , till it overflows ) .
43010011	I am the Good Shepherd . The Good Shepherd risks and lays down His [ own ] life for the sheep .
43010012	But the hired servant ( he who merely serves for wages ) who is neither the shepherd nor the owner of the sheep , when he sees the wolf coming , deserts the flock and runs away . And the wolf chases and snatches them and scatters [ the flock ] .
43010013	Now the hireling flees because he merely serves for wages and is not himself concerned about the sheep [ cares nothing for them ] .
43010014	I am the Good Shepherd ; and I know and recognize My own , and My own know and recognize Me --
43010015	Even as [ truly as ] the Father knows Me and I also know the Father -- and I am giving My [ very own ] life and laying it down on behalf of the sheep .
43010016	And I have other sheep [ beside these ] that are not of this fold . I must bring and impel those also ; and they will listen to My voice and heed My call , and so there will be [ they will become ] one flock under one Shepherd .
43010017	For this [ reason ] the Father loves Me , because I lay down My [ own ] life -- to take it back again .
43010018	No one takes it away from Me . On the contrary , I lay it down voluntarily . [ I put it from Myself . ] I am authorized and have power to lay it down ( to resign it ) and I am authorized and have power to take it back again . These are the instructions ( orders ) which I have received [ as My charge ] from My Father .
43010019	Then a fresh division of opinion arose among the Jews because of His saying these things .
43010020	And many of them said , He has a demon and He is mad ( insane -- He raves , He rambles ) . Why do you listen to Him ?
43010021	Others argued , These are not the thoughts and the language of one possessed . Can a demon-possessed person open blind eyes ?
43010022	After this the Feast of Dedication [ of the reconsecration of the temple ] was taking place at Jerusalem . It was winter ,
43010023	And Jesus was walking in Solomon’s Porch in the temple area .
43010024	So the Jews surrounded Him and began asking Him , How long are You going to keep us in doubt and suspense ? If You are really the Christ ( the Messiah ) , tell us so plainly and openly .
43010025	Jesus answered them , I have told you so , yet you do not believe Me [ you do not trust Me and rely on Me ] . The very works that I do by the power of My Father and in My Father’s name bear witness concerning Me [ they are My credentials and evidence in support of Me ] .
43010026	But you do not believe and trust and rely on Me because you do not belong to My fold [ you are no sheep of Mine ] .
43010027	The sheep that are My own hear and are listening to My voice ; and I know them , and they follow Me .
43010028	And I give them eternal life , and they shall never lose it or perish throughout the ages . [ To all eternity they shall never by any means be destroyed . ] And no one is able to snatch them out of My hand .
43010029	My Father , Who has given them to Me , is greater and mightier than all [ else ] ; and no one is able to snatch [ them ] out of the Father’s hand .
43010030	I and the Father are One .
43010031	Again the Jews brought up stones to stone Him .
43010032	Jesus said to them , My Father has enabled Me to do many good deeds . [ I have shown many acts of mercy in your presence . ] For which of these do you mean to stone Me ?
43010033	The Jews replied , We are not going to stone You for a good act , but for blasphemy , because You , a mere Man , make Yourself [ out to be ] God .
43010034	Jesus answered , Is it not written in your Law , I said , You are gods ?
43010035	So men are called gods [ by the Law ] , men to whom God’s message came -- and the Scripture cannot be set aside or cancelled or broken or annulled --
43010036	[ If that is true ] do you say of the One Whom the Father consecrated and dedicated and set apart for Himself and sent into the world , You are blaspheming , because I said , I am the Son of God ?
43010037	If I am not doing the works [ performing the deeds ] of My Father , then do not believe Me [ do not adhere to Me and trust Me and rely on Me ] .
43010038	But if I do them , even though you do not believe Me or have faith in Me , [ at least ] believe the works and have faith in what I do , in order that you may know and understand [ clearly ] that the Father is in Me , and I am in the Father [ One with Him ] .
43010039	They sought again to arrest Him , but He escaped from their hands .
43010040	He went back again across the Jordan to the locality where John was when he first baptized , and there He remained .
43010041	And many came to Him , and they kept saying , John did not perform a [ single ] sign or miracle , but everything John said about this Man was true .
43010042	And many [ people ] there became believers in Him . [ They adhered to and trusted in and relied on Him . ]
43011001	NOW A certain man named Lazarus was ill . He was of Bethany , the village where Mary and her sister Martha lived .
43011002	This Mary was the one who anointed the Lord with perfume and wiped His feet with her hair . It was her brother Lazarus who was [ now ] sick .
43011003	So the sisters sent to Him , saying , Lord , he whom You love [ so well ] is sick .
43011004	When Jesus received the message , He said , This sickness is not to end in death ; but [ on the contrary ] it is to honor God and to promote His glory , that the Son of God may be glorified through ( by ) it .
43011005	Now Jesus loved Martha and her sister and Lazarus . [ They were His dear friends , and He held them in loving esteem . ]
43011006	Therefore [ even ] when He heard that Lazarus was sick , He still stayed two days longer in the same place where He was .
43011007	Then after that interval He said to His disciples , Let us go back again to Judea .
43011008	The disciples said to Him , Rabbi , the Jews only recently were intending and trying to stone You , and are You [ thinking of ] going back there again ?
43011009	Jesus answered , Are there not twelve hours in the day ? Anyone who walks about in the daytime does not stumble , because he sees [ by ] the light of this world .
43011010	But if anyone walks about in the night , he does stumble , because there is no light in him [ the light is lacking to him ] .
43011011	He said these things , and then added , Our friend Lazarus is at rest and sleeping ; but I am going there that I may awaken him out of his sleep .
43011012	The disciples answered , Lord , if he is sleeping , he will recover .
43011013	However , Jesus had spoken of his death , but they thought that He referred to falling into a refreshing and natural sleep .
43011014	So then Jesus told them plainly , Lazarus is dead ,
43011015	And for your sake I am glad that I was not there ; it will help you to believe ( to trust and rely on Me ) . However , let us go to him .
43011016	Then Thomas , who was called the Twin , said to his fellow disciples , Let us go too , that we may die [ be killed ] along with Him .
43011017	So when Jesus arrived , He found that he [ Lazarus ] had already been in the tomb four days .
43011018	Bethany was near Jerusalem , only about two miles away ,
43011019	And a considerable number of the Jews had gone out to see Martha and Mary to console them concerning their brother .
43011020	When Martha heard that Jesus was coming , she went to meet Him , while Mary remained sitting in the house .
43011021	Martha then said to Jesus , Master , if You had been here , my brother would not have died .
43011022	And even now I know that whatever You ask from God , He will grant it to You .
43011023	Jesus said to her , Your brother shall rise again .
43011024	Martha replied , I know that he will rise again in the resurrection at the last day .
43011025	Jesus said to her , I am [ Myself ] the Resurrection and the Life . Whoever believes in ( adheres to , trusts in , and relies on ) Me , although he may die , yet he shall live ;
43011026	And whoever continues to live and believes in ( has faith in , cleaves to , and relies on ) Me shall never [ actually ] die at all . Do you believe this ?
43011027	She said to Him , Yes , Lord , I have believed [ I do believe ] that You are the Christ ( the Messiah , the Anointed One ) , the Son of God , [ even He ] Who was to come into the world . [ It is for Your coming that the world has waited . ]
43011028	After she had said this , she went back and called her sister Mary , privately whispering to her , The Teacher is close at hand and is asking for you .
43011029	When she heard this , she sprang up quickly and went to Him .
43011030	Now Jesus had not yet entered the village , but was still at the same spot where Martha had met Him .
43011031	When the Jews who were sitting with her in the house and consoling her saw how hastily Mary had arisen and gone out , they followed her , supposing that she was going to the tomb to pour out her grief there .
43011032	When Mary came to the place where Jesus was and saw Him , she dropped down at His feet , saying to Him , Lord , if You had been here , my brother would not have died .
43011033	When Jesus saw her sobbing , and the Jews who came with her [ also ] sobbing , He was deeply moved in spirit and troubled . [ He chafed in spirit and sighed and was disturbed . ]
43011034	And He said , Where have you laid him ? They said to Him , Lord , come and see .
43011035	Jesus wept .
43011036	The Jews said , See how [ tenderly ] He loved him !
43011037	But some of them said , Could not He Who opened a blind man’s eyes have prevented this man from dying ?
43011038	Now Jesus , again sighing repeatedly and deeply disquieted , approached the tomb . It was a cave ( a hole in the rock ) , and a boulder lay against [ the entrance to close ] it .
43011039	Jesus said , Take away the stone . Martha , the sister of the dead man , exclaimed , But Lord , by this time he [ is decaying and ] throws off an offensive odor , for he has been dead four days !
43011040	Jesus said to her , Did I not tell you and promise you that if you would believe and rely on Me , you would see the glory of God ?
43011041	So they took away the stone . And Jesus lifted up His eyes and said , Father , I thank You that You have heard Me .
43011042	Yes , I know You always hear and listen to Me , but I have said this on account of and for the benefit of the people standing around , so that they may believe that You did send Me [ that You have made Me Your Messenger ] .
43011043	When He had said this , He shouted with a loud voice , Lazarus , come out !
43011044	And out walked the man who had been dead , his hands and feet wrapped in burial cloths ( linen strips ) , and with a [ burial ] napkin bound around his face . Jesus said to them , Free him of the burial wrappings and let him go .
43011045	Upon seeing what Jesus had done , many of the Jews who had come with Mary believed in Him . [ They trusted in Him and adhered to Him and relied on Him . ]
43011046	But some of them went back to the Pharisees and told them what Jesus had done .
43011047	So the chief priests and Pharisees called a meeting of the council ( the Sanhedrin ) and said , What are we to do ? For this Man performs many signs ( evidences , miracles ) .
43011048	If we let Him alone to go on like this , everyone will believe in Him and adhere to Him , and the Romans will come and suppress and destroy and take away our [ holy ] place and our nation [ our temple and city and our civil organization ] .
43011049	But one of them , Caiaphas , who was the high priest that year , declared , You know nothing at all !
43011050	Nor do you understand or reason out that it is expedient and better for your own welfare that one man should die on behalf of the people than that the whole nation should perish ( be destroyed , ruined ) .
43011051	Now he did not say this simply of his own accord [ he was not self-moved ] ; but being the high priest that year , he prophesied that Jesus was to die for the nation ,
43011052	And not only for the nation but also for the purpose of uniting into one body the children of God who have been scattered far and wide .
43011053	So from that day on they took counsel and plotted together how they might put Him to death .
43011054	For that reason Jesus no longer appeared publicly among the Jews , but left there and retired to the district that borders on the wilderness ( the desert ) , to a village called Ephraim , and there He stayed with the disciples .
43011055	Now the Jewish Passover was at hand , and many from the country went up to Jerusalem in order that they might purify and consecrate themselves before the Passover .
43011056	So they kept looking for Jesus and questioned among themselves as they were standing about in the temple [ area ] , What do you think ? Will He not come to the Feast at all ?
43011057	Now the chief priests and Pharisees had given orders that if anyone knew where He was , he should report it to them , so that they might arrest Him .
43012001	SO SIX days before the Passover Feast , Jesus came to Bethany , where Lazarus was , who had died and whom He had raised from the dead .
43012002	So they made Him a supper ; and Martha served , but Lazarus was one of those at the table with Him .
43012003	Mary took a pound of ointment of pure liquid nard [ a rare perfume ] that was very expensive , and she poured it on Jesus’ feet and wiped them with her hair . And the whole house was filled with the fragrance of the perfume .
43012004	But Judas Iscariot , the one of His disciples who was about to betray Him , said ,
43012005	Why was this perfume not sold for 300 denarii [ a year’s wages for an ordinary workman ] and that [ money ] given to the poor ( the destitute ) ?
43012006	Now he did not say this because he cared for the poor but because he was a thief ; and having the bag ( the money box , the purse of the Twelve ) , he took for himself what was put into it [ pilfering the collections ] .
43012007	But Jesus said , Let her alone . It was [ intended ] that she should keep it for the time of My preparation for burial . [ She has kept it that she might have it for the time of My embalming . ]
43012008	You always have the poor with you , but you do not always have Me .
43012009	Now a great crowd of the Jews heard that He was at Bethany , and they came there , not only because of Jesus but that they also might see Lazarus , whom He had raised from the dead .
43012010	So the chief priests planned to put Lazarus to death also ,
43012011	Because on account of him many of the Jews were going away [ were withdrawing from and leaving the Judeans ] and believing in and adhering to Jesus .
43012012	The next day a vast crowd of those who had come to the Passover Feast heard that Jesus was coming to Jerusalem .
43012013	So they took branches of palm trees and went out to meet Him . And as they went , they kept shouting , Hosanna ! Blessed is He and praise to Him Who comes in the name of the Lord , even the King of Israel !
43012014	And Jesus , having found a young donkey , rode upon it , [ just ] as it is written in the Scriptures ,
43012015	Do not fear , O Daughter of Zion ! Look ! Your King is coming , sitting on a donkey’s colt !
43012016	His disciples did not understand and could not comprehend the meaning of these things at first ; but when Jesus was glorified and exalted , they remembered that these things had been written about Him and had been done to Him .
43012017	The group that had been with Jesus when He called Lazarus out of the tomb and raised him from among the dead kept telling it [ bearing witness ] to others .
43012018	It was for this reason that the crowd went out to meet Him , because they had heard that He had performed this sign ( proof , miracle ) .
43012019	Then the Pharisees said among themselves , You see how futile your efforts are and how you accomplish nothing . See ! The whole world is running after Him !
43012020	Now among those who went up to worship at the Feast were some Greeks .
43012021	These came to Philip , who was from Bethsaida in Galilee , and they made this request , Sir , we desire to see Jesus .
43012022	Philip came and told Andrew ; then Andrew and Philip together [ went ] and told Jesus .
43012023	And Jesus answered them , The time has come for the Son of Man to be glorified and exalted .
43012024	I assure you , most solemnly I tell you , Unless a grain of wheat falls into the earth and dies , it remains [ just one grain ; it never becomes more but lives ] by itself alone . But if it dies , it produces many others and yields a rich harvest .
43012025	Anyone who loves his life loses it , but anyone who hates his life in this world will keep it to life eternal . [ Whoever has no love for , no concern for , no regard for his life here on earth , but despises it , preserves his life forever and ever . ]
43012026	If anyone serves Me , he must continue to follow Me [ to cleave steadfastly to Me , conform wholly to My example in living and , if need be , in dying ] and wherever I am , there will My servant be also . If anyone serves Me , the Father will honor him .
43012027	Now My soul is troubled and distressed , and what shall I say ? Father , save Me from this hour [ of trial and agony ] ? But it was for this very purpose that I have come to this hour [ that I might undergo it ] .
43012028	[ Rather , I will say , ] Father , glorify ( honor and extol ) Your [ own ] name ! Then there came a voice out of heaven saying , I have already glorified it , and I will glorify it again .
43012029	The crowd of bystanders heard the sound and said that it had thundered ; others said , An angel has spoken to Him !
43012030	Jesus answered , This voice has not come for My sake , but for your sake .
43012031	Now the judgment ( crisis ) of this world is coming on [ sentence is now being passed on this world ] . Now the ruler ( evil genius , prince ) of this world shall be cast out ( expelled ) .
43012032	And I , if and when I am lifted up from the earth [ on the cross ] , will draw and attract all men [ Gentiles as well as Jews ] to Myself .
43012033	He said this to signify in what manner He would die .
43012034	At this the people answered Him , We have learned from the Law that the Christ is to remain forever ; how then can You say , The Son of Man must be lifted up [ on the cross ] ? Who is this Son of Man ?
43012035	So Jesus said to them , You will have the Light only a little while longer . Walk while you have the Light [ keep on living by it ] , so that darkness may not overtake and overcome you . He who walks about in the dark does not know where he goes [ he is drifting ] .
43012036	While you have the Light , believe in the Light [ have faith in it , hold to it , rely on it ] , that you may become sons of the Light and be filled with Light . Jesus said these things , and then He went away and hid Himself from them [ was lost to their view ] .
43012037	Even though He had done so many miracles before them ( right before their eyes ) , yet they still did not trust in Him and failed to believe in Him --
43012038	So that what Isaiah the prophet said was fulfilled : Lord , who has believed our report and our message ? And to whom has the arm ( the power ) of the Lord been shown ( unveiled and revealed ) ?
43012039	Therefore they could not believe [ they were unable to believe ] . For Isaiah has also said ,
43012040	He has blinded their eyes and hardened and benumbed their [ callous , degenerated ] hearts [ He has made their minds dull ] , to keep them from seeing with their eyes and understanding with their hearts and minds and repenting and turning to Me to heal them .
43012041	Isaiah said this because he saw His glory and spoke of Him .
43012042	And yet [ in spite of all this ] many even of the leading men ( the authorities and the nobles ) believed and trusted in Him . But because of the Pharisees they did not confess it , for fear that [ if they should acknowledge Him ] they would be expelled from the synagogue ;
43012043	For they loved the approval and the praise and the glory that come from men [ instead of and ] more than the glory that comes from God . [ They valued their credit with men more than their credit with God . ]
43012044	But Jesus loudly declared , The one who believes in Me does not [ only ] believe in and trust in and rely on Me , but [ in believing in Me he believes ] in Him Who sent Me .
43012045	And whoever sees Me sees Him Who sent Me .
43012046	I have come as a Light into the world , so that whoever believes in Me [ whoever cleaves to and trusts in and relies on Me ] may not continue to live in darkness .
43012047	If anyone hears My teachings and fails to observe them [ does not keep them , but disregards them ] , it is not I who judges him . For I have not come to judge and to condemn and to pass sentence and to inflict penalty on the world , but to save the world .
43012048	Anyone who rejects Me and persistently sets Me at naught , refusing to accept My teachings , has his judge [ however ] ; for the [ very ] message that I have spoken will itself judge and convict him at the last day .
43012049	This is because I have never spoken on My own authority or of My own accord or as self-appointed , but the Father Who sent Me has Himself given Me orders [ concerning ] what to say and what to tell .
43012050	And I know that His commandment is ( means ) eternal life . So whatever I speak , I am saying [ exactly ] what My Father has told Me to say and in accordance with His instructions .
43013001	[ NOW ] BEFORE the Passover Feast began , Jesus knew ( was fully aware ) that the time had come for Him to leave this world and return to the Father . And as He had loved those who were His own in the world , He loved them to the last and to the highest degree .
43013002	So [ it was ] during supper , Satan having already put the thought of betraying Jesus in the heart of Judas Iscariot , Simon’s son ,
43013003	[ That ] Jesus , knowing ( fully aware ) that the Father had put everything into His hands , and that He had come from God and was [ now ] returning to God ,
43013004	Got up from supper , took off His garments , and taking a [ servant’s ] towel , He fastened it around His waist .
43013005	Then He poured water into the washbasin and began to wash the disciples’ feet and to wipe them with the [ servant’s ] towel with which He was girded .
43013006	When He came to Simon Peter , [ Peter ] said to Him , Lord , are my feet to be washed by You ? [ Is it for You to wash my feet ? ]
43013007	Jesus said to him , You do not understand now what I am doing , but you will understand later on .
43013008	Peter said to Him , You shall never wash my feet ! Jesus answered him , Unless I wash you , you have no part with ( in ) Me [ you have no share in companionship with Me ] .
43013009	Simon Peter said to Him , Lord , [ wash ] not only my feet , but my hands and my head too !
43013010	Jesus said to him , Anyone who has bathed needs only to wash his feet , but is clean all over . And you [ My disciples ] are clean , but not all of you .
43013011	For He knew who was going to betray Him ; that was the reason He said , Not all of you are clean .
43013012	So when He had finished washing their feet and had put on His garments and had sat down again , He said to them , Do you understand what I have done to you ?
43013013	You call Me the Teacher ( Master ) and the Lord , and you are right in doing so , for that is what I am .
43013014	If I then , your Lord and Teacher ( Master ) , have washed your feet , you ought [ it is your duty , you are under obligation , you owe it ] to wash one another’s feet .
43013015	For I have given you this as an example , so that you should do [ in your turn ] what I have done to you .
43013016	I assure you , most solemnly I tell you , A servant is not greater than his master , and no one who is sent is superior to the one who sent him .
43013017	If you know these things , blessed and happy and to be envied are you if you practice them [ if you act accordingly and really do them ] .
43013018	I am not speaking of and I do not mean all of you . I know whom I have chosen ; but it is that the Scripture may be fulfilled , He who eats My bread with Me has raised up his heel against Me .
43013019	I tell you this now before it occurs , so that when it does take place you may be persuaded and believe that I am He [ Who I say I am -- the Christ , the Anointed One , the Messiah ] .
43013020	I assure you , most solemnly I tell you , he who receives and welcomes and takes into his heart any messenger of Mine receives Me [ in just that way ] ; and he who receives and welcomes and takes Me into his heart receives Him Who sent Me [ in that same way ] .
43013021	After Jesus had said these things , He was troubled ( disturbed , agitated ) in spirit and said , I assure you , most solemnly I tell you , one of you will deliver Me up [ one of you will be false to Me and betray Me ] !
43013022	The disciples kept looking at one another , puzzled as to whom He could mean .
43013023	One of His disciples , whom Jesus loved [ whom He esteemed and delighted in ] , was reclining [ next to Him ] on Jesus’ bosom .
43013024	So Simon Peter motioned to him to ask of whom He was speaking .
43013025	Then leaning back against Jesus’ breast , he asked Him , Lord , who is it ?
43013026	Jesus answered , It is the one to whom I am going to give this morsel ( bit ) of food after I have dipped it . So when He had dipped the morsel of bread [ into the dish ] , He gave it to Judas , Simon Iscariot’s son .
43013027	Then after [ he had taken ] the bit of food , Satan entered into and took possession of [ Judas ] . Jesus said to him , What you are going to do , do more swiftly than you seem to intend and make quick work of it .
43013028	But nobody reclining at the table knew why He spoke to him or what He meant by telling him this .
43013029	Some thought that , since Judas had the money box ( the purse ) , Jesus was telling him , Buy what we need for the Festival , or that he should give something to the poor .
43013030	So after receiving the bit of bread , he went out immediately . And it was night .
43013031	When he had left , Jesus said , Now is the Son of Man glorified ! [ Now He has achieved His glory , His honor , His exaltation ! ] And God has been glorified through and in Him .
43013032	And if God is glorified through and in Him , God will also glorify Him in Himself , and He will glorify Him at once and not delay .
43013033	[ Dear ] little children , I am to be with you only a little longer . You will look for Me and , as I told the Jews , so I tell you now : you are not able to come where I am going .
43013034	I give you a new commandment : that you should love one another . Just as I have loved you , so you too should love one another .
43013035	By this shall all [ men ] know that you are My disciples , if you love one another [ if you keep on showing love among yourselves ] .
43013036	Simon Peter said to Him , Lord , where are You going ? Jesus answered , You are not able to follow Me now where I am going , but you shall follow Me afterwards .
43013037	Peter said to Him , Lord , why cannot I follow You now ? I will lay down my life for You .
43013038	Jesus answered , Will you [ really ] lay down your life for Me ? I assure you , most solemnly I tell you , before a rooster crows , you will deny Me [ completely disown Me ] three times .
43014001	DO NOT let your hearts be troubled ( distressed , agitated ) . You believe in and adhere to and trust in and rely on God ; believe in and adhere to and trust in and rely also on Me .
43014002	In My Father’s house there are many dwelling places ( homes ) . If it were not so , I would have told you ; for I am going away to prepare a place for you .
43014003	And when ( if ) I go and make ready a place for you , I will come back again and will take you to Myself , that where I am you may be also .
43014004	And [ to the place ] where I am going , you know the way .
43014005	Thomas said to Him , Lord , we do not know where You are going , so how can we know the way ?
43014006	Jesus said to him , I am the Way and the Truth and the Life ; no one comes to the Father except by ( through ) Me .
43014007	If you had known Me [ had learned to recognize Me ] , you would also have known My Father . From now on , you know Him and have seen Him .
43014008	Philip said to Him , Lord , show us the Father [ cause us to see the Father -- that is all we ask ] ; then we shall be satisfied .
43014009	Jesus replied , Have I been with all of you for so long a time , and do you not recognize and know Me yet , Philip ? Anyone who has seen Me has seen the Father . How can you say then , Show us the Father ?
43014010	Do you not believe that I am in the Father , and that the Father is in Me ? What I am telling you I do not say on My own authority and of My own accord ; but the Father Who lives continually in Me does the ( His ) works ( His own miracles , deeds of power ) .
43014011	Believe Me that I am in the Father and the Father in Me ; or else believe Me for the sake of the [ very ] works themselves . [ If you cannot trust Me , at least let these works that I do in My Father’s name convince you . ]
43014012	I assure you , most solemnly I tell you , if anyone steadfastly believes in Me , he will himself be able to do the things that I do ; and he will do even greater things than these , because I go to the Father .
43014013	And I will do [ I Myself will grant ] whatever you ask in My Name [ as presenting all that I AM ] , so that the Father may be glorified and extolled in ( through ) the Son .
43014014	[ Yes ] I will grant [ I Myself will do for you ] whatever you shall ask in My Name [ as presenting all that I AM ] .
43014015	If you [ really ] love Me , you will keep ( obey ) My commands .
43014016	And I will ask the Father , and He will give you another Comforter ( Counselor , Helper , Intercessor , Advocate , Strengthener , and Standby ) , that He may remain with you forever --
43014017	The Spirit of Truth , Whom the world cannot receive ( welcome , take to its heart ) , because it does not see Him or know and recognize Him . But you know and recognize Him , for He lives with you [ constantly ] and will be in you .
43014018	I will not leave you as orphans [ comfortless , desolate , bereaved , forlorn , helpless ] ; I will come [ back ] to you .
43014019	Just a little while now , and the world will not see Me any more , but you will see Me ; because I live , you will live also .
43014020	At that time [ when that day comes ] you will know [ for yourselves ] that I am in My Father , and you [ are ] in Me , and I [ am ] in you .
43014021	The person who has My commands and keeps them is the one who [ really ] loves Me ; and whoever [ really ] loves Me will be loved by My Father , and I [ too ] will love him and will show ( reveal , manifest ) Myself to him . [ I will let Myself be clearly seen by him and make Myself real to him . ]
43014022	Judas , not Iscariot , asked Him , Lord , how is it that You will reveal Yourself [ make Yourself real ] to us and not to the world ?
43014023	Jesus answered , If a person [ really ] loves Me , he will keep My word [ obey My teaching ] ; and My Father will love him , and We will come to him and make Our home ( abode , special dwelling place ) with him .
43014024	Anyone who does not [ really ] love Me does not observe and obey My teaching . And the teaching which you hear and heed is not Mine , but [ comes ] from the Father Who sent Me .
43014025	I have told you these things while I am still with you .
43014026	But the Comforter ( Counselor , Helper , Intercessor , Advocate , Strengthener , Standby ) , the Holy Spirit , Whom the Father will send in My name [ in My place , to represent Me and act on My behalf ] , He will teach you all things . And He will cause you to recall ( will remind you of , bring to your remembrance ) everything I have told you .
43014027	Peace I leave with you ; My [ own ] peace I now give and bequeath to you . Not as the world gives do I give to you . Do not let your hearts be troubled , neither let them be afraid . [ Stop allowing yourselves to be agitated and disturbed ; and do not permit yourselves to be fearful and intimidated and cowardly and unsettled . ]
43014028	You heard Me tell you , I am going away and I am coming [ back ] to you . If you [ really ] loved Me , you would have been glad , because I am going to the Father ; for the Father is greater and mightier than I am .
43014029	And now I have told you [ this ] before it occurs , so that when it does take place you may believe and have faith in and rely on Me .
43014030	I will not talk with you much more , for the prince ( evil genius , ruler ) of the world is coming . And he has no claim on Me . [ He has nothing in common with Me ; there is nothing in Me that belongs to him , and he has no power over Me . ]
43014031	But [ Satan is coming and ] I do as the Father has commanded Me , so that the world may know ( be convinced ) that I love the Father and that I do only what the Father has instructed Me to do . [ I act in full agreement with His orders . ] Rise , let us go away from here .
43015001	I AM the True Vine , and My Father is the Vinedresser .
43015002	Any branch in Me that does not bear fruit [ that stops bearing ] He cuts away ( trims off , takes away ) ; and He cleanses and repeatedly prunes every branch that continues to bear fruit , to make it bear more and richer and more excellent fruit .
43015003	You are cleansed and pruned already , because of the word which I have given you [ the teachings I have discussed with you ] .
43015004	Dwell in Me , and I will dwell in you . [ Live in Me , and I will live in you . ] Just as no branch can bear fruit of itself without abiding in ( being vitally united to ) the vine , neither can you bear fruit unless you abide in Me .
43015005	I am the Vine ; you are the branches . Whoever lives in Me and I in him bears much ( abundant ) fruit . However , apart from Me [ cut off from vital union with Me ] you can do nothing .
43015006	If a person does not dwell in Me , he is thrown out like a [ broken-off ] branch , and withers ; such branches are gathered up and thrown into the fire , and they are burned .
43015007	If you live in Me [ abide vitally united to Me ] and My words remain in you and continue to live in your hearts , ask whatever you will , and it shall be done for you .
43015008	When you bear ( produce ) much fruit , My Father is honored and glorified , and you show and prove yourselves to be true followers of Mine .
43015009	I have loved you , [ just ] as the Father has loved Me ; abide in My love [ continue in His love with Me ] .
43015010	If you keep My commandments [ if you continue to obey My instructions ] , you will abide in My love and live on in it , just as I have obeyed My Father’s commandments and live on in His love .
43015011	I have told you these things , that My joy and delight may be in you , and that your joy and gladness may be of full measure and complete and overflowing .
43015012	This is My commandment : that you love one another [ just ] as I have loved you .
43015013	No one has greater love [ no one has shown stronger affection ] than to lay down ( give up ) his own life for his friends .
43015014	You are My friends if you keep on doing the things which I command you to do .
43015015	I do not call you servants ( slaves ) any longer , for the servant does not know what his master is doing ( working out ) . But I have called you My friends , because I have made known to you everything that I have heard from My Father . [ I have revealed to you everything that I have learned from Him . ]
43015016	You have not chosen Me , but I have chosen you and I have appointed you [ I have planted you ] , that you might go and bear fruit and keep on bearing , and that your fruit may be lasting [ that it may remain , abide ] , so that whatever you ask the Father in My Name [ as presenting all that I AM ] , He may give it to you .
43015017	This is what I command you : that you love one another .
43015018	If the world hates you , know that it hated Me before it hated you .
43015019	If you belonged to the world , the world would treat you with affection and would love you as its own . But because you are not of the world [ no longer one with it ] , but I have chosen ( selected ) you out of the world , the world hates ( detests ) you .
43015020	Remember that I told you , A servant is not greater than his master [ is not superior to him ] . If they persecuted Me , they will also persecute you ; if they kept My word and obeyed My teachings , they will also keep and obey yours .
43015021	But they will do all this to you [ inflict all this suffering on you ] because of [ your bearing ] My name and on My account , for they do not know or understand the One Who sent Me .
43015022	If I had not come and spoken to them , they would not be guilty of sin [ would be blameless ] ; but now they have no excuse for their sin .
43015023	Whoever hates Me also hates My Father .
43015024	If I had not done ( accomplished ) among them the works which no one else ever did , they would not be guilty of sin . But [ the fact is ] now they have both seen [ these works ] and have hated both Me and My Father .
43015025	But [ this is so ] that the word written in their Law might be fulfilled , They hated Me without a cause .
43015026	But when the Comforter ( Counselor , Helper , Advocate , Intercessor , Strengthener , Standby ) comes , Whom I will send to you from the Father , the Spirit of Truth Who comes ( proceeds ) from the Father , He [ Himself ] will testify regarding Me .
43015027	But you also will testify and be My witnesses , because you have been with Me from the beginning .
43016001	I HAVE told you all these things , so that you should not be offended ( taken unawares and falter , or be caused to stumble and fall away ) . [ I told you to keep you from being scandalized and repelled . ]
43016002	They will put you out of ( expel you from ) the synagogues ; but an hour is coming when whoever kills you will think and claim that he has offered service to God .
43016003	And they will do this because they have not known the Father or Me .
43016004	But I have told you these things now , so that when they occur you will remember that I told you of them . I did not say these things to you from the beginning , because I was with you .
43016005	But now I am going to Him Who sent Me , yet none of you asks Me , Where are You going ?
43016006	But because I have said these things to you , sorrow has filled your hearts [ taken complete possession of them ] .
43016007	However , I am telling you nothing but the truth when I say it is profitable ( good , expedient , advantageous ) for you that I go away . Because if I do not go away , the Comforter ( Counselor , Helper , Advocate , Intercessor , Strengthener , Standby ) will not come to you [ into close fellowship with you ] ; but if I go away , I will send Him to you [ to be in close fellowship with you ] .
43016008	And when He comes , He will convict and convince the world and bring demonstration to it about sin and about righteousness ( uprightness of heart and right standing with God ) and about judgment :
43016009	About sin , because they do not believe in Me [ trust in , rely on , and adhere to Me ] ;
43016010	About righteousness ( uprightness of heart and right standing with God ) , because I go to My Father , and you will see Me no longer ;
43016011	About judgment , because the ruler ( evil genius , prince ) of this world [ Satan ] is judged and condemned and sentence already is passed upon him .
43016012	I have still many things to say to you , but you are not able to bear them or to take them upon you or to grasp them now .
43016013	But when He , the Spirit of Truth ( the Truth-giving Spirit ) comes , He will guide you into all the Truth ( the whole , full Truth ) . For He will not speak His own message [ on His own authority ] ; but He will tell whatever He hears [ from the Father ; He will give the message that has been given to Him ] , and He will announce and declare to you the things that are to come [ that will happen in the future ] .
43016014	He will honor and glorify Me , because He will take of ( receive , draw upon ) what is Mine and will reveal ( declare , disclose , transmit ) it to you .
43016015	Everything that the Father has is Mine . That is what I meant when I said that He [ the Spirit ] will take the things that are Mine and will reveal ( declare , disclose , transmit ) it to you .
43016016	In a little while you will no longer see Me , and again after a short while you will see Me .
43016017	So some of His disciples questioned among themselves , What does He mean when He tells us , In a little while you will no longer see Me , and again after a short while you will see Me , and , Because I go to My Father ?
43016018	What does He mean by a little while ? We do not know or understand what He is talking about .
43016019	Jesus knew that they wanted to ask Him , so He said to them , Are you wondering and inquiring among yourselves what I meant when I said , In a little while you will no longer see Me , and again after a short while you will see Me ?
43016020	I assure you , most solemnly I tell you , that you shall weep and grieve , but the world will rejoice . You will be sorrowful , but your sorrow will be turned into joy .
43016021	A woman , when she gives birth to a child , has grief ( anguish , agony ) because her time has come . But when she has delivered the child , she no longer remembers her pain ( trouble , anguish ) because she is so glad that a man ( a child , a human being ) has been born into the world .
43016022	So for the present you are also in sorrow ( in distress and depressed ) ; but I will see you again and [ then ] your hearts will rejoice , and no one can take from you your joy ( gladness , delight ) .
43016023	And when that time comes , you will ask nothing of Me [ you will need to ask Me no questions ] . I assure you , most solemnly I tell you , that My Father will grant you whatever you ask in My Name [ as presenting all that I AM ] .
43016024	Up to this time you have not asked a [ single ] thing in My Name [ as presenting all that I AM ] ; but now ask and keep on asking and you will receive , so that your joy ( gladness , delight ) may be full and complete .
43016025	I have told you these things in parables ( veiled language , allegories , dark sayings ) ; the hour is now coming when I shall no longer speak to you in figures of speech , but I shall tell you about the Father in plain words and openly ( without reserve ) .
43016026	At that time you will ask ( pray ) in My Name ; and I am not saying that I will ask the Father on your behalf [ for it will be unnecessary ] .
43016027	For the Father Himself [ tenderly ] loves you because you have loved Me and have believed that I came out from the Father .
43016028	I came out from the Father and have come into the world ; again , I am leaving the world and going to the Father .
43016029	His disciples said , Ah , now You are speaking plainly to us and not in parables ( veiled language and figures of speech ) !
43016030	Now we know that You are acquainted with everything and have no need to be asked questions . Because of this we believe that you [ really ] came from God .
43016031	Jesus answered them , Do you now believe ? [ Do you believe it at last ? ]
43016032	But take notice , the hour is coming , and it has arrived , when you will all be dispersed and scattered , every man to his own home , leaving Me alone . Yet I am not alone , because the Father is with Me .
43016033	I have told you these things , so that in Me you may have [ perfect ] peace and confidence . In the world you have tribulation and trials and distress and frustration ; but be of good cheer [ take courage ; be confident , certain , undaunted ] ! For I have overcome the world . [ I have deprived it of power to harm you and have conquered it for you . ]
43017001	WHEN JESUS had spoken these things , He lifted up His eyes to heaven and said , Father , the hour has come . Glorify and exalt and honor and magnify Your Son , so that Your Son may glorify and extol and honor and magnify You .
43017002	[ Just as ] You have granted Him power and authority over all flesh ( all humankind ) , [ now glorify Him ] so that He may give eternal life to all whom You have given Him .
43017003	And this is eternal life : [ it means ] to know ( to perceive , recognize , become acquainted with , and understand ) You , the only true and real God , and [ likewise ] to know Him , Jesus [ as the ] Christ ( the Anointed One , the Messiah ) , Whom You have sent .
43017004	I have glorified You down here on the earth by completing the work that You gave Me to do .
43017005	And now , Father , glorify Me along with Yourself and restore Me to such majesty and honor in Your presence as I had with You before the world existed .
43017006	I have manifested Your Name [ I have revealed Your very Self , Your real Self ] to the people whom You have given Me out of the world . They were Yours , and You gave them to Me , and they have obeyed and kept Your word .
43017007	Now [ at last ] they know and understand that all You have given Me belongs to You [ is really and truly Yours ] .
43017008	For the [ uttered ] words that You gave Me I have given them ; and they have received and accepted [ them ] and have come to know positively and in reality [ to believe with absolute assurance ] that I came forth from Your presence , and they have believed and are convinced that You did send Me .
43017009	I am praying for them . I am not praying ( requesting ) for the world , but for those You have given Me , for they belong to You .
43017010	All [ things that are ] Mine are Yours , and all [ things that are ] Yours belong to Me ; and I am glorified in ( through ) them . [ They have done Me honor ; in them My glory is achieved . ]
43017011	And [ now ] I am no more in the world , but these are [ still ] in the world , and I am coming to You . Holy Father , keep in Your Name [ in the knowledge of Yourself ] those whom You have given Me , that they may be one as We [ are one ] .
43017012	While I was with them , I kept and preserved them in Your Name [ in the knowledge and worship of You ] . Those You have given Me I guarded and protected , and not one of them has perished or is lost except the son of perdition [ Judas Iscariot -- the one who is now doomed to destruction , destined to be lost ] , that the Scripture might be fulfilled .
43017013	And now I am coming to You ; I say these things while I am still in the world , so that My joy may be made full and complete and perfect in them [ that they may experience My delight fulfilled in them , that My enjoyment may be perfected in their own souls , that they may have My gladness within them , filling their hearts ] .
43017014	I have given and delivered to them Your word ( message ) and the world has hated them , because they are not of the world [ do not belong to the world ] , just as I am not of the world .
43017015	I do not ask that You will take them out of the world , but that You will keep and protect them from the evil one .
43017016	They are not of the world ( worldly , belonging to the world ) , [ just ] as I am not of the world .
43017017	Sanctify them [ purify , consecrate , separate them for Yourself , make them holy ] by the Truth ; Your Word is Truth .
43017018	Just as You sent Me into the world , I also have sent them into the world .
43017019	And so for their sake and on their behalf I sanctify ( dedicate , consecrate ) Myself , that they also may be sanctified ( dedicated , consecrated , made holy ) in the Truth .
43017020	Neither for these alone do I pray [ it is not for their sake only that I make this request ] , but also for all those who will ever come to believe in ( trust in , cling to , rely on ) Me through their word and teaching ,
43017021	That they all may be one , [ just ] as You , Father , are in Me and I in You , that they also may be one in Us , so that the world may believe and be convinced that You have sent Me .
43017022	I have given to them the glory and honor which You have given Me , that they may be one [ even ] as We are one :
43017023	I in them and You in Me , in order that they may become one and perfectly united , that the world may know and [ definitely ] recognize that You sent Me and that You have loved them [ even ] as You have loved Me .
43017024	Father , I desire that they also whom You have entrusted to Me [ as Your gift to Me ] may be with Me where I am , so that they may see My glory , which You have given Me [ Your love gift to Me ] ; for You loved Me before the foundation of the world .
43017025	O just and righteous Father , although the world has not known You and has failed to recognize You and has never acknowledged You , I have known You [ continually ] ; and these men understand and know that You have sent Me .
43017026	I have made Your Name known to them and revealed Your character and Your very Self , and I will continue to make [ You ] known , that the love which You have bestowed upon Me may be in them [ felt in their hearts ] and that I [ Myself ] may be in them .
43018001	HAVING SAID these things , Jesus went out with His disciples beyond ( across ) the winter torrent of the Kidron [ in the ravine ] . There was a garden there , which He and His disciples entered .
43018002	And Judas , who was betraying Him and delivering Him up , also knew the place , because Jesus had often retired there with His disciples .
43018003	So Judas , obtaining and taking charge of the band of soldiers and some guards ( attendants ) of the high priests and Pharisees , came there with lanterns and torches and weapons .
43018004	Then Jesus , knowing all that was about to befall Him , went out to them and said , Whom are you seeking ? [ Whom do you want ? ]
43018005	They answered Him , Jesus the Nazarene . Jesus said to them , I am He . Judas , who was betraying Him , was also standing with them .
43018006	When Jesus said to them , I am He , they went backwards ( drew back , lurched backward ) and fell to the ground .
43018007	Then again He asked them , Whom are you seeking ? And they said , Jesus the Nazarene .
43018008	Jesus answered , I told you that I am He . So , if you want Me [ if it is only I for Whom you are looking ] , let these men go their way .
43018009	Thus what He had said was fulfilled and verified , Of those whom You have given Me , I have not lost even one .
43018010	Then Simon Peter , who had a sword , drew it and struck the high priest’s servant and cut off his right ear . The servant’s name was Malchus .
43018011	Therefore , Jesus said to Peter , Put the sword [ back ] into the sheath ! The cup which My Father has given Me , shall I not drink it ?
43018012	So the troops and their captain and the guards ( attendants ) of the Jews seized Jesus and bound Him ,
43018013	And they brought Him first to Annas , for he was the father-in-law of Caiaphas , who was the high priest that year .
43018014	It was Caiaphas who had counseled the Jews that it was expedient and for their welfare that one man should die for ( instead of , in behalf of ) the people .
43018015	Now Simon Peter and another disciple were following Jesus . And that disciple was known to the high priest , and so he entered along with Jesus into the court of the palace of the high priest ;
43018016	But Peter was standing outside at the door . So the other disciple , who was known to the high priest , went out and spoke to the maid who kept the door and brought Peter inside .
43018017	Then the maid who was in charge at the door said to Peter , You are not also one of the disciples of this Man , are you ? He said , I am not !
43018018	Now the servants and the guards ( the attendants ) had made a fire of coals , for it was cold , and they were standing and warming themselves . And Peter was with them , standing and warming himself .
43018019	Then the high priest questioned Jesus about His disciples and about His teaching .
43018020	Jesus answered him , I have spoken openly to the world . I have always taught in a synagogue and in the temple [ area ] , where the Jews [ habitually ] congregate ( assemble ) ; and I have spoken nothing secretly .
43018021	Why do you ask Me ? Ask those who have heard [ Me ] what I said to them . See ! They know what I said .
43018022	But when He said this , one of the attendants who stood by struck Jesus , saying , Is that how You answer the high priest ?
43018023	Jesus replied , If I have said anything wrong [ if I have spoken abusively , if there was evil in what I said ] tell what was wrong with it . But if I spoke rightly and properly , why do you strike Me ?
43018024	Then Annas sent Him bound to Caiaphas the high priest .
43018025	But Simon Peter [ still ] was standing and was warming himself . They said to him , You are not also one of His disciples , are you ? He denied it and said , I am not !
43018026	One of the high priest’s servants , a relative of the man whose ear Peter cut off , said , Did I not see you in the garden with Him ?
43018027	And again Peter denied it . And immediately a rooster crowed .
43018028	Then they brought Jesus from Caiaphas into the Praetorium ( judgment hall , governor’s palace ) . And it was early . They themselves did not enter the Praetorium , that they might not be defiled ( become ceremonially unclean ) , but might be fit to eat the Passover [ supper ] .
43018029	So Pilate went out to them and said , What accusation do you bring against this Man ?
43018030	They retorted , If He were not an evildoer ( criminal ) , we would not have handed Him over to you .
43018031	Pilate said to them , Take Him yourselves and judge and sentence and punish Him according to your [ own ] law . The Jews answered , It is not lawful for us to put anyone to death .
43018032	This was to fulfill the word which Jesus had spoken to show ( indicate , predict ) by what manner of death He was to die .
43018033	So Pilate went back again into the judgment hall and called Jesus and asked Him , Are You the King of the Jews ?
43018034	Jesus replied , Are you saying this of yourself [ on your own initiative ] , or have others told you about Me ?
43018035	Pilate answered , Am I a Jew ? Your [ own ] people and nation and their chief priests have delivered You to me . What have You done ?
43018036	Jesus answered , My kingdom ( kingship , royal power ) belongs not to this world . If My kingdom were of this world , My followers would have been fighting to keep Me from being handed over to the Jews . But as it is , My kingdom is not from here ( this world ) ; [ it has no such origin or source ] .
43018037	Pilate said to Him , Then You are a King ? Jesus answered , You say it ! [ You speak correctly ! ] For I am a King . [ Certainly I am a King ! ] This is why I was born , and for this I have come into the world , to bear witness to the Truth . Everyone who is of the Truth [ who is a friend of the Truth , who belongs to the Truth ] hears and listens to My voice .
43018038	Pilate said to Him , What is Truth ? On saying this he went out to the Jews again and told them , I find no fault in Him .
43018039	But it is your custom that I release one [ prisoner ] for you at the Passover . So shall I release for you the King of the Jews ?
43018040	Then they all shouted back again , Not Him [ not this Man ] , but Barabbas ! Now Barabbas was a robber .
43019001	SO THEN Pilate took Jesus and scourged ( flogged , whipped ) Him .
43019002	And the soldiers , having twisted together a crown of thorns , put it on His head , and threw a purple cloak around Him .
43019003	And they kept coming to Him and saying , Hail , King of the Jews ! [ Good health to you ! Peace to you ! Long life to you , King of the Jews ! ] And they struck Him with the palms of their hands .
43019004	Then Pilate went out again and said to them , See , I bring Him out to you , so that you may know that I find no fault ( crime , cause for accusation ) in Him .
43019005	So Jesus came out wearing the thorny crown and purple cloak , and Pilate said to them , See , [ here is ] the Man !
43019006	When the chief priests and attendants ( guards ) saw Him , they cried out , Crucify Him ! Crucify Him ! Pilate said to them , Take Him yourselves and crucify Him , for I find no fault ( crime ) in Him .
43019007	The Jews answered him , We have a law , and according to that law He should die , because He has claimed and made Himself out to be the Son of God .
43019008	So , when Pilate heard this said , he was more alarmed and awestricken and afraid than before .
43019009	He went into the judgment hall again and said to Jesus , Where are You from ? [ To what world do You belong ? ] But Jesus did not answer him .
43019010	So Pilate said to Him , Will You not speak [ even ] to me ? Do You not know that I have power ( authority ) to release You and I have power to crucify You ?
43019011	Jesus answered , You would not have any power or authority whatsoever against ( over ) Me if it were not given you from above . For this reason the sin and guilt of the one who delivered Me over to you is greater .
43019012	Upon this , Pilate wanted ( sought , was anxious ) to release Him , but the Jews kept shrieking , If you release this Man , you are no friend of Caesar ! Anybody who makes himself [ out to be ] a king sets himself up against Caesar [ is a rebel against the emperor ] !
43019013	Hearing this , Pilate brought Jesus out and sat down on the judgment seat at a place called the Pavement [ the Mosaic Pavement , the Stone Platform ] -- in Hebrew , Gabbatha .
43019014	Now it was the day of Preparation for the Passover , and it was about the sixth hour ( about twelve o’clock noon ) . He said to the Jews , See , [ here is ] your King !
43019015	But they shouted , Away with Him ! Away with Him ! Crucify Him ! Pilate said to them , Crucify your King ? The chief priests answered , We have no king but Caesar !
43019016	Then he delivered Him over to them to be crucified .
43019017	And they took Jesus and led [ Him ] away ; so He went out , bearing His own cross , to the spot called The Place of the Skull -- in Hebrew it is called Golgotha .
43019018	There they crucified Him , and with Him two others -- one on either side and Jesus between them .
43019019	And Pilate also wrote a title ( an inscription on a placard ) and put it on the cross . And the writing was : Jesus the Nazarene , the King of the Jews .
43019020	And many of the Jews read this title , for the place where Jesus was crucified was near the city , and it was written in Hebrew , in Latin , [ and ] in Greek .
43019021	Then the chief priests of the Jews said to Pilate , Do not write , The King of the Jews , but , He said , I am King of the Jews .
43019022	Pilate replied , What I have written , I have written .
43019023	Then the soldiers , when they had crucified Jesus , took His garments and made four parts , one share for each soldier , and also the tunic ( the long shirtlike undergarment ) . But the tunic was seamless , woven [ in one piece ] from the top throughout .
43019024	So they said to one another , Let us not tear it , but let us cast lots to decide whose it shall be . This was to fulfill the Scripture , They parted My garments among them , and for My clothing they cast lots . So the soldiers did these things .
43019025	But by the cross of Jesus stood His mother , His mother’s sister , Mary the [ wife ] of Clopas , and Mary Magdalene .
43019026	So Jesus , seeing His mother there , and the disciple whom He loved standing near , said to His mother , [ Dear ] woman , See , [ here is ] your son !
43019027	Then He said to the disciple , See , [ here is ] your mother ! And from that hour , the disciple took her into his own [ keeping , own home ] .
43019028	After this , Jesus , knowing that all was now finished ( ended ) , said in fulfillment of the Scripture , I thirst .
43019029	A vessel ( jar ) full of sour wine ( vinegar ) was placed there , so they put a sponge soaked in the sour wine on [ a stalk , reed of ] hyssop , and held it to [ His ] mouth .
43019030	When Jesus had received the sour wine , He said , It is finished ! And He bowed His head and gave up His spirit .
43019031	Since it was the day of Preparation , in order to prevent the bodies from hanging on the cross on the Sabbath -- for that Sabbath was a very solemn and important one -- the Jews requested Pilate to have the legs broken and the bodies taken away .
43019032	So the soldiers came and broke the legs of the first one , and of the other who had been crucified with Him .
43019033	But when they came to Jesus and they saw that He was already dead , they did not break His legs .
43019034	But one of the soldiers pierced His side with a spear , and immediately blood and water came ( flowed ) out .
43019035	And he who saw it ( the eyewitness ) gives this evidence , and his testimony is true ; and he knows that he tells the truth , that you may believe also .
43019036	For these things took place , that the Scripture might be fulfilled ( verified , carried out ) , Not one of His bones shall be broken ;
43019037	And again another Scripture says , They shall look on Him Whom they have pierced .
43019038	And after this , Joseph of Arimathea -- a disciple of Jesus , but secretly for fear of the Jews -- asked Pilate to let him take away the body of Jesus . And Pilate granted him permission . So he came and took away His body .
43019039	And Nicodemus also , who first had come to Jesus by night , came bringing a mixture of myrrh and aloes , [ weighing ] about a hundred pounds .
43019040	So they took Jesus’ body and bound it in linen cloths with the spices ( aromatics ) , as is the Jews’ customary way to prepare for burial .
43019041	Now there was a garden in the place where He was crucified , and in the garden a new tomb , in which no one had ever [ yet ] been laid .
43019042	So there , because of the Jewish day of Preparation [ and ] since the tomb was near by , they laid Jesus .
43020001	NOW ON the first day of the week , Mary Magdalene came to the tomb early , while it was still dark , and saw that the stone had been removed from ( lifted out of the groove across the entrance of ) the tomb .
43020002	So she ran and went to Simon Peter and the other disciple , whom Jesus [ tenderly ] loved , and said to them , They have taken away the Lord out of the tomb , and we do not know where they have laid Him !
43020003	Upon this , Peter and the other disciple came out and they went toward the tomb .
43020004	And they came running together , but the other disciple outran Peter and arrived at the tomb first .
43020005	And stooping down , he saw the linen cloths lying there , but he did not enter .
43020006	Then Simon Peter came up , following him , and went into the tomb and saw the linen cloths lying there ;
43020007	But the burial napkin ( kerchief ) which had been around Jesus’ head , was not lying with the other linen cloths , but was [ still ] rolled up ( wrapped round and round ) in a place by itself .
43020008	Then the other disciple , who had reached the tomb first , went in too ; and he saw and was convinced and believed .
43020009	For as yet they did not know ( understand ) the statement of Scripture that He must rise again from the dead .
43020010	Then the disciples went back again to their homes ( lodging places ) .
43020011	But Mary remained standing outside the tomb sobbing . As she wept , she stooped down [ and looked ] into the tomb .
43020012	And she saw two angels in white sitting there , one at the head and one at the feet , where the body of Jesus had lain .
43020013	And they said to her , Woman , why are you sobbing ? She told them , Because they have taken away my Lord , and I do not know where they have laid Him .
43020014	On saying this , she turned around and saw Jesus standing [ there ] , but she did not know ( recognize ) that it was Jesus .
